Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	"Thus begins the words of Albucasis."
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	"Oh, sons, since I have fulfilled for you this book, which is the last of the science of medicine, to complete it and its consequences, and by its explanations and declarations, it seems to me that I accomplish that for you with this treatise, which deals with the operation by hand, that is surgery."
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the operation by hand is greatly hindered in our region and time, so that few know its science, and its traces are almost lost; indeed, there remain only a few descriptions of it in the books of the Ancients, which have been obscured over time, their meanings changed, and they have fallen into error and obscurity, such that their intentions are hidden and their strength is weakened."
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	"And it seems to me that I revive this with the ordering of this treatise according to the way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and also adding illustrations of the shapes of the instruments for cauterization and other tools necessary for the work, and preparing them, which is necessary."
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	"For the reason why there are not many good practitioners of this craft in our time is because the art of medicine requires that its practitioner be skilled in anatomy beforehand, knowing the arrangement of limbs and their forms, connections and separations; and having knowledge of bones, nerves and ligaments – their number and function; also of the pulsating veins and quiet ones, and the places where they discharge."
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	"And therefore said Hippocrates with his name, but in practice little, and especially in the art of surgery."
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	"But we have already said at the beginning of this book that whoever does not know what we have said about anatomy will surely fall into error and cause many deaths of men, as I have seen too often."
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	"For I saw a foolish and inexperienced surgeon open an escrofulous swelling on the neck of a woman, and cut some arteries in the neck so that much blood flowed out, causing the woman to die immediately."
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	"And I saw another surgeon who took it upon himself to remove a stone from the bladder of a man who had fallen into that state, and the stone was large; he came near him and removed that stone with a piece of the bladder, so that the man died on the third day."
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	"And I had already foreseen that outcome and saw that because of the size of the stone and the condition of the patient's illness, he would surely die."
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	"And I saw another surgeon who was paid a fee of one ducat by our lord to perform surgery, and he undertook the case of a black man who had a fracture of his thighbone; preparing himself with great ignorance, he reduced the fracture without leaving any space, with pillows and stones under strong pressure, and did not allow space for respiration."
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	"Then he bound him up according to his desires, then released him and let him lie down again for some days, commanding that they release the bandage; and so it happened that the thighbone became inflamed and putrefied, and he came to destruction."
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	"And I was called to him, and prepared to remove the bandage; but as soon as it was removed, calmness returned, and his pain ceased immediately."
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	"But nevertheless the corruption was already confirmed in the limb, so that I could not prevent it, and the corruption did not cease to wander throughout the limb until the patient perished."
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	"And I saw another surgeon who perforated a cancerous swelling, and it became ulcerated in a few days, so that the evil was increased by its lord."
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	"The reason for this is because the cancerous ulcer is full of melancholic humor, therefore it should not be cauterized with iron on all sides, but only on the part that suffers from inflammation."
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	"And therefore, children, it is necessary for you that the operation with the hand be divided into two parts: on the one hand is the operation associated with health, and on the other hand is the work where there is danger in the greatest dispositions."
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	"And I have already spoken about this throughout the whole of this book where operation is associated with error and fear; therefore it is necessary for you to keep this in mind and leave that alone, so that foolish men may not find an opportunity to speak and dishonor you."
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	"Therefore take up your arms with diligence and protection from God, and treat your illnesses with skillfulness and firmness."
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	"And use the best way through the grace of God to obtain health and praiseworthy success, leave behind terrible illnesses of difficult healing, show your arms against what makes you fearful, so that steadfastness in your faith and in your name does not desert you: for greater is remaining in your glory, and then in the world and finally in your sanctity."
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	"Since I have already spoken in some of my books:"
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"No medical illness, so that bad doctors are not appointed."
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	"And I have already divided this book according to three chapters."
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	"Here begins the division of the book, first of the first part."
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	"The first chapter ordered concerning the head, in the forms of instruments and irons for cauterization, and what is necessary in the operation."
La divisio de la segonda partida.	"Here begins the second part."
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	"The second chapter concerning cautery and perforation, and cupping glasses, compresses, and extraction of arrows and similar things, all ordered according to the forms of instruments."
Divisio de la tersa partida.	"Here begins the third part."
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	"The third chapter concerning reduction and dislocation, and the cure of torticollis and similar things; this chapter is ordered according to the head, in the forms of instruments."
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	"Concerning cauterization with fire and with sharp medicine, and remembrance of the operation."
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	"And with this begins the treatise of the entire book."
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	"It is necessary for me to speak about the qualities of those caustics and their effects, and in what complexion cautery is prohibited."
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	"Therefore I say that the discussion about the quality of cautery and its effects is long and prolix, subtle in science, and secretly hidden; many wise men have already spoken about it, and they disagree among themselves, but for me it suffices to touch upon some of their discussions briefly, fearing prolivity."
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	"And therefore I say that cautery agrees with every universal complexion, whether it has matter or not, except for two complexions, which are dry without matter."
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	"In the case of a dry and hot complexion that is out of balance; some say that cautery is beneficial for this, while others say the opposite, that cautery is not suitable for an illness that is due to heat and dryness, as fire itself is hot and dry, and it is inappropriate to use something hot and dry to treat a condition that is already hot and dry."
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	"And he who says the opposite, that cautery is beneficial in all hot and dry illnesses that occur in men's bodies, argues that when you compare the body of man and its humidity to the nature of fire, you find them alike."
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	"And I say, based on what that person says, that I have already experienced this many times."
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	"But it is not necessary for me to repeat what has already been said and practiced in the chapter on cautery through recent exercises, having learned about the diversity of men's complexions and the disposition of illnesses in their bodies, as well as their causes, accidents, and duration."
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	"But in other complexions, there is less fear for you, especially in hot and humid illnesses, because all physicians agree on these matters and are not disagreed on the use of cautery in them."
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	"And know, son, that the secret of cure by cautery with fire and its benefit is about cautery in medicine that burns, because fire is simple, whose action only extends to the member being cauterized, and it does not extend to another adjacent member except with some damage."
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	"But the action of burning medicine extends to those who are near it and often causes difficult-to-heal illnesses in nearby members."
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	"But fire, due to its sublimity and good substance, only serves to superfluously remove excesses. And we are already familiar with this through experimentation and the length of our service studying this art, which reveals the truth of these causes. Therefore, I am excused from speaking at length on this topic. But if it were not forbidden to me by law in this passage to reveal this secret about fire, and its qualities and operation within bodies and its expulsion of illnesses through philosophical demonstration, which would illuminate your minds."
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	"And know, son, that they disagree about the time when it is convenient to perform cautery and prefer the best time of spring."
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	"I say that cautery is convenient at all times, because the damage caused by accidental timing is submerged in the benefit of what is drawn out by cautery. And especially if the cautery is performed for pains or necessary remedies for severe and persistent pains, which cannot tolerate delay, because it is feared that something worse will come about, which is greater than the small damage caused by time."
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	"And do not think this in your minds, children, for only the common people and foolish doctors estimate that those illnesses cured by cautery are completely incurable at all times, and they put up with that consequence."
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	"And the reason is not as they think for this, because cautery is only a substitute for medicine that alters complexion and dries out the moistures which are the cause of pains."
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	"But cautery is superfluous in addition to medicine due to the willingness of its value and virtue of its operation, as well as the greatness of its power."
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	"But it is possible that its illness will return at some time due to the complexion of the sick person and the location of their illness, as well as the virtue of cautery and what has been prepared in the body from the aggregation of excesses within it, and what was acquired by it in nutrition and similar causes. But the illness in which cautery is administered is one that is subtle in a member with few superfluities and moistures, such as toothache for pain and similar things, it is possible that this pain will not return, but this happens rarely."
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	"And the common saying is that cautery is the last resort of medicine, and this saying is quite true, because they believe that there is nothing beneficial in it beyond cautery itself."
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	"And the reason is quite contrary to this; and the intention that cautery is the last resort of medicine means only when one uses the methods of treatment in certain illnesses, and those medicines do not help. And therefore, cautery is administered at the end of the disease, and it proves beneficial."
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	"And hereafter let it be understood that cautery is the last resort of medicine, but not in the sense that vulgar people and many foolish doctors understand it."
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	"And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they said this not because of any other reason than the equality of gold and the sublimity of its substance."
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	"And they said that the location of cautery does not make a scar, which is not absolutely true, because I have already seen and proven that this is only the case in certain bodies without others, and cautery with gold is good and better than with iron as they said; but however when you perform cautery with fire using gold, it is not declared to you, because it depends on the quantity of gold you want due to its luster, and because it prepares to receive friction. And if you adjust the ignition above it, the gold will melt from the fire, and some sheets may fall into the fire due to the occupation of that."
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	"And for this reason, cautery should be performed with iron more lightly and more carefully in terms of the correctness of its operation."
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	"And I have already ordered this chapter on cautery according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the head among them for now. So that later when someone asks about something related to it, they may find what they want."
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	"Regarding cautery for headaches caused by coldness and moisture."
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers upon the humid and cold nature of the servant's accident. Its two causes are coldness and great quantity of fluxes from the head to the parts of the eyes and ears, flowing abundantly, causing much sleepiness, toothache, and headache; universally it causes all illnesses that come from coldness, such as paralysis, sodden feet, apoplexy, and similar diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The manner of this cauterization is as follows: firstly, you shall command the patient to be evacuated with a laxative medicine for three or four nights, according to what you judge necessary based on the strength of the illness and the age and habits of the patient.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to shave his head with a razor, and then have him sit on a smooth bench, placing his feet upon the stones of the floor.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	Then place your palm close to his nose between his eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	"But when the illness reaches its peak, mark that spot with a tent, and immediately light the olive-oil cautery of which this is the shape:"
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	"And then gently place that [cautery] on the marked spot so that it descends gradually, allowing your hand to be scorched little by little, and you turn it."
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	"And then lift your hand gently and look at the spot. If you see that some of the bone has been exposed, about as much as a grain of barley, then lift your hand; but if it does not return to its former state, replace it with another one until you see what I told you."
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	"And then take a little salt and dissolve it on that spot and let it sit for three days."
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	"And then place [a bandage] around the wound and leave it until the fire's scar is destroyed."
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	"And then heal the wound with tetrapharmacon until it is healed."
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	"And they said that when the wound remains open, it's better to tie the arm, as this is more beneficial."
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	"And some of them said that the tendon should be cauterized within the bone, and hold the cautery there until it burns a part of the bone's surface."
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	"Then scrape away what has adhered to the bone, then apply treatment."
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	"And others said that when the cautery reaches the bone, it should press down strongly until the bone cracks; this is the way to perform a small trepanation."
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	"The vapor of the head escapes from this place."
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	The wound should be kept open for a long time, and then it should be treated until it has healed.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen this type of cauterization in all cases, only in some men due to fear; and that one, it seems to me, is better with regard to health when it happens, because the head is uncovered by solution of continuity from it just as we have testified in other members, and even more so when the head of the patient is naturally bald.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And that first type of cauterization is safer and better in my opinion, and with that one and with that operation there is health.
Capitol segon.	Chapter Two
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cauterization of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When there is chronic and long-lasting pain in the whole head and this is prolonged illness, and it is treated with plasters and ointments and poultices and emplasters and warm water and cabbage leaves and linseed poultices and similar remedies, especially if it has already been cauterized once without benefit from any of those causes, then consider whether the patient's head has a strong constitution by nature; if it is not thin or weak in any way, then cauterize it again with another cautery near that first one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And cautionarily cauterize that over the horn of his head with a cautery within which the chain is broken.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Break the chain and uncover the bone as much as we have indicated and cauterize it with a cautery in the last part of the head where it is called "the fontanelle" - that is the place where cupping glasses are applied.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And soften your hand in this, and do not uncover the bone because the illness suffers great pain different from all other cauteries of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I say this cautery in its place because it is necessary to cauterize with the same cautery with which you cauterize the horns of the head and the occiput, for that cautery is more subtle than that with which you cauterize the middle part of the head; and this is the form of it.
Capitol ters.	Chapter Three
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of cautery treatment for non-acute migraine.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When sudden pain occurs in the part of the head or when there is continuous pain inside the brain, let it be evacuated with medicines that cleanse the head and let the other treatment which I have described in previous sections be administered. And if none of this helps, then cautery treatment may be done in two ways: either cautery with an acutely burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	The cautery with a burning medicine is as follows: take a dish of salt and dissolve it in vinegar and then separate the extremities from both ends.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then make an incision with a sharp lancet in the location of the pain on the temple within the area where the chain lies beneath the skin without exposing it.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	"Then press upon them with a firm grasp for a descending constriction, and leave them thus for the space of three hours; then untie them and draw them out, and leave the plaster on for two or three days, then pause over the submerged area with a wet cloth until the place becomes warm."
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"And then treat that wound until it is healed."
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	"If you wish, perform some warming medicines which I have written about in the second book of warming remedies."
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	"However, the cautery with iron is done in this manner; heat the cauterizing iron until it glows red-hot:"
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	"and is called nail clamps because its head resembles the shape of a nail with some curvature, and in its middle there is a small prominence."
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	"And then press the cauterizing iron onto the area of pain, keeping your hand steady so that the heat is not scattered, and slowly move the iron back and forth with speed."
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	"And if the quantity of the cauterization is as great as the size of the wound itself, lift your hand away quickly so that the artery that remains open does not become cauterized, for fear that blood flow ceases."
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"And then soak a piece of cotton in saltwater and apply it to the area, leaving it there for three days. Then rinse off with warm water, and then treat the wound until it is healed."
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	"If you wish, cauterize with the tip of a knife according to cautery, and be careful not to cut an artery in this migraine specifically."
Capitol quart.	"Chapter Four."
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	"Regarding the cautery of an ancient headache."
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	"When you treat a headache with the methods we have mentioned previously and in the divisions of illnesses, but find that it is not effective, then it is necessary to heat the cauterizing knife until it glows red-hot. Then apply your hand to the location of the pain for a moment and press down firmly until you cut through the skin and reach the bone."
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	"But it is necessary for you to guard against the continuation of the jawbone, which is moved by chewing, and ensure that the nerve is not cauterized or burned, and that there is no spasm."
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	"And concerning the care and caution regarding blood flow from the artery that is opened, for there is fear in such an opening, especially for one who does not know what they are doing and is untrained or inexperienced. Leave the operation to someone experienced at the beginning."
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	"And here we come back with a reminder of the method for controlling accidental bleeding from an artery according to its manner in the place where this book is located."
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	"And if you see this illness not helped by the cautery and that the patient can tolerate it, then cauterize in the middle of the head as we have described, and treat the wound until it is healed."
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	"And if you wish, administer the cautery that we have mentioned in the chapter on ligation of an artery with cautery using two knives, for this is a better and more certain cauterization."
Capitol .v.	"Chapter Five."
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	"Regarding cautery for ear pain."
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	"When there is pain in the ear due to friction and it has been treated with laxatives and other methods mentioned earlier but the pain persists, then heat the cautery instrument called 'punctum,' which has this form:"
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	"And then apply the cautery to the ignition point, and move it around the entire ear like a wheel, or in circles around each part if the pain is in one specific area."
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	"Gradually apply heat with the cautery to the opening of the ear, little by little, until you feel the location with your hand."
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	"And if you apply cautery at several points around the entire ear and it relieves the pain, then treat those locations until they are healed."
Capitol .vi.	"Chapter Six."
De cauterizacio de turtura.	"Regarding cautery for strangulation."
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	"Strangulation that is cured with cautery only refers to those types that come on suddenly due to blood clots, as we have mentioned in the divisions of illnesses."
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	"Avoid cautery for the type that comes on due to dryness or spasm of a nerve."
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	"When you treat that type of strangulation with remedies and expectorants but find that your treatment is not effective, then it is necessary to cauterize the patient at three locations: first, at the opening of the ear; second, a little below the temple; and third, at the junction of the two lips."
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	"And pause your cautery on the side opposite to the affected area, for softening occurs only in the part that appears healed."
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	"The method of cautery is to cauterize with the cautery instrument on the right side of the ear's tip slightly above the horn of the head, and also on the temple on the other side, the length of which should be according to the length of a finger. Then pause your hand with the cautery until it burns as much as half of its circumference."
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	"This is the form of the cautery instrument, and it is specifically for use by surgeons. Its form is shown in front of this table."
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	"Nevertheless, even more subtle and precise than this one is the one you see here. It is necessary to use a knife instead of excessive coarseness."
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	"And then treat the location with what is described as the process until it is healed."
Capitol .vii.	"Chapter Seven."
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	"Regarding cautery for ancient apoplexy."
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	"When apoplexy has become chronic and you treat it with the methods we have described but find that your treatment is not effective and the patient does not have a fever, then cauterize them at four locations: on all of their cranial bones; in the middle of the head as we have mentioned; and on the nape of the neck."
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	"The method of cautery is done according to what has been described above."
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	"And it is also cauterized over the mouth of the stomach; this is the last step. And then treat with what you process."
Capitol .viii.	"Chapter Eight."
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	"Regarding cautery for fainting caused by blood clots."
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	"It is necessary to give the patient large diuretics and pills made of blessed thistle at the beginning."
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	"And then shave the head completely for the patient, and pause on their nape where the plaster of lead is placed, as described in the treatise on plasters."
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	"And pause there several times, for this is the method of cautery."
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	"Do what you have been told according to that order I have mentioned."
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	"And then if the patient is healed well with that, do so. But if not, then apply three cauteries on the last part of their head, which should be descending from the highest point of the head down to the lowest point of the neck."
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	"Pause between each cautery for the thickness of a finger, and then treat the cautery with what is processed."
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	"But if you make an addition and the patient is tolerant of it, then apply cautery in the middle. And if you wish to make an additional addition, then apply cautery on both cranial bones."
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	"And then treat until healed. And let the cauteries be olive-shaped according to the form shown above."
Capitol .ix.	"Chapter Nine."
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	"Regarding cautery for paralysis and softening of the entire body."
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	"It is necessary that you process in clarification of the head with diuretics and what we have said. And then shave the head of the patient, and apply cautery to them on the middle of their head, on all of their cranial bones, on the last part of it, and apply three cauteries on the spinal bones of the neck."
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	If it is necessary in the illness of body softening due to too much coldness and tolerances, and the illness is severe, then cauterize with four cauteries on the shoulders of the back, and afterward apply a cautery entering near the base of the neck of him, and raise your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Afterward, heal him until he is healed, then cauterize with olive oil cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of cautery for epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized unless the epilepsy is due to phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	Therefore, first cleanse the brain of him with hellebore at the beginning and also use the other treatment that we have mentioned in the division when the illness is great and does not respond to medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not tolerate medicines, then administer purgatives and chew hellebore for him, before that for several days, with proper diet of foods.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And afterward shave the head of the patient, and then cauterize him with one cautery in the middle of the head according to the previous manner, and with another cautery on the back of his head, and cauterize each of his horns.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and does not respond to medicines, then cauterize him with the cauteries mentioned above, having paralytically softened and mollified his body over the vertebrae of the neck and back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And let the cautery be olive oil according to what is preceding.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then pause cauterizing with subtle cauteries in this manner:
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of cautery for melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupt humidity and thick phlegm, then cauterize him with the cauteries that we have mentioned previously, having paralyzed him.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excessive matter that declines to melancholy and the body of the patient is moist, then he should drink hellebore to cleanse his brain according to what has been mentioned in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And afterward shave the head of the patient, and then place a well-prepared plaster made from dove's dung on his head in a circle, and afterward remove it from the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let the patient be kept quiet and restrained from all parts.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And afterward apply a liniment; and afterwards it is fitting to apply powder of ram's testicles.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat him over the fire with moderate warmth according to his endurance when placed upon him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And afterward place him on the middle of the head in a circle and let him remain until he is warmed up.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this with the patient once each week until he is healed; or if you wish, cauterize him with small points according to his strength, but hold your hand thus with a cautery arranged in this manner: This is the type of cautery that moistens the brain evenly.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And afterward apply powder made from the ashes of wool or flaxseed.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	"For burning off descending water from the head."
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	"When you have declared the beginning of water in the head by its signs that I mentioned in the division, then begin and give the patient something to drink that cleanses their head, and guard them from all humidity."
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	"And let them take a bath with warm water for several days."
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Approximately command him to raise his head, and cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head; then cauterize it with two cauteries on both temples if it is the beginning of an epilepsy attack with water in both ears, or on one side if it begins only in one ear.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Make incisions with cauteries on all the veins and arteries that are located near the neck; the cauteries should be of such a length as to reach the level of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be careful about blood flow when cauterizing; and if you see any blood flowing, remove the cautery with some medicine that you have available.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And bring along knowledge about extraction of arteries and ablation of those, as well as caution regarding blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	Sometimes it is cauterized in the back of the neck near two bones with two cauteries perpendicularly applied.
Capitol .xiii.	Capitol 13
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Regarding the cauterization of old tears (i.e., treatment of chronic blepharitis or conjunctivitis).
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears from the eyes are excessive and continuous due to veins and arteries in the visible area of the head being obstructed by a superfluous flow of serous fluid, then cauterize as follows: with the cautery mentioned at the beginning for watery discharge in the ears, and with another cautery in the middle of the head, and with two cauteries on either side of the temples, and with two cauteries on either side of the two bones in the neck.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you need to add more, then cauterize also on both sides of the cheekbone above the outer corner of the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Capitol 14
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Regarding cauterization for foul-smelling breath (i.e., treatment of halitosis).
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat someone with the remedy mentioned earlier and it does not prove effective, then prepare and give them to drink the decoction for three nights. Afterwards, shave their head and cauterize it as follows: first with a cautery in the middle and then with an olive-shaped cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And also cauterize with a clove-shaped cautery on both eyebrows above the hairline using two cauteries.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn the artery (i.e., avoid damaging blood vessels).
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	This is the shape of the clove-shaped cautery:
Capitol .xv.	Capitol 15
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Burns for softening eyelids
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid is softened by illness or humidity, cauterize that eyelid with this lunar cautery; and this is how it is done:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	"If you wish, cauterize that area on both eyebrows with two small cauteries, separated from the temples."
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	"And let the length of each cautery be according to the amount of eyebrow present."
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	"Press the cautery gently onto the skin, so that only a third of the eyelid's thickness is burned."
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	"Regarding cauterization of the eyelids when the hairs inside become inflamed and pierce the eye."
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	"When the hairs of the eyelid become inflamed and penetrate the eye so that it is pierced, there are two ways to cauterize them: either by burning or using medicinal remedies."
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	"If cauterizing with fire, command the patient beforehand that they pull out their hairs like those who are plucked for depilation, ensuring they are lengthened and hardened; and if one of them pierces near its origin, then immediately stretch the eyelids using a bandage so that it is not bothered until the hairs have grown back."
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	"When the hairs have grown back and hardened, then pause the patient's head against a wall, and holding the eyelids open with one hand using a tent-like device made of linen cloth, bring the cautery close to the base of the hairs."
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	"And hold the cautery wrapped in wax or pitch-plaster over the eyelid."
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	"And then ignite the cautery of which this is the shape."
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	"And then cauterize over the figure that you have traced, little by little in many places until the surface of the skin appears like a boxwood leaf."
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	"A sign that your work is complete is when you see the eyelid of the eye begin to contract and its hairs rise up from the puncture wound."
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	"And then raise your hand [from the cauterization] and leave it for three days. After that, touch the area gently around the scar until it has healed."
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"And then dress it with gauze until it is healed."
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	"But if the hairs return for some reason and the eyelid becomes softened again, then perform the cautery once more just as you had done initially."
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	"But if the hairs remain on the eyelid and it droops downwards, then cauterize that area until it is raised to its natural position, closed, and the hairs do not obstruct the eye."
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	"But during cauterization with a burning medicine, you should command the patient to raise their eyebrows until they are fully extended and closed. Then, make a template of boxwood leaf shape from card or cloth."
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	"And then take some known soap and live coals and mix them well together quickly so that it does not cool down. Then spread this mixture onto the card template shaped like a boxwood leaf, and place it over one or both eyes. The patient should keep their eye covered with a damp cloth while keeping their head still."
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	"And then place your finger on the medicine and press it gently without moving until the patient feels the bite of the medicine, for the bite is like that of fire."
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	"And when the patient feels that sensation of being bitten, then lift off the medicine and move it with your fingertip; once the biting sensation ceases, remove the medicine and rinse the eye with water. Then observe whether the eyelid has risen as it should be when lifted by the restriction with fire or incision, for sometimes it is necessary to repeat the operation until the eye is completely closed."
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	"And then place a border around it so that the edge of the wound is properly sealed. Then dress it with deaffection or another suitable dressing until it heals."
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	"And you must be very diligent to ensure that no particles of the medicine fall into the eye during your operation. And if the eyelid becomes inflamed after several days and some cause of hairs obstruction occurs in the eye, then repeat your application of the medicine on that area which is inflamed, just as you did at the beginning. And then surround it until it heals."
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	"And this is the shape of a boxwood leaf template:"
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	"And know that the eyes of men are diverse in size and smallness, and thus your cauterization should be adjusted accordingly."
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	"And it shall not be hidden from those who wish to learn this art correctly."
Capitol .xvii.	"Chapter XVII."
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	"Of the cautery of a fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye."
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	"When you treat a fistula as we have said in the divisions of diseases and your treatment does not improve, then you should cauterize it in this manner: Have the patient hold their head still with their chin on their chest, and have someone else hold the patient's head firmly between their thighs so that it is not moved or shaken by the patient's own head."
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	"And then place a hot iron in a boxwood leaf template or in pitch on the eye of the patient."
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	"And then heat the cautery, which has this shape:"
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	"which is heated, so that it resembles the shape of a reed or a vulture's feather at its tip where the cautery is made."
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	"If you wish, let it penetrate slightly into the other extremity."
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	"And if you want, let it come out like this:"
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	"But rather use the one that is heated for better results."
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	"And then press on the fistula if it is open, and draw out its humor and dry it."
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	"But if it is not open, then open it and extract the pus from it."
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	"And then take the cautery which is well heated and place it near the eye but not too close to the cautery of the eye at the opening of the nose, so that you do not err with your hand or cause discomfort to the patient. Then place the cautery on the granuloma and burn it."
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	"And thus if at the beginning of your cautery it enters the bone, that is good. But if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice if necessary, and leave it alone for three days. Then dress it with a dry dressing until it heals."
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	"But if after eleven days it has not healed, then apply a caustic medicine until the bone is exposed and scrape it according to what you consider necessary in this chapter."
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	"And there is another method of cautery for fistulas which some first said: Take a narrow knife and cut into the location of the fistula. Then place in that fissure a subtle thread of lead, about one inch long. Then take it up with tweezers while holding it firmly so that the molten lead does not fall into the eye of the patient. And then place this on the eye of the patient covered with a boxwood leaf template or water, for lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it wonderfully."
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	"And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cautery and treatment, that is good. But if not, then it is necessary to administer a traction of the nose and reduce the fistula into the nasal cavity according to what will be written in its proper place."
Capitol .xviii.	"Chapter XVIII."
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	"Of the cautery of the fissure of the eyelids."
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	"Fissures occur frequently in the eyelids, and more so in children's eyelids."
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	"So when you treat those fissures as we have said in the divisions and your treatment is not beneficial, then heat a small cutting cautery of this shape:"
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	"And let it be heated according to the sharpness of a needle."
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	"Then carefully place that heated cautery in those fissures until it reaches the edge of the fissure."
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	"And then dress it with wax until it heals."
Capitol .xix.	"Chapter XIX."
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	"Of the cautery of a fistula in the mouth."
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	"When an abscess forms on the uvula or palate or at the roots of the teeth and it bursts and becomes chronic, forming a fistula which you treat without success, then you should heat a cautery according to the size received in the fistula. Then insert that heated cautery into the tract of the fistula until the hot iron reaches the edge of it. And repeat this once or twice. Then dress it with what we have said about treatment until it heals."
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	"And if the healing is separated and healed, that is good. But if not, then it is necessary to expose the location and scrape out the rotten bone according to what will be written in its chapter."
Capitol .xx.	"Chapter XX."
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	"The cauterization of teeth and the softening of vessels."
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	"When vessels are softened by moisture and teeth are moistened, and you treat them with medications but they do not improve, then place the head of the patient on a cloth, and quickly bring the cautery iron, as shown here. Thus, hold the jawula over the tooth and insert the cautery iron into it quickly, taking care that your hand does not come too close so that the patient feels the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth."
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	"And then remove your hand, and repeat the cautery several times according to what you desire."
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	"Then the patient should rinse their mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out, because the moist tooth is solidified and the softened gum is strengthened and the corrupted moisture is dried."
Capitol .xxi.	Here is a translation of Chapter XXI:
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	"Of cauterization for tooth pain."
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	"When toothache is caused by coldness, or there is heat or worm in it, and the cure does not work with medicine, then cauterize it in that place in two ways: either cauterize it with a red-hot iron or cauteri with fire."
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	"To cauterize with a red-hot iron: you take a piece of red-hot iron and place it on the coal fire, then take cotton and wrap it around the tip of the toothpick, and quickly immerse that in boiling water. Then apply that to the painful tooth immediately before it cools."
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	"And repeat this several times until the power of the heat reaches the root of the teeth."
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	"Now if you wish, immerse wool or cotton in the aforementioned boiling water, place it on the painful tooth, and then apply that hot iron to the groove of the tooth until the iron reaches its point."
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	"But however the cauterization with fire is done: you wait until the coal or iron is red-hot, and it should be in the middle of the fire some distance away so that the heat does not reach the mouth of the sick person."
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	"And then ignite the cautery in whatever shape it may be, place it on the tooth and press it there with your hand until the cautery cools. And do this several times, either that day or the next, until the pain is removed."
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	"And it should be noted that after this cautery, the patient should rinse their mouth with good water and hold it there for an hour, and then spit it out. And this is the form of the cautery."
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	"And cauterize with whatever you wish according to what is possible for you."
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	"And this is the form of the canal:"
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of the cauterization of external haemorrhoids.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When external haemorrhoids are composed of fatty matter and humors that are resistant to digestion by medications and you wish to digest them thus, then you ignite the cautery that has two ends closed so that yes smoke goes through one end, and place it on that pile once or twice until it reaches its point."
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	"And if the pile is small, then place the cautery according to its quantity, and then leave it for three days and apply it to the cotton immersed in boiling water until what the fire has burnt is removed."
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	"And then treat it with ointments and bandages until it is healed."
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	"And the form of the canal or cautery for such a purpose is as follows:"
Capitol .xxiii.	De cauterizacio de internas haemorrhoidas.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	"For cauterization of a sore throat and constriction of the breath."
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.
