"When humidity comes over the canal of the lung, especially when it is with coldness of complexion, then it is necessary for the patient to be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines, and also cauterize that place on the root of the uvula in the depressed area."
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	"And make sure not to burn the uvula with the cautery nor burn too much of its base."
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	"And cauterize that place with another cautery on the junction of the neck in the last vertebra of it."
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	"And the cautery of it should be done in such a way as described before."
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	"Moreover, treat that with what is prescribed until it is healed."
Capitol .xxiiii.	"Chapter XXIV"
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	"For cauterization of lung disease and cough."
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	"When cough and lung disease are from moist coldness, and the disease does not have fever nor spitting, and it is an old disease, then cauterize that place with two cauteries over the furcula in the depressed areas of the lungs and breasts; and with another cautery in the middle of the pit between two nipples; and the cauteries should be done firmly according to the previous method."
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	"And if you wish, your cautery can also be punctured with the cautery called 'puncta', whose form is described in the punctuation of ear pain."
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	"And make several punctures there, and afterwards treat that place with what you have prescribed until it is healed."
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	"Already the cautery has three branches, therefore cauterization is done with that; in one session you can perform three cauteries according to this method:"
Capitol .xxv.	"Chapter XXV."
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	"The cauterization of the little one that is the head of the helper."
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	"When the head of the helper is dislocated due to slippery humidity and is not fixed at the time of its return, you must reduce its dislocation before it returns to its usual position. First, reduce the dislocation, and then place the patient on their back or side. Next, lift the shoulder that is located beneath the little one's neck up towards the upper parts with your left hand if the joint is dislocated below."
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And also ignite the cautery, which has two heads; this is its form:"
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	"And then cauterize the shoulder until it enters that of the other side. Now comes the figure for cauterizing with four cautery heads."
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"and thus subtly, according to the quantity of the tent; this is its form:"
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	"And sometimes it is adjusted in this manner, and therefore there are eight cautery heads."
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	"And then pause over the cautery with cotton dipped in salt, and make sure the patient is at rest, so that the limb is not moved for some time until it is consoled."
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	"And if the dislocation is above and it has been done this way, then cauterize over the muscle with a claw-shaped cautery or pointed cauteries, for the joint is strengthened, moisture is reduced, and the patient is healed."
Capitol .xxvi.	"Chapter 26."
De cauterizacio del stomac.	"Of cautery of the stomach."
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	"When the stomach is hot and moist with many humors which that part has extracted from its complexion and multiplied, and if you continue your usual methods of treatment without considering the cause, it will happen that the patient will become worse, so extend their arms and legs, place them on a table, and cauterize this area with three cauteries: one on the lower side of the sternum about the size of a fingertip, one on each side of the sternum like the points of a triangle; take care that those which are not adjacent do not cause blisters."
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	"The depth of the cautery should be equal to the thickness of two thirds of the diameter of a finger."
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	"And if you want to use a large cautery in the middle of the stomach according to this form, this is a cautery in the shape of a circle with this form:"
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	"And the stomach is punctured with that which frightens him from this cautery: and if you see on the stomach a point according to how much you want, cauterize it with tentativeness using the cautery; and also cure it with the treatment that has been previously mentioned until it is healed."
Capitol .xxvii.	"Chapter XXVII."
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	"On cauterizing a fatty liver."
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	"When there is pain in the liver due to coldness or humidity or excessive windiness such that its normal complexion has been altered by superfluous egression, and if the illness is treated with what we have said and it does not improve, then you should raise the illness above its usual place and cautiously cauterize three points according to this form and quantity evenly on the liver near the hypochondrium, where a man lies on his back."
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	"And the space between each cautery should be equal to the thickness of the finger, and the cauteries should be as long as the right hand."
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	"Don't press too hard with the cautery handle."
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	"And if the amount of that which is adhered is equal to the thickness of a finger's joint, do not adjust it further; and if the illness is standing on the lungs; and if it is not standing, then let him be seated with his legs extended and raise his arms."
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	"And this is the shape of the cautery:"
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	"And it may be possible for you to cauterize these cauteries with a scalpel cautery if you have subtlety and prudence in the art."
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	"But be careful not to proceed too far in the cautery, and adhere the entire spinal cord so that the whole body is adhered and enters into the intestines, for here the spine is delicate. Know this."
Capitol .xxviii.	"Chapter XXVIII."
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	"On puncturing an abscess of the liver with a cautery."
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When an abscess or boil appears on the liver and you want to know if that boil is in the flesh of the liver or in its covering, then if it is in the flesh of the liver, the patient feels heavy and sharp pain.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the covering of the liver, then the pain is very acute and sometimes even discourages physicians from treating it.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Therefore, make the patient turn onto their back; then find the location of the boil with your touch and burn it using an iron that resembles wool, whose shape has been described on the previous page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And cauterize with that cautery until all the chain is burned, until it reaches the nipple, until in ash it remains.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that one according to how you would treat other boils until it is healed.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And do not use this cautery technique unless you are someone who has studied medicine extensively and has treated many illnesses. Although some people have tried it several times with success, it is still better to leave such operations to those who deserve them and know how to perform them best.
Capitol .xxix.	Capítulo XXIX.
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	Of cautery for pleurisy.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	It is said by ancient authors that cautery for pleurisy should be done in this manner: take a dry and hard splinter of aristologist wood (a type of oak), make it into a sharp point as thick as your finger.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	And then immerse that splinter in oil and heat it over the fire. Then cauterize with it at a point between the continuation of the furcula and the collarbone; and with two small diagonal cauteries below the jaw on either side, inclining slightly towards the back of the neck; and with two cauteries between the fifth rib and the armpit, inclining slightly backwards; and with another cautery in the middle of the chest; and one on the stomach; and three cauteries on the back; and one cautery between the two shoulder blades; and two cauteries on either side of the chest.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And do not hold the cautery with your hand but place it in a suitable holder for the purpose of cauterizing.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And they also said that some people use a cautery made of iron like a rod and heated it until it glows red-hot, placing it between the shoulder blades until it reaches the boil and makes it suppurate in order to heal it, as we have mentioned for the boil on the liver.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	But in this operation with cautery there is danger, because many people die immediately if it happens in the location of a fistula that does not heal.
Capitol .xxx.	Capítulo XXX.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	Of cautery for the spleen.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you treat the illness of the spleen with what we have said about division and curing, if your treatment does not succeed, then cauterize it in one of three acceptable ways:
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	"The thickness between each cautery should be that of a finger or slightly more, and the manner of the cautery should be as we have described for the burning of the liver equally."
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	"Do not press your hand on the cauteries; let the patient lie on their side."
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	"And another method of cautery is that you should light the cauteries having two vents, which we have mentioned in the chapter on dislocation of the muscle, and raise the collarbone which is situated towards the left side where the patient's chest lies."
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	"And your elevation should be such that you raise the collarbone along the length of the body, so that cauteries may be applied according to the width of the chest."
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	"And then introduce both vents promptly and simultaneously into that opening where the collarbone enters from the other side."
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	"Then extract the cautery, making four cauteries in total."
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	"If you wish, cauterize with a cautery having three vents."
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	"Then remove the cautery because it has been applied for too many days, since this is more harmful than all other causes preceding in treatment."
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter LXXI.
De cauterizacio de ydropici.	Of cauterization of dropsical patients.
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	"Cauterize hydrocele only, not scrotum improperly."
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	"When you treat the hydrocele with the methods of treatment that we have mentioned in this division and you do not succeed, then it is necessary to cauterize with four cauteries around the navel, one on the stomach, one on the liver, one on the spleen, two between the vertebrae of the back, one on the right side of the foot, and another on the stomach."
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	"The depth of the cautery should be proportional to the thickness of the cord."
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	"And do not leave the cautery burning for too long, so that it grabs and stays on for a long time."
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	"And do not evacuate the patient from treatment until after the cautery has been applied, so that two intentions are added to it, and it will be hastened with the help of healing."
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	"The shape of the cautery with which the belly is cauterized should be like a key, according to the shape that is described above, and the one with which the back is cauterized should be olive-shaped, as it is described beforehand in its shape."
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter .xxxii
De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	"Of cauterization of hair and skin."
Quan les pes so apostematz en ydropitz e so repletz de aygua sitrina, cove que cauterisas les pes sobre le dos del pe in nocrati aquo que es entre le auricular e le anular, e eleva la tua ma am le cauteri e no torses aquel; e aprop eleva la tua ma, e no retornes aquela de tot, quar l’aygua satrina rezuda.	"When the hair becomes infected with hydrops and is filled with yellow water, it is necessary to cauterize the hair on the back of the head, near where the ear joins the neck, raising your hand with the cautery and not turning it; and as soon as you raise your hand, do not return immediately, so that the yellow water does not ooze."
Es le cauteri segon aquesta forma: E aprop fay sobre las doas coyssas dos cauteris, e en quascuna coysa sia feyt cauteri am la extremitat del cauteri cutellar.	"The cautery should be done in this way: And afterwards make two cauteries on both sides of the skin, and each side should be cauterized with the tip of the cautery spoon."
E sia le cauteri segon la longitut de la coyssa: i dejos le denolh e l’autre jos le mieg loc de la coyssa; e sobre quascuna coyssa dos cauteris.	"And let the cauteries be done according to the length of the skin, one near the denuded area and the other near the middle of the skin, and make two cauteries on each side."
E layssa la plagua uberta ses curacio per lonc temps per so que alcuna aygua resuda de lu.	"And do not leave the dressing untreated for too long so that no water oozes from it."
E aprop cura le am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas.	"And then treat it with those causes that we have mentioned."
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter .xxxiii
De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	"Regarding the cauterization of the abdominal body."
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	"When the abdominal body is affected by heat and humidity, it weakens the strength. This is the digestive and retentive virtue located in the stomach and intestines. It is treated with this method of treatment without any contradictions, sometimes the patient suffers from cauterization of virtues being exhibited, therefore cauterize it with a large cautery on its stomach as previously described for the cauterization of the stomach, with a circular cautery and four subtle cauteries around the navel, using a pointed cautery; or apply cauteries to the bladder and kidneys."
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	"However, if the humidity is excessive and the patient cannot tolerate it, then cauterize them on the pubis and intestines, placing two cauteries firmly on the stomach near the groin. This will achieve a perfect cure without error."
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter xxxiv
De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	"On the cauterization of old hemorrhoids."
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz.	When the derriere is covered in ancient eruptions or one of thick humors or corrupted humidities, and they are cured with what we have said in this division without conferring your cure, then cauterize with three cauteries on the left side of the lower spine and a cautery above the navel, placed like this:
E si doptas que l’estomac de lu sia enfregidat e la vianda de lu no sia degerida, e la cara de lu vezes apostemada, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre l’estomac am gran cauteri segon que es precedit; e am un cauteri sobre fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa de lu am cauteri clavilh, e leyssa le cauteri per alcun temps ubert, e aprop cura lu entro que sia sanat.	If you find that the stomach is chilled and its food not digested, and the face becomes pale, then cauterize it on the stomach with a large cautery as described; and with one cautery on the liver, and another on the spleen with a pointed cautery, leaving the cautery there for some time, and afterwards cure the inside when it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	Concerning cautery after excision of tumors.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you cut arteries, then ignite the cautery that resembles a ray.
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Apply the cauterizing iron to the cut artery and push it in until it reaches the opening of the vein from which blood flows.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And do this once or twice, because if there are too many [arteries], then cauterize each one individually according to what has been said earlier, and then dress those wounds until they are healed.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	And if you use a large cautery on some [arteries], it is more likely to cause injury.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter XXXVI
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	Of the cauterization of fistulas made by nature in the region around the anus.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	If nature does not obey the operation recommended in its place and the patient becomes frightened by this, then it should be treated with cautery.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore, when there is some fistulous opening in the anus region and it is old, corrupted by bad humor and moisture, then it is more appropriate to probe that with a subtle tent and thus determine the quantity of its depth using the aforementioned tent.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Then apply the cautery that resembles a ray.
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	And then insert that cautery while lit into this fistula, according to how deep the tent entered it.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And repeat applying the cautery until those corrupted tissues are completely burned once or twice or three times, according to how much it is necessary for you.
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	And be careful not to burn nerves and veins; or if the fistula goes into the body of the bladder or the body of the gut, then be careful about all those places. And do not do this unless the fistula is in a fleshy location and you think that it is not penetrating.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	"And next, heal the wound within until it is healed."
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	"And if the wound is sealed and its matter has been removed, and no new signs appear for some time, then you will know that it has entirely healed."
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	"And if the matter was not all removed from it, then you will know that it is penetrating or spreading into the surrounding flesh, or corrupted due to one of those causes which we will mention later."
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter XXXVII
De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	Of cauterization of warts.
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	When warts cause pain by friction or are very rough, and the heat of the illness is increased because of this, then you should cauterize them with a cautery iron on each wart, pressing down firmly on each one, as mentioned in the memorandum.
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	And if you cauterize strongly with the second one for a short while, so that three cauteries are made in a row, then apply more cauteries afterwards as needed.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter XXXVIII
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	"On cauterizing the bladder."
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	"When the bladder suffers from weakening and softening due to friction and moisture such that the patient cannot retain urine, then cauterize this in the part where the public hair begins above the bladder, cauterizing on the right side with one cautery iron and on the left side with another."
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat.	"And the length of each cautery iron should be according to the amount of hair in the pubic area. And cauterize this on the lower part of the back, using one cautery iron or two if necessary."
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	"And use a pointed cautery iron as needed."
Capitol .xxxix.	"Chapter XXXIX."
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	"On cauterizing the uterus."
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	"When friction and moisture occur in the uterus, causing it to be closed off from pregnancy, and its menstrual flow is corrupted, delayed, or accompanied by pain during its occurrence, then that place should be cauterized with three cautery irons around the navel area as we have described for bladder cauterization; and also cauterize on the spot where the buttocks begin on the back, using one pointed cautery iron or two if necessary."
Capitol .xl.	"Chapter XL."
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	"On cauterizing for dislocation of the urine."
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	"When moist and mucous urine flows from the urinary opening, and this is the cause of its inflammation, a sign of which is that one side protrudes more than the other when compared."
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	"And the location of the dislocation can be found in the scrotum."
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	"Therefore you should cauterize the diseased area around the urinary opening with an annular cautery iron, and first mark it with your finger by tracing its circumference as it is rounded out, so that the opening falls into the middle of the circle."
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	"And the cautery previously described should be used in this form for cauterizing the stomach."
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	"And if that cautery is not available to you, then cauterize it with three olive-shaped cautery irons."
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And the cautery should be applied according to the amount of inflammation along the entire length of the penis; and afterwards carefully dress the wound so that it heals."
Capitol .xli.	"Chapter XLI."
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	"On cauterizing the sciatic vein."
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	"When pain occurs at the urinary opening due to friction and moisture, that condition is treated as we have described earlier but without good results, then you should evacuate the excess humors with pills made from fetid substances or artificial ones of a similar nature; and afterwards cauterize it."
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	"And there are two methods of cautery for that condition: either cauterizing with burning medications or cauterizing with fire."
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	"According to two known methods, one of which is to cauterize it around the urinary opening with three triangular cautery irons in this shape, applying them deeply."
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	"And let the space between each cautery be equal to the thickness of the finger, if using an olive-shaped or large cautery iron."
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	"But sometimes it is better to place the cautery in the middle above the head of the penis so that there are four cauteries."
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	"And if you wish to do so, cauterize with the circular cautery iron described in the form used for cauterizing dislocation of the penis, ensuring that it encircles and burns off all the inflammation along its length."
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	"And this is the method of cautery for sciatica when the pain is attached to the penis and not extended throughout the whole area."
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	"But if it extends throughout the area, then cauterize it with two cauteries on the thigh at the location where you feel the pain, and one cautery on the knee joint a little below the right side of the kneecap."
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	"And if using the knife-shaped cautery iron, its depth should be determined according to the amount of inflammation along the penis."
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	"And if you feel that the pain extends to the area around these three points, then cauterize there with a cautery iron having three or four or more points according as it is needed."
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	"And if you feel pain below the thigh, then cauterize there with a knife-shaped cautery iron."
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	"And be careful in all cauteries that you do not burn any large nerve or artery with the cautery iron, lest you harm the patient or cause a contraction."
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	"And I have seen some of those who have cauterized on the knee joint and burned too deeply in doing so, causing the thigh to become swollen, with a tumor reaching the foot, and resulting in gangrene and corruption of the entire limb."
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	"And accordingly, a strong solution of vinegar should be applied locally, and if necessary, used as a drink to prevent death."
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	"And if the pain is in two places at once, cauterize each according to this method."
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	"And some authorities on cauterizing the penis describe the following method: Make it resemble an iron hoop, with its circumference about the size of a man's palm; and let its opening be on its convex side, according to the thickness of a date bone or somewhat less."
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And within that circle there should be another third one; and the space between them should be equal to the thickness of a finger joint; and these circles should have two openings on opposite sides; and their length should be about one or two finger joints, with the edges well sharpened with iron in the form shown below:"
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	"And appropriate it should be heated in the fire until it becomes red-hot and throws off sparks, then place it on the urinary opening with the diseased side towards you."
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	"And then cauterize it with three applications of the hot iron at once."
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"And afterward leave it alone for three days, then apply a plaster with honey and let the wound remain open too long, and cure it with ointments until it is healed."
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	"Albucasis says: 'O son, we have used this kind of cautery little because of the fear of injury to it, and therefore few are those who regard it.'"
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	"But among good cauteries there is one that suffers most, yet finds its proper place."
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	"But cautery with adherent medicines is done by making two circles having an opening bored in each, through which you insert the blade of a knife made of iron; let their length be about the thickness of two fingers or somewhat less."
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	"And if the space between each is equal to the thickness of a finger, and they are open below and above, let them contain within themselves according to this form:"
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	"And appropriate it should be placed on the urinary opening with the diseased part lying upon your left side, and press your hand over the urinary opening; then take some boiling water and pour it between two circles, letting its heat be gradually increased by the fire until it becomes as hot as possible, keeping it so for about an hour while enduring the biting and adhering of the iron — for that will bite like fire — until the biting ceases."
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	"And then raise your hand along with the instrument, and wash off all the boiling water from the penis with fresh water."
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	"And then leave it for three days, and apply honey plaster over it until the blackness of adhesion disappears, leaving it thus for some days until suppuration begins; this is the last stage in treatment."
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"And finally cure it with ointments until it is healed."
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	"If the pain extends into the scrotum or thigh, make a similar cautery on those parts containing water as was done for the penis."
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	"And this is the manner of boiling water, which I have already written about in my treatise on the correction of medicines."
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Guessed translation: Take equal parts of alkali and unquenched lime, grind them together into a paste, sieve it through a new earthenware pot that has been pierced with a small hole on one side according to the amount needed for the mixture.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	Guessed translation: Then place the bottom of one earthenware pot over another inverted one, and pour onto it a solution of water and quicklime, catching it with your fingertips. Once you have collected enough, press it gently but firmly with your fist, ensuring that no sharp water escapes from between the two pots.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	Guessed translation: Next, gather all that water and pour it onto more fresh slaked lime and alkali, as at this point the solution will be very caustic. This mixture is used in many medical operations and for cautery of other limbs, as it has fire-like properties.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	Guessed translation: And among these remedies is one used for cauterization of large wounds, such as pitch, honey, and soap mixed with slaked lime.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	Guessed translation: And Galen recounts an operation and cure for the pain of arthritis and sciatica, greatly praising it and saying that no other treatment is necessary. For he was cured in a single application, as he himself reports, because he bathed in this mixture and became free of that affliction.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	Guessed translation: And it is said that green celery should be taken, and if none is available, then fresh figs should be used. These should be finely chopped with a little salt and placed on the water where there is pain, or on the thing itself, or in a vessel, and bound up.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	Guessed translation: And it should be left for three hours or for as long as the patient feels relief from the adhesion.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	Guessed translation: And then put that [mixture] on a bath and once the body is warmed up, rub it into the skin. For the pain will cease and it will be healed.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	Guessed translation: And know that these remedies should not be used for cautery, but rather for evacuation of the body.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	Guessed translation: But Dioscorides says that when the streaked vein is cauterized with goat's beard, it is beneficial to apply this [mixture]; and the cautery should be done in this manner: wool should be dipped in old oil and placed between the thumb and forefinger.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	Guessed translation: And then take dry goat's beard, inflame it with fire until it becomes carbonized. Then place it on the wool and apply it while it is still hot.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	Guessed translation: And repeat this [procedure], not ceasing until the sensation of biting pain has penetrated into the water and the pain has subsided.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	Guessed translation: And this manner of cautery is called cautery with bellows.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter XLII
De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	Of cauterizing pain in the teeth.
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida.	Some pains in the back arise from several causes, such as from cold or from a blow or from excessive evacuation, and from similar causes due to the infusion of moist and warm matter.
E cauteri no catz sino en aquesta sola specia la qual es fayta per efusio de materia frega.	Cautery is only used in this one condition which occurs due to an effusion of hot matter.
Donc cove, aprop evacuacio del malaute am pillulas fitidas e am semblant a lor, que sian faytas sobre·l dos en le qual es la dolor tres linhas segon la latitut de lu, pus que senhas am tentha en quascuna linha v cauteris o mays, segon la quantitat que ve de la tolleransa del malaute e de la vertut de lu.	Therefore, it is necessary to evacuate the pain with pills made of dried figs and similar ones. These should be placed on the back where there is pain in three lines according to its length, because as many cauteries as there are fingers should be done in each line, depending on the amount of tolerance for the pain and the strength of it.
E sia fayta cauterizacio am cauteri de punt.	And cauterization should be done with a pointed cautery.
E si vols, cauteriza am tres cauteris o am quatre am cauteri clavilh medial segon aquesta forma:	And if you wish, cauterize with three or four cauteries using a triangular cautery in this manner:
Capitol .xliii.	De ventositat de la cossella e de lo cor.
De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	Cauterization at the beginning of swelling.
Motas veguadas endeve aquesta malautia als petitz enfantz; e senhal del comensament de lu en les enfantz es que accideys sobre lor estrectura en le ale eves la elevacio e·l movement.	Many times this disease is seen in young children, and one of the signs that indicates its beginning in children is when it occurs above their anus, accompanied by swelling and redness.
E atrobas en le derier espondil del dos e dels notz de lu que ja comensa a sobremontar sobre les autres spondils.	And if it appears on the last vertebra of the back or neck, and begins to rise above the other vertebrae
E donc quan tu vezes aquo e voles prohibir, lahoras cauterisa aquel am cauteri que sia cercle segon aquesta forma:	And therefore, when you see this [swelling], in order to prevent it from spreading further, cauterize around it with a hot iron that is circular in shape
que prengua le cauteri sobre tota partida del spondilh engualment.	so that the cautery covers the entire inflamed part of the spine.
E si vols, cauteriza en le circuit del spondilh am le cauteri de punt dos linhas o tres.	And if you wish, cauterize around the spine with a cautery rod two or three lines thick
E sian les puntz propdas entre lor.	So that the points are close together.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat am aquo que havem dit.	And afterwards, treat the affected area with what has been said [about cauterization].
Mays guarda que cauteri no sia administrat en gelbositat que sia fayta per spasme de nervi.	But be sure not to administer cautery to swelling that is caused by spasm of nerves.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLIV
De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	Of the cauterization of podagra and pain in joints.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	When pain in the joints is caused by cold humors that have infiltrated each member of the body, thus when pains occur in the feet, it is customary for doctors to call this gout properly.
E donc cum es curada podagra de causa frega am manieyra de cura e no so remaugudas las dolors, lahoras las remau cauteri.	And therefore, since gout caused by cold humors cannot be cured and the pains are not removed, cautery is resorted to.
E es que tu cauterizas aquel aprop evacuacio en le circuit de la junctura del pe am motz cauteris.	You cauterize that area appropriately with several cauteries in the circuit of the ankle joint using moxa cauteries.
E sia cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is the form of olive oil cautery:
E si es necessitat que puntz sia fayt sobre la fassia del pe, lahoras fay am cauteri de punt.	If it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery.
E si las dolors pujan entro als denolhs o a las autras juncturas, e aquo motas vetz s’endeve, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre quascun donolh am tres cauteris o quatre de tota partida am aquest cauteri olivar.	If pains push inside the joints or other connections, and this happens often, then cauterize each painful point with three cauteries or four in total using this olive-oil cautery.
E si motz cauteris que aquestz cauteris sian a tu necessaris, lahoras cauteriza aquel e no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri abans, sia tant solament enviro la specitut de la codena.	If more cauteries are needed than these, then cauterie each one and do not press too hard with the cautery beforehand, only enough to heat the surface of the skin.
E si las dolors pugan entro al donolh e·l dos, lahoras aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le sieu capitol.	If pains push inside both knees, then administer the cautery that we have described in this chapter.
E si las dolors so en las mas tant solament, e es apelada suagra, lahoras puncta en le circuit dels focils ayssi cum se revolvo, puncta en aquels dos linhas.	If pains are only on one side and are called cramps, then prick around the belly button in this way: prick along these two lines.
E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	If pains remain on them, then prick around the belly button above each knot and also on the palm of the hand.
E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	If pains push near the joints or muscles of the thighs, then cauterize each of all the helpers (i.e., the points around the knee).
E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	Do not rely solely on this cautery to treat illness without good regimen and receipt of medicines, for if a good regimen is followed and the disease is evacuated with this cautery alone, God willing, it will heal.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter XLVI
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	**On Cauterization of Fractures**
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When rupture occurs in the groin and intestines protrude before the hernia, and this is how it begins, then you should order the patient to abstain from his usual diet on that day and to use gentle laxatives so that the protruding opening of his belly may subside.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	Then approach the patient between your thighs and press firmly on their buttocks, commanding them to hold their breath until the tumor or protruding intestines appear clearly.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	Then return with your hands and press the rupture onto the bone of the pelvis, indicating the extremity that is like half a circle among the upper ribs.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then apply the cautery in this form:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	until it becomes very red and sparks are emitted.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	Then reduce the intestines or tumor to its natural position, and press your hand firmly over the spot so that the intestines do not escape.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	And you have now put your hands between the patient's thighs and allowed him to rest on one elbow, and others support his shoulders and hips, while he holds his own buttocks with his hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	Then place the cautery on that spot with your left hand holding the cautery, and press firmly until you reach the bone of the pelvis in the middle of the thigh; repeat this procedure with another burn if you have not succeeded in the first attempt.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	Be sure to observe carefully the condition of the intestines during your cautery, and do not burn them accidentally lest the patient suffer death or some other great harm.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	Know that if you do not reach the bone with the cautery, you have not completed your operation.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And it is necessary that the cautery used for children be small according to their size and proportion.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	Then cleanse the spot of the cautery for three days with warm water so that the scar may heal properly.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Then dress him with other remedies until he is healed.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	And the patient should lie on his back for forty days so that the wound may be sealed and healed properly.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	It is necessary that the patient's diet be regulated according to the length of time for his healing, so that his belly may not be disturbed by excessive effort during recovery and intestines do not protrude.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And when he wants to get up after forty days, gradually administer solid food, and keep him in bed for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And he should refrain from work, overindulgence in food and drink, and violent coughing or vomiting, for if he uses this regimen of healing entirely as prescribed, he will be completely healed.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And I have given you the treatment for ruptures in other parts of the belly, and if it is at the beginning and does not proceed, then cauterize the rupture with a round cautery according to its size, and let the water that has been expelled from the intestine be as large as the third part of it; then dress him with what I have said, but do not use this remedy.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And some authors have previously stated that a rupture should be cauterized with a triangular cautery in the shape of an inverted triangle, as indicated by this diagram:
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	"And a line is placed that goes along the latitude in the side where the rupture occurs, and another line above it; then place your hand on a pointed cautery, but the first cautery should be lighter and better."
Capitol .xlvi.	Here's the translation of "Capitol XLVI":
De cauterizacio de torcio.	"For cauterization of a twisted [organ]."
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	"When pain occurs in certain members due to contusion or percussion and persists for a long time without improvement despite treatment with medicine, it is necessary to cauterize using a pointed cautery."
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	"And the cautery should be chosen according to the magnitude and smallness of the member, its strength and weakness, the location of the twist and the pain."
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	"If the first cautery does not heal it, then repeat the cautery; for such pains are often caused by a member adjacent to it being punctured, so that one should continue with cauteries until the ailment is healed."
Capitol .xlvii.	"Chapter XLVI."
De cauterizacio de lepra.	"For cauterization of leprosy."
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	"Some cases of leprosy are sometimes cauterized with little benefit, and especially if the type of leprosy is made by putrefaction of phlegm and melancholy."
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	"And therefore, when you wish to cauterize that person, consider whether the leprosy is dry and hardened as described in our division above. Do not give it, nor is it, if it has already begun to corrupt the whole body and all its completeness. Therefore, cauterize him on the head with five cauteries: one in the middle of the head, and another a little further from it towards the forehead; at both horns; and one behind on the nape or neck."
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	"Lastly, press the cautery a little deeper until it impresses on the bone with a small impression, and thus loosen the scales so that the expiration of thick vapors may be alleviated from him. And cauterize the chest according to what is necessary."
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	"And if the leprosy has already spread over the person and appears manifestly, then you should cauterize him with those cauteries which we have mentioned above in the head; and cauterize also on the tip of the nose, and with two cauteries on each cheekbone, and two cauteries on the two shoulder blades, and six cauteries on the spine of the back, and one large one over the spine near the buttocks, and one on the buttock itself, and two on the ankles, and one on each ankle, and two on the toes and one on each toe, and two on the knees, and two on the muscles, and two on the tendons of his feet. And cauterize him on all the joints of these members and feet, and on each heel of his feet."
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	"And beware of burning the nerves which are over the heel lest thou burn them."
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	"Sometimes it is necessary to cauterize with one cautery on the bone of the breastbone, and another over the mouth of the stomach, and yet another over the liver."
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	"And know that the more closely you apply the cauteries, the greater is the benefit and the more helpful it is. And know that the person does not feel pain from the cautery as others do, because his body has become numb."
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	"And it is necessary that the cauteries be large or small according to the members and joints as prescribed by the species of instruments used."
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"Next, care for the cautery with bran meal mixed with honey, and with other remedies until it is healed."
Capitol .xlviii.	Capítulo XLVIII.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	Chapter XLVIII. On cauterization for numbness
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	"When any member is paralyzed or numbed and is treated with medicines, oils, and plasters, but is not healed, then you should cauterize that paralyzed member with cauteries according to the size of the member or its smallness."
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	"And let your cautery enter the thickness of the skin a little."
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"Then treat it with ointment until it is healed."
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	"Sometimes some numbness which affects the hands and feet, and the spine of the back and elsewhere is cauterized, and by removing the impediment of the nerves which cause that member, the numbness is removed."
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	"But do not presume to do this except one who is knowledgeable in the anatomy of the members and the exit of the nerves throughout the whole body."
Capitol .xlix.	Capítulo XLIX.
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	Chapter XLIX. On cauterization for moles that are raised
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	"When moles are old and do not respond to any of the ointments of medicine, then cauterize over that with a preheated cautery a little according to the quantity of the thickness of the skin until its whiteness and color are removed and its color is changed."
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	"Then treat it with bran meal and lentil flour mixed with rose oil and with leaves of arnagosa, and with dove's blood or hen's blood, giving each one part and mixing them all together, and then wrap it with a cloth and place it on the spot until it is healed."
Capitol .l.	Capítulo L. De cauterizacio de cecas e catarros que son en les oeus.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	"Regarding cauterization of cancer."
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	"If cancer begins and you want to remove it, then cauterize the affected area with a round cautery tool in a circular motion around its perimeter."
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	"And the learned say that it should be cauterized with the last cautery in the middle of the wound; but I have not seen this, because I fear that it might ulcerate, and I have seen this happen on several occasions."
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	"And it is then more appropriate to cauterize the perimeter with circles as we have said before, or with many cauteries."
Capitol .li.	"Chapter fifty-two."
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	"Regarding the cauterization of hemorrhoids."
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	"When some hemorrhoids are delayed in maturation, and this is due to the superfluity causing them or the state of the illness, because it is old and decrepit with little blood or due to time, and you want to hasten the maturation of hemorrhoids; then cauterize around them with many small puncturing cauteries; and leave those alone that have already matured."
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	"But if you want the perforation to be made with a cautery, then heat that cautery of which this is the shape: and pause it in the middle of the hemorrhoid until it penetrates the cord."
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And if you heat that cautery on that spot which is a little higher up, so that the vein of the arm may be relieved; and then dress it until it heals."
Capitol .lii.	"Chapter fifty-three."
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	"Regarding the cauterization of eroding wounds."
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	"Erosion is wandering corruption in the member, which erodes it just as dry wood is consumed by fire."
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	"Therefore, if that erosion is in a place where it suffers cautery with fire, then heat small and large cautery nails according to what is convenient for that place where there is erosion."
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	"And then cauterize it throughout its entire extent until you have eradicated all the corrosion and nothing of it remains."
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	"And then leave it alone for three days, and apply over the cauterized places a plaster mixed with oil until all the scabs are eradicated and all the corruption."
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	"And then dress it with flesh-producing ointment."
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	"But if three days after that wound has healed with flesh without corruption, good. But if not, then repeat the cautery over what remains in the corrupted places."
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	"And erosion is sometimes treated with an acute medicine because it takes the place of cautery."
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	"But however, cautery with fire is easier to judge well."
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	"And I have already spoken about the treatment of it with an acute medicine in its division, and therefore take that when you begin with it."
Capitol .liii.	"Chapter fifty-four."
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	"Regarding the cautery of warts and similar conditions."
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	"Many times warts develop in the skin of the sick person that is called a 'claw,' which is a thick, penetrating cause that harms the skin. And there are two ways to cauterize them: with fire and with boiling water."
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	"But cautery with fire is done by heating the cautery cone-shaped like aulture's feather, which should be made of iron according to the size that corresponds to the wart throughout its entire extent, and it should be made of fine margins."
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	"And then pause that heated cautery on the wart, and then revolve your hand with the cautery around the circumference of the wart until it penetrates to the depth of the wart."
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	"Leave it alone for three days until it begins to suppurate."
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	"And then plaster that with wild mallows mixed with salt and leave the plaster on it for one night because it will eradicate its roots."
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	"And then dress the place with flesh-producing ointment until it is healed."
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	"And if it is not converted, and many times this happens on the surface of the body, more often in the breasts and thighs, then you must administer cautery with water there, which is done by taking a quill of bronze or iron orulture's feather and pausing that on the wart. And then pour some boiling water into the quill and keep your hand still, and revolve it with pressure from your whole hand so that the margin of the quill is pressed against the root of the wart, and allow the boiling water to pass through the front of the root of the wart. And wait for the sickness a little while for the biting of the boiling water for one hour, and then remove it because the wart with its roots will be eradicated."
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	"And do this to those and also do the other thing until you come upon all of those that are on their body."
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	"And then dress them afterwards, once the roots of the warts have been eradicated, with those ointments that cause flesh to grow."
Capitol .liiii.	"Chapter fifty-five."
De cauterizacio de tremor.	"Regarding cautery for trembling (tremor)."
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	"When trembling occurs due to heat in the nerve or from a fever caused by heat, or from another similar cause, then you must cauterize it with four cauteries or five on the vertebrae of the back, between each vertebra with one cautery; and also cauterize the sole of its foot and on its stomach with an olive-sized cautery."
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	"And trembling will subside and recovery from the feverish illness will be hastened."
Capitol .lv.	"Chapter fifty-six."
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	"Regarding cautery for accidental blotches on the skin."
