"And when you find that according to the manner I have described of its whiteness and length, you should make the patient lie down and press the tongue of it with an instrument which has been prepared for that purpose, and hold the onyx in the new wound, and pull it downward and incise it with one of two instruments which are mentioned in the incision of double mellas."
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	"And you should not incise it unless what is appropriate to its natural term without addition, for if you incise more than that, you will harm the patient."
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	"And after the incision, use what has been recommended in the incision of double mellas, and care for it until it is healed."
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	"But if the patient is frightened by the incision of it, you should use a hot iron in its cauterization without fear, and the manner of cautery in it is only with sharp water, which is that you hold the head of the patient on his right side, and then press the tongue of it with the instrument which has been mentioned, and take some of the water which has been mentioned in the chapter of cautery, and apply it with a live coal, pausing it neither thick nor thin, and from it fill the cavity of the instrument of which this is the shape:"
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	"So that the extremity of the cavity in which the medicine is placed is like the cavity of a spoon of ray, and pause the instrument with the medicine over the ulcer, and the patient should lie on his side so that saliva or mucus from the mouth does not fall into the interior of it through the intrusive medicine, lest it cause any harm to him."
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	"And then you place your hand on the medicine and squeeze it over the ulcer for about half an hour until you see that it has become blackened and dried by the biting of the medicine."
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	"And if you wish, take some cotton and wrap it around the extremity of the ray, and immerse the cotton in the medicine, and insert the ray with the cotton into a cannula from above until the cotton adheres to that cannula, and do this several times until you achieve what you want from the cauterization of the ulcer, and then leave it alone for it to dry and fall off after about three or four days."
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	"And if you need to repeat the medicine, repeat it, and after cauterization cleanse around the ulcer with cotton soaked in honey, and remove what is on the circuit of it from the medicine, rinse it with warm water, and then treat it externally with embrocation, and afterwards wrap it up until it has healed."
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	"And this type of treatment should be used with caution, incision and cautery should not be feared."
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	"Sometimes the uvula is cured with something more subtle than cautery and incision, for it is treated by suffumigation in this manner: take calamint, hyssop, origanum, rue, scabious arabic, chamomile, broad-leaved plantain and similar herbs of that kind, and adjust all those herbs, or some of them, in a pot, and immerse them in sour wine, and boil it; and the pot should be well covered with decent lutum, and in the middle of the pot there should be a tripod on which is placed a concave instrument made of silver or brass."
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	"And insert the extremity into the mouth of the patient so that the vapor can reach the uvula above it until the uvula is well suffused."
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	"And repeat this several times until it is dry, and be sure not to perform this treatment at the beginning of an eruption of abscesses, for that would stimulate the abscess too much, and you should not do that, but rather perform the treatment for the declaration of the abscess of it."
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	"But if you do not have this instrument at hand, then take a reed and make a closure of wax at the extremity of it, so that the mouth of the patient may be covered, for the closure of wax prevents the vapor from burning the mouth."
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	"And this treatment is good for health."
Capitol .xxxviii.	"Chapter XXXVI"
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	"Of the extraction of thorns and of what adheres in the throat, and of other causes."
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	"Often adhesions are found in the groin or spine of the foot due to some other cause."
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then you must remove what is apparent of it, upon which the sight falls, because when you press with the tongue on an instrument before the sun, it will be declared to you what is in the groove.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And what is not apparent and is hidden in the groove, you must make the patient vomit before the food has digested in the stomach, because very easily the cause attached to the groove will be forgotten by vomiting; or have the patient swallow a piece of bread dipped in oil or lettuce juice, or give them some dry breadcrumbs mixed with honey and salt; or take a piece of dried sea sponge, squeeze it well with wine, and have the patient swallow that, because when it gets to the place where its spines are extracted, they will be remembered then.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And if you take an eel and beat it well in wine, and place it within the table and suddenly extract it; or take a pot and suddenly put it in and suddenly remove it.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if those causes which we have mentioned are not forgotten, then do this with a lead instrument in the following way:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And let it be thicker than a little finger, and at its end make a cavity which you will insert into the groove with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And have the patient raise their head upwards, and make sure that your touch does not reach the bone of the throat, because if it did it would go into the body and with that which removes the bone or the spine, or what the physician touches with his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But nevertheless the patient should insert it themselves, by their knowledge of the place where the cause is attached and removed downwards, and they should pull their hand with the instrument upwards, all this according to the amount that has been prepared before it is forgotten.
Capitol .xxxix.	**Chapter XXXIX.**
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	Of the Extraction of Sanguisuga Attached to the Throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When sanguisuga is applied with what we have mentioned in the division of cure with medicines and it does not adhere, consider then at the throat of the patient in the sunlight, because you have prepared the tongue of it with the instrument which we have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Then if you see the sanguisuga, extract it with a small hook or with a gentle subtle movement accordingly.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible for you to extract it with that, then take a concave cannula and insert it into the throat of the patient, and carefully place within the concavity of the cannula an ignited iron brand, and do this several times (until the sanguisuga is dead and removed from the throat) and have the patient abstain from water all day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then take a vessel full of water, wet, and place the mouth of it upon that (the throat), and wash the mouth with it; and do not allow any cause to remain in it, and hold the water for an hour again with your hand, because the sanguisuga quickly feels the water.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not forgotten with what we have mentioned, then fumigate the patient with incense or with asafetida through the instrument which we have recommended in the fumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, so that they may recover.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And here is another way of operation in fumigation of that: Take an earthenware pot with burning coals inside it, and cover the pot with a lid which has a hole in its center, through which insert the end of the instrument; then begin the fumigation above; place the patient's mouth on the end of the cannula, close their mouth so that the fumigation is not wasted until you know that the fumigation has reached the sanguisuga, because the sanguisuga will soon fall.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not fall, then repeat the fumigation many times, and have the patient abstain from drinking, eat salty foods and drink water, and do not drink water; and thus it is necessary that with this regimen it should be forgotten.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which sanguisuga is extracted from the throat when it is seen: It resembles forceps thus, except that there is some curvature in it:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	"The one placed on the pestle has an extremity like the beak of a stork, which is called a glove, sharpened with a file."
Capitol .xl.	"The last chapter."
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	"In this one, the sum of the sermon regarding the opening and closing of apostemes is given."
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	"Apostemes are many species with many forms, according to what has been remembered about them, each one in this book."
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	"And thus they differ in perforation and section through two ways: one is by the means of gangrene, inserted within; and thereby we comprehend from moistures."
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	"And the second way is near the places where they occur, for gangrene occurring in the head is different from that in the buttocks; and gangrene in fatty tissue differs from that at joints; each has its own treatment through operation."
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	"And with regard to some gangrenes, it is necessary not to pierce them but rather wait for their maturation or completion of healing."
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	"And there are other gangrenes that must be pierced when they are hard and not ripe according to their completion, such as those near joints, for when gangrene comes near a joint, its nature is prolonged within what is in its circuit, and quickly the ligaments or nerves of that joint are corrupted, causing contraction of that limb. Or it may be near a main member, and if you delay piercing until it is ripe, there will be no harm to the main member. Or it may be near the anus, which should not be pierced unless it is hard and unripe, so that its opening does not extend into the inner parts of the anus and make a fistula."
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	"But you must know the time for piercing gangrene, which is when it is ripe."
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	"And you should know that gangrene is ripe when there is cessation of pain and fever, and around the time of decrease in redness and pulse, and when the head of the gangrene becomes sharp, and other signs."
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	"And it is necessary that you know that the piercing should be made near to the gangrene, at a place where there is little pus coming from the swelling."
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	"And piercing should always be done along the length of the flesh or body, if gangrenes are located in the parts of the thigh or leg, and in places where there are muscles, tendons, nerves, arteries, and especially in places where reflection is not present; for those that are reflected upon, use piercing according to that member."
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	"But when the gangrene is in a fleshy place, it is better to leave piercing until digestion of it is confirmed according to completion, as we have said; for if you pierce it before that time, the course of the passage from it is prolonged and much filth flows out, and quickly its lips become hardened and its depth increases."
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	"But some gangrenes are pierced according to the width of the flesh or body when necessary, or according to what that member needs."
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	"And it is necessary that you make a small piercing in small gangrenes, and a large piercing with wide incisions or many sections according to the diversity of the size of the gangrenes."
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	"And there are other gangrenes in which the cord should be curved and cut when it is made, so that it is finished at once like bread dough, as was done with troches of dewlap and buboes."
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	"And of those that are incised with three angles in section; and there are those in which it is incised like the figure of a mitre leaf, as with gangrenes on the angle."
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	"And there are some in which round section and crescent section are used, similar to those."
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	"But that one to which gangrenes do not extend like lion's paws on the surface, it is necessary for you to pierce it with superficial or flat piercing alone."
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	"And when the gangrene is large and has collected much pus, it is necessary for you to pierce it but do not try to extract all the pus at that time. Extracting a part of it and then packing the gangrene the following day, extracting more each time until it is completely drained."
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	"And especially if the patient is an elderly person of weak virtue, or a pregnant woman, or a small child, or an old man in decrepitude, for the animal spirit is often resolved with the exit of the pus, and quickly the patient dies, and you operate thus."
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	"Therefore guard this chapter with great caution, and also the piercing that you make in these gangrenes, making sure to cleanse the wounds and consider whether the wound of the gangrene is small or has a flat section. If it is small, use linen or cotton dressings; but if it is large and the incisions of the piercing are many, then pause in each traction until they come together simultaneously."
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"And if in the gangrene a part of the cord is cut off or curved in its circuit, it is necessary for you to fill it with old cotton or thread made from linen cloth, like when baking bread or cakes without moisture; and strengthen that on the third day; and then process it and cure it with what is necessary for other wounds until it is healed."
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	"But if bleeding occurs during your operation, then use a cloth wrung out in cold water and vinegar and place it on the location of the bleeding many times."
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	"But if the bleeding persists, it is necessary for you to apply regimen and cure and powders which have been recommended in many places of this book and division."
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	"But if it is during wintertime and the location of the gangrene has many nerves, then you should make a poultice with hot wine and oil and apply it to those locations."
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	"And if it is during summer and the locations are fleshy, then you should apply poultices made with water and oil or wine and oil, all of which has been cooked until the third day as we have said, and then drain the gangrene, cleanse it, and apply to its cure what is necessary for it until it is healed."
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	"And this is what is necessary regarding the knowledge of the cure of gangrenes universally; but according to the way of distinction I have already said how each gangrene should be cured specifically in its own chapter."
Capitol .xli.	Chapter XL.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of sectioning gangrenes that occur on the neck of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the chain of the small head, posthemas appear, which are species of knots containing tunics that are made by them; and their species are many.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And among them are pimples, and those contain moisture like lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And there are those which contain moisture resembling dust, similar to them; and those that are stony, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all, and in the extraction of these there is no fear, since the extraction of them does not cause harm to the art.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in section of those is that you should spread them with an instrument whose shape is like this [drawing], called entromes, until you see that it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what it contains is moisture, then immediately cut it with a section along its length into a surface section according to this shape:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begin at the section of line .B. up to line .G. Then, once the moisture has been evacuated, immediately you should excoriate that by which that moisture was contained, and do not leave any cause of it, because viewed troops return if there remains any cause.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And quickly immerse it in Egyptian cement, if available, and if not, in water and salt. Then fill it with that and leave it for another day, because with this you will corrode all that which remains of that skin layer.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And again apply that cement on it second and third times if necessary, until you are confident that there remains no trace of that skin layer. Then cure the wound with ointment until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	"And if an abscess contains fatty knots, then you should incise it in this manner:"
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	"And if the section has a cross shape, then insert your needle between its two lips and cut it completely,
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	"If your arrow should go awry, then do what I have told you first."
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	"And similarly, perform the operation and treatment of an indurated ulcer according to what we have told you; for incision over an indurated ulcer is easier because it involves less blood and fluid."
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	"And sometimes some of these ulcers are found on the head in certain men who have no moisture at all. The cause is that one once incised an ulcer on the head of an old woman and pushed the ulcer together like a hard, rough, white stone, which could not be opened, and if anyone were struck by it, it would injure them."
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	"But in other accidental ulcers on the head, this is not the case, such as those that come to the heads of children and at the roots of the ears; but the incision of these should always be a superficial one."
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	"And pause the perforation of those that are in the lower parts, since it is intended to alleviate the body from the excessive heat in the lower parts."
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	"And accordingly treat those with what is appropriate for that kind of treatment."
Capitol .xlii.	Capital Forty-Two
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Of the section on scrofula which occurs in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	These abscesses usually occur in the neck, armpits, and groin; however, sometimes they may occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur in the neck are many that are generated between them, and all scrofula of these is within its own tunic, as in the nodes and abscesses of the head, as we have discussed.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the kinds of these scrofula are many; for some are hard and stone-like, others contain moisture, while still others are malignant and do not respond to treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, in that which you find to have good disposition upon touching it, whose color is similar to that of bone and is hard throughout, not annexed to the nerve of the neck, nor to the veins or artery, then incise it with a superficial cut from above to below along the line GA across the line GB, and scrape it away completely, extending the lips of the wound with tweezers, or several tweezers if necessary, as we have said regarding the abscesses of the head, and remove it bit by bit.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more caution that the vein or nerve be not incised.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And let the spatula not be too sharp, lest it hurt your hand during the incision or cause further injury, and do not incise that which does not need to be incised; for if you should cut a vein or artery and interrupt your operation, then quickly apply cupping vessels or other powders that stop bleeding, and dress the wound, letting it rest until the inflammation of the abscess has decreased and the wound begins to heal.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When blood is discharged
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation once you have completed this step.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	"And then you shall ask with your little finger if there is any cause of the other small sores, and then cut those and cleanse them."
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	"And if it's in the area of a large vein, take care not to incise that scrophulus from its root."
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	"Then you must press it with doubled cloth firmly and let it fall inwards without injury."
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	"And then fill the wound with cotton wool that you have already moistened in Egyptian ointment, and then dress it."
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	"And if you cut that scrophulus entirely, then take care to join the two lips of the wound and dress it immediately afterwards so that there is no excess oozing left."
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	"But if there is too much oozing due to the size of the scrophulus, then you should extend your incision towards its root, and draw it out and administer sutures as directed."
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	"And those scrophulas that contain moisture should be perforated with a superficial perforation where you see the point of maturation, and pause the perforation when you have expressed enough pus from beneath the skin, as we have said."
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	"And then administer an ointment and dressings similar to those used for ulcers, so that it may cauterize what has come out from the perforation."
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	"And when you see that the wound is already clean, then dress it with a healing ointment for flesh until it has healed."
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter XLIII
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of the incision of the head of an accidental impostume in the throat.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	"Ancients called this section 'epilepsy,' but we have not seen anyone in our land who has had it."
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	"And this is the inscription of their sermon."
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	"And in men, epilepsy should be avoided because its extraction does not bring healing since all the veins and major vessels of the patient are here."
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	"But in those who have scabs caused by the mouth or ear, when the illness is not on the bone, it is necessary to avoid the section of epilepsy to prevent harm that occurs by suffocation."
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	"So when we want this, that we incise the epilepsy three or four circles of the circles of epilepsy, or with a small section across it in one who is between two circles in quantity, let the section be on the bone, not on the cartilage, and this place is convenient for sectioning because it is devoid of flesh and blood vessels from its surroundings."
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	"And if the doctor is inexperienced, it is necessary to extend the ear canal with forceps and carefully split the canal until it reaches the auditory canal, but avoid the blood vessels if there is any cause for this."
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	"And then incise the cartilage as recommended earlier; this is indicated on the section of the auditory canal by the membrane that is from there and which is from its disruption and for the extraction of pus."
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	"Then leave the wound open for some time."
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	"So when the time is removed at which perforation is feared, add two lips of the edge of the wound and cover only the cartilage."
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	"And then apply medications that promote tissue growth so that it may heal."
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	"And Albucasis says that the essence of what has been recommended is to see that some of these abscesses have already obstructed the ear canal of the patient, and the disease has come inside causing death, and the air passage has been cut off, and some go to incise the epiglottis so that the patient may breathe over the wound for some breath, and be saved from death."
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	"And for this reason it is commanded to leave the wound open until the malignancy of the disease is consumed; and the malignancy lasts for three days; and then it is commanded to close the wound, and heal that until it may be healed."
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	"And what I have seen with my own eyes is that a woman took a knife and inserted it into her ear and incised herself with it through the auditory canal of the lung, and I was called to treat her, and when I arrived I found that she was dead like one who has died, and I discovered the wound and extracted some blood which had issued from the wound."
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	"So I was convinced that she had not cut any vein or artery, and the wind came out from the wound, and I healed it until it was healed."
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	"And nothing happened to the woman if she had not had something in her voice, and some days later she returned for an improvement of her condition."
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	"And now you say that there is no fear in the section of the epiglottis."
Capitol .xliv.	"Chapter .xlv."
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	"About an incision for an abscess that occurs in the external ear canal, and is called a herniation of the ear."
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	"This abscess named hernia of the ear is a large abscess according to the color of the body, and it is common in women."
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	"And it occurs in two ways, either naturally or accidentally."
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	"And in the natural [way], it does not arise to be cured."
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	"And the accidental [way] is of two kinds: one is similar to fatty nodes, and the other kind is similar to an abscess which is made by the bursting of an artery, and in this there is danger."
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	"And it is only necessary to perform incision with iron on that which is asked for."
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And then you examine it and investigate it with the finger, and if you find it similar to fatty nodes, and it is not suspended from any of the veins, then you incise it like nodes, and extract it with what contains it of skin and bursicle; but if not, then the whole thing is explored, and then the place is treated with whatever is necessary for treatment until it may be healed."
Capitol .xlv.	"Chapter .xlv."
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	"About section of kinds of nodes."
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	"There are many species of nodes, and I have already mentioned all the species of them in the division."
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	"And it is necessary that I recount thus the difference between a node and an exitura in case there may be doubt."
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	"I say that in an exitura there is heat and fever and violent pains until the ebullition of the superfuities is quieted; but it is completed putrefaction which now ceases the fever, pain and heat."
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	"But in a node there is neither heat nor fever nor pain, and it contains only chyle or lymph which is proper to the sac."
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	"And according to the color of the body, and its beginning is like a pea and it becomes thus like an empty sac, whether large or small, and they are of two kinds: either fatty and containing moisture, and the colors of the moisture are many, as I have said in the division."
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	"Therefore, when you arrive at the treatment of a node, it is necessary to examine it and inquire into its beginning with an instrument which is called an introser, according to what will come in the following chapter on this subject."
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	"And this is the manner of inquiry for abscesses and all kinds of nodes: you take this instrument and introduce it into the moistest place which you find in the abscess, and you turn your finger little by little until you know that the instrument has penetrated the channel."
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	"And then lastly you extend your hand according to the measure of the size of the abscess, and then extract the introser and consider what is issued in the trace of it."
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	"And if running moisture is found, of whatever color it may be, then you incise it with a superficial section as I have said in other abscesses."
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	"But if there is no moisture in the trace of the introser, then know that it is fatty."
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	"And cut it with an incision having the shape of a cross thus:"
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	"As I have shown you, and suspend it with forceps, and strip the channel from all sides with ease, and preserve the skin or sac if possible over it, and extract that sanies along with the node."
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	"But if it is broken during the operation, then it is not possible to extract that sanies, and many times you will find there nothing, and then you extract it piece by piece until none remains."
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	"For if any cause remains of it, a little or much, the node returns according to its nature."
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And if you find that some small part of it remains, then fill the wound with some powdery acid caustic and strengthen the dressing, and apply over that which makes an abscess cure, and treat it with another treatment until it may be healed."
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	"If it is a large node, then cut the two lips of it and cure it with what heals."
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	"But if a pulsating vein is found near it, either pulsating or non-pulsating, then apply a compress and humidify the wound with triplets of treacle for two days or three until the dressing can dry out and the boiling of the blood may calm down; and then return to cutting away what remains of the node."
Capitol .xlvi.	"Chapter .xlvi."
De las formas del sturmentz necessaris en seccio e perforacio.	"About the forms of instruments necessary for section and perforation."
De aquels so las formas dels intromesas, e so de tres specias, que de aquels es alcu gran, e de lor es migier, e de lor es petit.	"There are three kinds of introseres, that is to say the large ones, the medium ones, and the small ones."
La forma de intromes gran es aquesta:	The great form of entering is this:
La forma de intromes migier es aquesta:	The middle form of entering is this
La forma de intromes petit es aquesta:	The small form of entering is this
Sian faytz de ferr, de alfulud, de extremitatz cayradas decentment, per so que festino le intrament en les apostemas.	They should have feet of iron, of almond-shaped, and well-shaped extremities, so that they may quickly enter the openings.
E aquestas so las formas dels experientz, e son nompnatz albered, e un de aquels es apelat berid.	And these are the forms of the experienced ones, and they are named Alberich, and one of them is called Berith.
E so de tres especias, quar de lor es gran, migier e pauc.	And there are three spices: large, middle-sized, and small.
La forma de experient gran, forma de lu:	The form of great experience is this:
La forma de experient migier, forma de lu:	The form of experiencing evil, the form of it:
La forma de experient pauc, forma de lu:	The form of experiencing little, the form of it
Conveneysso que sian per aquels apostemas e exituras e fistulas e bubos per so que entre aquelas so dels osses e de autras causas.	It is convenient that they should be for those apostemes and exits and fistulas and buboes, so that between those are of the bones and other causes.
E so faytz redontz, grosses, leons, ayssi cum grans agulhas am las quals son cosidas las selhas, e son faytas de eram citri, o de eram o de ferr, o de argent, E las milhors so quan so faytas de eram citri.	And so they are made redontz, thick, large, like big needles with which the stitches are sewn, and they are made of lemon wood, or of oak, or of iron, or of silver. The best ones are when they are made of lemon wood
E son faytz les experient de plum negre, les quals se acordan que per aquels sian ubertas las fistulas en la conquavitat de las quals so reflexios, que sian reflectidas am la sua levitat am aquelas refleccios.	And they are made of black lead, which should be opened for those fistulas in the concavity of which reflections are reflected, that they may be reflected with their levitation with those reflections.
E so de tres specias, quar alcus de lor so loncs, e dels autres migiers, e dels autres breus, segon la quantitat del ample de la fistula e de la strictura de lu.	And there are of three kinds: some of them are long, others medium, and others short, according to the quantity of the width of the fistula and the narrowness of it.
Forma del experient gran de plom:	Form for a large lead plug:
Forma del experient migier de plom:	"Method for the experiment of lead."
Forma del experient petit de plom:	"Method for the experiment of small amounts of lead"
Las formas dels oncis so de motas specias, quar de aquels so alcus simples, als quals es una curvitat solament, e so de tres specias: grans, paucs e migiers.	"The shapes of the rings are of several species, because some are simple ones, which are only a curvature, and they are of three kinds: large, few, and medium."
E de lor so uncis orps, e so de tres specias.	"And among these, there are circular rings, and they are of three kinds."
E de aquels so uncis haventz doas curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	"Among those that have two curvatures, there are also three kinds."
E de lor so haventz tres curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	"And among those with three curvaturas, there are again three kinds."
E totz aquetz so necessaris en lor loc.	"And all of these are necessary in their places."
Forma de unci simple gran, forma de lu:	"Shape of large simple ring, shape of light:"
Forma de unci simple migier:	"Form for medium-sized simple ring."
Forma de unci simple pauc, forma de lu:	"Form for small simple ring, shape of light:"
Forma de unci orp gran:	"Shape of large circular ring:"
Forma de unci orp migier, forma de lu:	"Shape of medium-sized circular ring, form of light:"
Forma de unci orp pauc, forma de lu:	"Shape of small circular ring, shape of light:"
Forma de unci gran havent dos curvaturas:	"Shape of large ring with two curvatures:"
Forma de unci migier havent dos curvatas:	"Shape of medium-sized ring with two curvatures:"
Forma de unci pauc havent dos curvaturas:	"Shape of small ring with two curvatures:"
Forma de unci gran havent tres curvaturas:	"Shape of large ring with three curvatures:"
Forma de unci migier havent tres curvaturas:	"Form for medium-sized ring with three curvatures."
Forma de unci pauc havent tres curvaturas:	"Form for small ring with three curvatures."
E aquestas so las formas dels scalpels am les quals son seccatz e scorjatz les nodes e le apostemas, e so de tres specias, quar de aquels es gran, migier, e pauc.	"And these are the shapes of the scalpels used to cut and scrape nodes and apostemes, and they come in three species: large, medium, and small."
Forma de scapel gran:	"Form for large scalpel:"
Forma del scapel migier:	"Shape of medium-sized scalpel:"
Forma de scapel pauc:	"Form for small scalpel:"
Las extramitatz de aquels am les quals es fayta seccio so agudas e las autres extramitatz so no-agudas, e no so pausadas en tal manieyra, sino per que sia fayt juvament en la excorjacio dels nodes la temor de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e per aquels sia sanat le malaute e atrobe tranquilitat un petit per la adustio la qual atroba deves la excoriacio del apostema.	"The extremities of those with which section is made are sharp, and the other extremities are not-sharp, and they are not paused in such a way that there might be fear of incising a vein or nerve during scraping of nodes, and so that the malady may be healed and tranquility obtained a little by cauterization which follows the excision of the aposteme."
E aquestas son las formas de almagidas, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc, ayssi cum veyras.	"And these are the shapes of spatulas, and they come in three species: large, medium, and small, as you see:"
La forma de magda gran:	"The shape of large spatula:"
Forma de magda migier:	"Form for medium-sized spatula:"
Forma de magda pauc:	"Shape of small spatula:"
Sian faytas de eram e so semblantz de ray am le qual e fayt alcofol.	"They are made of iron and resemble a rod with which alcohol is made."
E es en la extramitat lada punctada am spatum occultada e en aquela corr a las partidas dedintz e defora, quan tu vols, ayssi cum veses.	"And at the pointed extremity there is a hole hidden by the spatula and through that hole you can insert or remove sutures as you wish."
Las formas de spatimis, les quals so amaguatz entre los ditz deves la perforacio dels apostemas e no les percebo les malautes, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc.	"The shapes of spatulas, which are used between the said ones for the perforation of apostemes and do not cause harm, come in three species: large, medium, and small."
E aquestas so las formas de aquels:	"And these are the shapes of them:"
Las formas de ventozas am las quals es abscindit le flux del sanc, e so de tres specias; gran, migiera e pauca; las formas de lu:	"The shapes of forceps used to remove blood flow and come in three species: large, medium, and small. The forms are as follows:"
Sian faytas de eram citri, redondas am alcuna longitut , e sian subtils.	"They are made of citric iron, round with some length, and they are subtle."
E cove que sian aquestas specias de ventosas deves tu grans, migieras e paucas, per so que per aquelas abscindas flux de sanc am velocitat en necessitat, e lahoras quan a tu primieyrament no es medicina.	"And it is necessary that these species of forceps come in sizes large, medium, and small, so that by means of them blood flow can be removed quickly when needed, especially when there is no medicine at hand."
Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz.	"However, do not use those for removing blood from all parts of the body, and only use them in fleshy locations, such as in the joints of thighs and buttocks, elbows and nipples, belly button, and similar moist flesh."
E alcunas veguadas son faytz de aquels strumentz autres petitz semblantz scorsas de fisacs segon aquesta forma; per les quals lo sanc es abscindit quan es fayt per fleubotomia, o deves inscizio de vena o de arceria.	"And sometimes those instruments are made of small pieces resembling fishhooks in this shape: with them blood is removed when it is done by phlebotomy or through incision of a vein or artery."
E alcunas veguadas son faytas redondas segon aquesta forma:	"And sometimes they are made round like this:"
Capitol .xlvii.	"Chapter XLVI."
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	"Of the care of men's nipples, which resemble those of women."
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	"Sometimes the nipples of some men become swollen during sleep and begin to resemble those of women or even appear like apostemes from afar."
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And if you encounter such a case, you should incise it with a crescent-shaped incision according to this form, from line B to line G, and then excise all the thickness, apply a poultice of caustic medication, and finally close the wound with sutures. Care for it until it is healed."
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	"But if the nipple leans towards its outer parts and becomes soft due to its size, as it happens in women, then it should be split into two parts lengthwise with two crescent-shaped incisions, each contained within the other at their ends so that the larger line contains the smaller one according to this form: from line B to line G. Then excise the node between the two lips of the wound, remove the suppuration, and administer what has been said about sutures and powders as necessary in its care until it is healed."
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And if you do not perform the incision that is necessary due to the turmoil of the ailment and blood flow, then you should apply a poultice of soft cotton soaked in corrosive ointment and leave it on until it has eaten away what is necessary. Then care for it until it is healed."
Capitol .xlviii.	"Chapter XLVIII."
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	"Of the perforation of apostemes that come from the sides of the testicles."
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	"Those apostemes that arise from the sides of the testicles are of the species called scrofulas, hard ones which contain a point that can be extracted."
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	"And among those are some that contain moisture; and those that contain moisture should be incised with a crescent-shaped incision according to this figure: from line G to line B. And when all the sanious matter has been evacuated, then fill it with soft cotton and leave it alone for another day."
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	"And then the cotton should be removed and the wound cared for with appropriate ointment until it is healed."
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	"And if the aposteme is of the species called nodes or scrofulas, then incise it as we have said in the section on the treatment of scrofulous swellings."
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	"But if the wound has spread to the point of being difficult to heal, then apply cautery according to what we have said about it earlier."
Capitol .xlix.	"Chapter XLIX."
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	"Of the incision of apostemes that occur by means of an artery or a vein."
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	"When an artery is broken and the cord above it becomes consolidated, then often an aposteme occurs. The signs by which it is known that inflammation and aposteme are due to an artery or a vein: for when an apostema is caused by an artery, it is long and adherent in front of the body; and if you press on the apostema with your fingers, you will feel a creaking noise."
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	"And one that is due to a vein appears on the surface of the body."
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	"But the incision of this aposteme is an error, especially in those that are located near the armpits, groin, neck, and many other parts of the body; and it is very large, so its cure with iron should be avoided. And one that is on the extremities or the head should be avoided."
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	"But regarding those that occur due to inflammation of the sheath of an artery, incise along its length and then widen the incision with forceps and expose the artery. Then free it from its sheaths until it is completely exposed."
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	"And then place that needle on the other side and make it penetrate until it reaches the other side. Then tie the artery with double thread in two places, which will cause you to be able to extract two arteries that are located near the temples."
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	"And then pierce the place that is between two ligaments with a spit until all the blood comes out and the abscess is dissolved."
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	"And then apply treatment that causes putrefaction between the fallen ligaments, and properly care for him until he is healed."
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	"And if it is an abscess caused by the section of a vein, then you should hold with your hand what is nearest to the abscess on the skin, and then insert the needle where you have held it with your hand, causing it to penetrate; and be careful to make that hole double until you extract the blood from the other side, and then tie the abscess with good ligaments according to what I told you in the grapevine of two parts with two ends of the thread."
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	"But if you fear that the thread may come out, then insert the needle with the thread into the entire abscess through the first incision of the needle, and tighten your threads in four places."
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	"And then dry the abscess in the middle of it until what is inside comes out, and then incise the superfluity of the skin, allowing that which remains to remain tied."
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"And then place over it some powder that you have moistened in wine and oil, and then apply the treatment which is done with hot water and fomentations until he is healed."
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	**Chapter on Abscesses That Occur Due to Twisting of Nerves**
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	"Thus when an aposteme occurs in the artery and vein, similarly it occurs in the nerves upon percussion or through excessive labor."
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	"And it happens mostly in the places of the assistants or the heel, or in any place where one twists the joints."
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	"A large abscess has formed, resembling the color of other flesh, and is located in the thighs. When pressed with great force, it causes the patient to feel as if they are stunned."
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	"It is not an abscess attached to the front of the body; therefore it is left behind. It moves with every part and does not go before nor behind."
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	"Therefore, those that are located in the joints need not be treated with iron, for it would cause too much stiffness."
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	"But one that is on the head or forehead should be opened with a scalpel."
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	"However, if it is a small abscess, lance it with hot iron and excise it with a scalpel at its root."
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And if it is large, then suspend it with a hook, excise it, and remove its outer skin. Then approximate the wound edges and adjust them with sutures. And care for it until it heals."
Capitol .li.	"Chapter 52."
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	"To cut open an abscess that has occurred on the cheek which has occurred on the belly."
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	"Also some men are seen to have warts on their bellies and on other parts of their body which are called fungals due to their similarity with those that have mushrooms; the cause of which is subtle and the head of that is large. And the lips of them are turned, and it is among those that are small, and it is among those that are greatly magnified."
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	"And I have already seen one, and on his belly were two things that resembled mushrooms very much, and there was no difference between them in terms of their whiteness and small size."
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	"And the lips of those were turned inward and split open, and moisture ran from it all the time."
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	"So I cut them open and removed one weighing eighteen ounces and the other weighing six ounces."
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	"And the operation in the incision of them is that you should consider whether the illness is humid, and the color of the skin is white, humid, and of subtle size. Then you should cut it open with a broad spatula, and have cauteries ready in the fire before you, because many times what is expelled from the section is much blood; and if blood comes to you, cauterize that."
