E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	"And of those things, one is like the glans penis, round, and its extraction is easy."
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	"Therefore, if it is that which has angles and margins, adjust it in the opening [incision]."
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	"And if it is not thus forgotten [removed], then you should press upon it or press upon it with gentle pressure using a tool like a chisel whose end is curved and does not slip away, or else insert into there a thin instrument with a curved extremity."
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	"But if you cannot press upon it, then widen the opening a little and if you see blood flow, cut through that with gentle pressure using tripled vitriol."
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	"But if the stone is larger than one, then at first you press your hand on the mouth of the bladder and cut through there; then press a little more on it; and similarly do this if there are many stones."
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	"And if the stone is very large, then it would be ignorance to cut through that with a large incision because one of two things happens to the patient: either it becomes accustomed [to the condition] or it continues with the distillation of urine, because the place is not completely solidified."
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	"But instead administer expulsion of it from within so that it may be forgotten [removed], or press on the fracture of it with forceps in order to extract it piece by piece."
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	"Therefore, once you have completed your operation, then fill the wound with cloths of Aloes and dragon's blood, and press upon it."
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	"And place over that a linen cloth dipped in oil and wine or in rose oil and fresh water so that a cauterizing blister may be formed."
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	"Then let the patient lie on their back for three days without removing the stitches."
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	"And once that has been removed, wash the place with water and much oil and then treat it with a fine liniment and a liniment of Diabazilon until it is healed."
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	"But if an aposteme caut and corrosive forms in the wound, resembling as if the blood is congealed in the bladder, and because of this urine is prohibited (and this is known by the exit of blood with urine), then insert your finger into the wound and extract that blood, for if it remains it will cause corruption of the bladder and its putrefaction."
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And then wash the wound with sour wine, water, and salt, and apply any opposite [remedy] that is suitable for healing until it is healed."
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	"And during all the time of the treatment, you should lie with both thighs raised and adjust the medications which have been placed on the place."
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And if the stone is small and in the middle of the penis, embedded in it, and urine cannot be expelled, then treat it with what I recommend before you come to an incision, because many have been cured by this treatment; and here it is: Take a pointed awl made of iron, whose form is as follows:"
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	"with a triangular extremity, sharp, inserted into wood."
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	"And then take pitch and tie it with that to the penis below the stone so that it does not return to the bladder."
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	"And then insert the iron into the penis, easily penetrating until the awl reaches that stone."
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	"And gradually turn the borer with your hand in that small opening until you've pierced through it so the other side can penetrate; for urine is then released."
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	"And press your hand over what has been broken off from the opening of the stone outside the penis, because that is constricted and forgotten with urine, and the patient will be healed."
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	"But if this treatment is not suitable for some reason which prevents it from being done, then place a bandage on either side of the stone."
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	"And cut into the stone with that penknife between two ligatures."
E aprop extratz aquela.	"And pull it out."
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	"And untie the ligature and clean the blood clots, which are formed in the wound."
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	"And there is no need for a bandage on either side of the stone, except to prevent it from returning to the bladder, and the upper ligature prevents blood loss when it is untied near the entrance of the stone."
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	"And therefore, when you tie the upper ligature, it is necessary that you elevate the cord above the ligatures so that it does not return to its place and cover the wound as we have said."
Capitol .lxi.	"Chapter 61:"
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	"On the extraction of stones from women."
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	"Stones are rarely formed in women."
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	"But if a stone is found in one of them, it is difficult to treat it and there are many prohibitions regarding its treatment."
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	"The first prohibition is that women have delicate genitals."
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	"And the second is because you cannot find a woman who willingly reveals herself to the doctor if she is chaste or has been married."
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	"The third is that it is difficult to find a woman who knows this art well, especially regarding the operation of a stone with the hand."
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	"And the fourth is that the location of the section for removing stones from women is far from the location of the stone, which requires a deep incision and causes fear."
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	"But if necessity compels you to do so, then it is necessary that you find a woman midwife who knows well how to perform the operation and is not easily embarrassed."
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	"But if you are deprived of that option, then seek a skilled and subtle male midwife, or present an experienced woman midwife who is versed in the ways of women, or a woman who has some knowledge of this art."
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	"So bring that woman to you and command her to do everything that you order regarding the examination of the stone at the beginning; which is done to determine whether the woman is a virgin. If she is, then it will be necessary for her to insert her finger into the woman's vagina and seek out the stone."
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	"So if she finds it, then remove her finger and then command her to insert the probe on it."
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	"But if she is not a virgin, then command the midwife to insert her finger into the patient's vagina and seek out the stone, since she can place her left hand on the bladder and compress it well."
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	"So if she finds it, then gradually move her finger from the opening of the bladder towards its entrance, using all your strength until you reach the desired goal."
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	"And when you have reached that position, insert the probe on it, placing your finger behind the opening of the vagina where the stone is located. Keep your finger pressed against the stone until you remove the probe."
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	"The incision should be small at the beginning. Then insert the probe into that incision and if you feel the stone, adjust the size of the incision according to the quantity that you know will come out from there."
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	"And know that stones are of many kinds: some are small and large, sharp and smooth, long and round, and have branches."
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	"So you should know how many kinds there are by what you have indicated regarding what you want to know."
E si tu veus flux de sanc, ajusta en le loc vetriol trissat e te aquela per una hora entro que sia abscindit le sanc, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	"If you see bleeding, apply a bandage soaked in vinegar and hold it there for one hour until the bleeding stops. Then return to your operation until the stone is removed."
E fay que prepares am tu dels instrumentz les quals e ditz en la extraccio de peyra en les homes, per so que sias ajudat per aquels en la tua operacio.	"And make sure you have prepared the instruments that are mentioned in the extraction of stones from men, so that they may assist you in your operation."
E si tu veus flux de sanc, e sabes que la expulcio del sanc es de la arceria que es insciza, lahoras tu pausa polvera sobre le loc e estrenh aquel am pulvils e strictura descent, e no iteras aquo; e layssa la peyra e no extraguas aquela, quar fort leu morira la malauta.	"If you see bleeding and know that the expulsion of blood is from the incision made in the urethra, then apply powder to the location and strain it with dry bread crumbs and stricture descent. Do not repeat this action; leave the stone and do not extract it, for otherwise the patient will die."
E aprop cura la plagua.	"And then dress the wound."
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	"So when the sharpness of the bleeding has subsided after several days and the location is healed, then return to your operation until the stone is removed."
Capitol lxii.	Chapter LXII.
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	Of incision for strangulated hernia.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	A strangulated hernia is nothing but an aggregation of moisture in the white sac that is outside the abdomen containing the intestines, and it is called a "sac."
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	Sometimes it is seen in the proper paniculus that Nature prepares for him at the time of birth, even though it might be another one; and this is the cord of the genitourinary system between the white cicatrix which we have mentioned, but this is not all.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	The cause of this hernia is weakness which occurs in the genitals, causing that matter to protrude through them, and sometimes it happens due to a blow received on the genitals.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	This fluid has various colours, for its colour can lean towards citrine or sanguineous red, or brown, or it can be blackish-feculent or watery-white.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the signs by which it is known where this accumulation of water is located are these: for if it is in the white cicatrix that we have mentioned, then the swelling will be somewhat elongated and egg-shaped, and the genitals will appear, as the fluid contains them on all sides.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	And if the fluid is in the proper paniculus, then the swelling will be round like an egg and it is estimated that it is another testicle.
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the fluid is between the cord of the genitals and the white cicatrix, then the sensation will be to the left.
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And if you wish to know the colour of the fluid, then press on the colour of the fluid in the swelling with a thin catheter whose form is preceded; and according to what appears in the trace of the interior, judge what lies beneath it.
Donc quan nos vinem a la curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que comandem al malaute que sia fleubotomat si aquo es a tu possibla, e vezes le cos de lu ple.	Therefore when we come to the treatment of it with iron, then we must command the patient to be flebotomized if this is possible for him, and empty the body of it completely.
E aprop sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos sobre alcuna causa un pauc auta, e pausa dejos lu motz draps.	And let him lie on his back on some cause a bit higher up, and place to the left a few cloths.
E aprop setz tu sobre la part sinistra de lu, e comanda al ministra que segua a la dextra de lu, le qual extenda la sua vergua a hun de dos latz a la codena dels genetius e a la partida del mirac del ventre.	And then you sit on the left side of him and command the minister to stand on the right side of him, who will extend his whip hand to one of two latts at the cord of the genitals and at the parting of the navel of the abdomen.
E aprop pren spatum lat e scindeys la codena dels genetius del mieg loc per la longitut entro prop le pentenilh.	And then take a broad knife and cut the cord of the genitals from the middle place along its length, close to the penis.
E sia fayta la seccio segon rectetut engualment distant de la linha que deveseys la pel dels genetius, entro que pervengua al ciphac blanc comprehendent.	"Make an incision according to the rule, evenly spaced from the line where you should grasp the skin of the genitals, until it reaches the white navel."
E excorja aquel, e observa, e guarda te per aysso que tu no inscidas aquel; e la tua excoriacio am la qual aquel excorjas per partida jassia que sia suspenduda am le huou mays e subtilment escruta am la excoriacio segon la quantitat a tu possibla.	"Remove that, observe it, and be careful not to cut it. The removal should be done gently yet skillfully, with the amount of skin removed being as much as possible."
E aprop perfora le ciphac ple de aygua am perforacio ampla, e extratz tota l’aygua.	"Next, perforate the belly full of water with a wide perforation and extract all the water."
E aprop separa entre doas labias de la seccio am uncis, e exten le ciphac a las partidas desus; e no toques la codena les genetius comprehendent, e inscideys le ciphac en aquela manieyra que es a tu possible.	"Next, separate the two lips of the incision with forceps and extend the belly at its sides. Do not touch the cord connecting the genitals, and make your incision in this manner as much as is possible."
E inscideys aquel am la sua totalitat o en pessas, e majorment le sieu latz subtil, quar si tu no perscrutas exquisidament la inscizio de lu, no es fayta segurtat que la aygua no retorne.	"And incise it completely or in pieces, especially its sides subtly, for if you do not examine the incision carefully, it is not certain that the water will not return."
Mays si le huou procezeys de aquela defora de la sua codena en la ora de la tua operacio, lahoras quan tu auras complida la seccio del ciphac, retorna dedintz aquel, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la codena dels genetius am sutura, e aprop cura aquel ayssi cum las autras plagua, entro que sia sanat.	"But if you proceed from the outside of its cord during your operation, then when you have completed the incision on the belly, return inside it and immediately join together the two lips of the cord of the genitals with sutures, and then take care of it just like other wounds until it is healed."
E si atrobas le huou corromput per autra malautia, lahoras cove que tu lies les vayssels les quals so sore le suspensori, e extrat le huou, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit.	"And if you find the belly corrupted by some other illness, then it is necessary to ligate the vessels that are near the suspensiony ligaments, and extract the belly, and then take care of it with what we have said."
Mays si l’aygua es agreguada en doas partidas esemps, lahoras sapias que doas son las ernias; donc inscideys aquela partida segon que has feyt en l’autra engualment; e si es a tu vist que sia una opera, lahoras tu la fay.	"But if the water accumulates in two places at once, know that there are two hernias present. Therefore incise that side just as you did on the other side, and if it appears to be an operation, then perform it."
E aprop tu abstergiys le sanc, e entramet en las seccios lana submersa en oli o en oli rozat; e pausa deforo autra lana la qual tu as submersa en vi e oli, e expandeys aquela sobre dos genetius e·l mirac del ventre; e pausa desobre draps doblatz e pulvils, e lia aquels desobre am liament le qual es segon aquesta forma:	"And then you should cleanse the blood, and enter into the incisions with wool soaked in oil or rose oil. Then place over this another wool soaked in wine and oil, and spread it out over both of the genitals and the belly button. Then place folded cloths and powders over it, and bind them together with bandages in this manner:"
e aprop sian preses dos draps e sian humplitz de lana carmenada segon aquesta semblansa; e sian faytas las extremitatz am les quals es premut de coto o de lana humida, e sian agreguatz am strectura en le braguier de las braguas, e la una de las extremitatz prengua del cul entro al dos, e la segonda prengua a la partida del pantenilh, e dos extramitatz sobre dos coyssas dejos e dos extramitatz autras sobre dos angonars, e tota extrictura sia ajustada en le braguier de las braguas.	"And then two cloths are taken and filled with wool carded in this manner. The ends of them are tied with cotton or wet wool, and they are attached with a bandage in the fly of the breeches, and one end takes the buttocks between the two, and the other end takes the groin, and two bands on both sides and two others above the thighs, and all tension should be adjusted in the fly of the breeches."
E alcunas veguadas aquesta hernia es medicada artificialment am cauteri en loc de seccio am ferr; e es que tu prenguas cauteri cutellar subtil e que inscidas am aquel la codena dels ginitius, e es ignit segon que havem recomtat entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc contenent la aygua, e lahoras tu pren cauteri segon aquesta forma:	"And sometimes this hernia is treated artificially with a cautery instead of an incision with iron. And if you take a thin cautery needle and incise the cord of the genitals with it, and light it according to what we have recommended until the white belly containing the water is revealed, then you should take cautery in this manner:"
e es asemblat a letra greca.	"And it resembles the Greek letter gamma."
E aprop perfora am aquel ciphac, e es ignit entro que tota la humiditat sia fora-gitada.	"And then pierce that belly with it, and light it until all the moisture is driven out."
E aprop exten le ciphac am uncis, e excorja am uncis, e excorja am cauteri subtil ignit; e inscideys aquel segon que es a tu possible entro que eradiques tot lu; e guarda te del huou que·l foc no·l toque.	"And then extend the belly with forceps, and tear it open with forceps, and cauterize it with a thin lit forceps. And incise it according to what is possible for you until you have removed all of it. And be careful that the belly does not touch the fire."
E sapias que aquesta operacio es pus salva e pus longinqua de flux de sanc, e milhor que operacio am seccio.	"And know that this operation is safer and farther from bleeding than an operation with incision."
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat apostema caut en la hora de seccio o en hora de cauteri, o flux de sanc, lahoras cove que tu cures qual contrarietat fa a tu per aquo, am curacio la qual conveneys a lu segon que es dit.	"But if you encounter an aposteme or bleeding during the time of incision or cautery, or bleeding, then you should take care of what is causing this to you according to what has been said."
Mays si le malaute es pauruc, e no spera la segonda operacio per la sua horribilitat, lahoras administra perforacio segon que yeu recomti aquo; e es quan es certificat deves tu, per aquo que havem dit de las significacios, que aquela hernia es ayguosa.	"But if the patient is fearful and does not wait for a second operation due to its horrible nature, then perform a perforation according to what you recommend. And this should be done when you are certain, based on what we have said about the meanings, that that hernia is hydrocele."
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute sobre alcuna cezelha elevada, aprop perfora le apostema en la partida pus bassa de lu am spatum lat, e pausa la perforacio segon la longitut del cos.	"Then you should make the patient lie on some elevated pillows. Then perforate the aposteme at its lowest part with a wide spatula, and continue the perforation according to the length of the body."
E sia la apercio ampla entro que corro tota l‘aygua.	"And let the opening be wide enough that all the water may run out."
E aprop pausa sobre le loc coto e lia aquel e layssa aquel, per so que corro le romanent de l’aygua.	"And then place cotton on the spot and bind it there, so that the remainder of the water may drain off."
E aprop cura aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	"And then treat it until the wound is healed."
Mays si contrarietat es a la egrecio de l’aygua en aquela hora tu perforas aquela: e aquo no es fayt sino per aquo quar le pannicol blanc en le orrifici de la plagua fa contrarietat e prohibeys le eyssiment de l’aygua, lahoras cove que tu metas en la plagua pena o instrument am la qual es extrayta l’aygua dels ydropitz, la forma del qual es precedida; o ajusta en la opprecio de la plagua un petit.	"But if there is difficulty in the discharge of water at that time, then perforate it: and this happens only when the white panicle at the opening of the wound causes difficulty and prevents the escape of water. Then you should place into the wound a trocar or instrument with which the water is extracted from hydroceles, as shown below, or fit into the opening of the wound a small tube."
E sapias que l’aygua retorna, e es agueguada aprop vi meses o enaviro aquels; e cum es agreguada, lahoras sia perforat segon aquela meteyssa manieyra, quar le malaute ayssi passara les sieus dias.	"And know that the water returns, and it accumulates again after about six months or approximately those times. And when it has accumulated, then it should be perforated in the same manner as before, for the patient will thus spend his days."
Capitol .lxiii.	"Chapter LXIII."
De seccio sobre hernia carnosa e la curacio de lu.	"Chapter on fatty hernia and its cure."
Sapias que en la seccio sobre aquesta hernia es temor perdusent a pernicia en las majors disposicios; per que a mi es vista la dimissio de lu e esser salvat per aquela milhor.	"You should know that in this section about this hernia, great caution is required to avoid injury during the operation; for this reason, it is my recommendation to dismiss the surgery and save the patient from it."
E yeu so rememorant la operacio en aquela e las specias dels apostemas.	"And remember the operation that was performed on him and the specifics of his abscesses."
Donc, dic que l‘apostemas natz en les cos dels quals les genetius so conponutz e es fayt aquo per motas causas: o per superfluitat aguda agra, la qual es efundida als genetius, o per percuscio.	"Therefore, I say that abscesses are formed in the bodies of those whose veins are affected and this happens for many causes: either due to acute severe inflammation which overflows into the veins, or due to injury."
E es la color de la apostema segon la color del cos, e no es atrobat en lu dolor, e es apostema greu.	"And its color matches that of the body, and it is not accompanied by pain, indicating a severe abscess."
E fort leu es apostema lapificada, del qual la color es fosca, e no es centiment a lu.	"And a hard, elevated, encapsulated abscess with dark skin coloring, which is insensitive to touch."
E alcunas veguadas es fayt per nodacio de las arcerias, e per imflacio de aquelas ayssi quo ja es perceubut la rememoracio de lu, o per imflacio de venas.	"And sometimes it occurs due to the knotting of arteries, and inflammation of these vessels is perceived before remembering the injury itself, or due to venous inflammation."
Mays aquo que es per imflacio de arcerias es conogut per la dispercio de la apostema quan compremas aquela am les tieus ditz; e no cove que aquel toques.	"But what is caused by inflammation of arteries is known by the spreading out of the abscess when you press it with your fingers, and it does not require touching."
Mays aquel que es fayt per imflacio de vena no es dispergut de lu alcuna causa deves la compressio am les ditz.	"But one that is caused by inflammation of a vein is not spread out by pressing it with the fingers due to its hardness."
E ja es possible que sobre aquesta specia sia fayta seccio e sobre les autres carns; e es que tu inscida la codena dels genetius, e aprop esten le huou a las partidas desus, e extratz aquel del ciphac blanc, e deliura le suspensori dels vaysels, e ligua les, e inscideys le suspensori pus que tu deliuras aquel de tota partida de las partidas del huou.	"And it is possible that with this type of abscess there may be an incision made into other flesh; and this occurs when you insert the chain of veins, and then stretch the skin upwards at its edges, extract the white cylinder, deliver the suspensory ligaments of the vessels, tie them, and then cut the suspensory ligament as you completely free it from all attachments to the skin."
Donc si l’huou ja es am aquelas carnadas consolida, lahoras cove que tu extraguas le huou e inscidas aquel.	"So if the skin is firmly attached to those tissues, then you must extract the skin and incise that area."
E si es adherencia entro alcuna causa del ciphac, o entre aquo que es entre les bayssels, lahoras cove que tu deliures tota aquela adherencia e inscidas aquela per inscizio redonda.	"And if there is adhesion between the cylinder or between the vessels for any cause, then you must release all that adhesion and make a round incision."
Mays si es nativitat de carn en le loc de la adherencia la qual es detras, lahoras cove que tu inscidas tot aquo que es de lu, e extraguas le huou ayssi cum havem dit.	"But if there is a birthmark of flesh in the place of adhesion that is behind it, then you must incise all that and extract the skin as we have said."
Donc cum es complida la tua operacio, lahoras omple la plagua de lana imfuza en oli rozat e vi; e aprop cura aquela am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"So once your operation is complete, then fill the wound with lanolin infused in rose oil and wine, and afterwards dress it with the other dressing until it heals."
Capitol .lxiv.	Chapter LXIV
De la curacio de hernia que es de vitz.	Of the treatment of a hernia that occurs in childhood.
Vit es apostema envolut per alcuna envolucio semblant a broto am mollificacio dels testiculs, e es fayt dificil movement exercitiu e deambulacio sobre le malaute.	A hernia in children is an abscess wrapped in some kind of wrapping resembling a bud with softening of the testes, and it makes difficult exercise and walking for the patient.
E en la curacio de aquesta malautia es per temor per aquo del qual es precedida rememoracio.	And in treating this condition, fear is the cause of what preceded its onset.
Empero cove que diguam opperacio en aquela segon que fero les primiers.	However, we must speak about the operation on it according to how it first appears.
E dic que cove que fassas sezer le malaute sobre una cezelha elevada; e aprop enpelleys le suspensori dels testiculs a las partidas dejos; e aprop te la codena dels genetius am les tieus ditz am les baysels que so probdas a la vergua; e tengua aquels autre ministre que tu, e extenda aquels am extencio vehement.	"I say that you should place the patient on an elevated pillow; then expose the suspensory ligaments of the testicles to the parts left uncovered; and then take hold of the tendon of the hamstrings with your fingers, as close as possible to the thighbone; and have another servant help you, stretching them with great vehemence."
E aprop inscideys am spatum lat agut per seccio traversa en le dreyt dels vaysels entro que sian les vayssels descubertz.	"And then make an incision with a sharp knife along the right side of the vessels where they are uncovered."
E aprop excorja de tota partida ayssi quo a tu havem dit en extraccio de arceria las quals so en las templas.	"And then strip away all the surrounding parts, just as we have said in the extraction of an arrowhead from the temples."
E aprop fica en aquelas un’agulha en la qual sia fiel doble, e lia aquel en le primier del locs en les quals accideys vit, e lia aquel autra veguada en le derier de lor.	"And then place a needle with double thread in that location where you first saw the vein appear, and tie it there; then tie it again at the last point where it disappears."
E aprop inscideys aquels en le mieg loc per seccio dreyta segon la longuesa del cos, e extratz aquo que es agreguat de las humiditatz fetulentas e corruptas.	"And then cut that in half with a straight incision along the length of the body and remove what has accumulated there from the putrid and corrupted moistures."
E aprop cura la plagua am curacio de las autras plaguas en las quals vols sania esser engendrada per so que caian les vaysels les quals noyreysso un de dos genetius, quar no es mal per aquo.	"And then treat the wound with the usual treatment for wounds to ensure that it heals well and does not fall prey to gangrene from one or both testicles, as this would be unfortunate."
Mays si accideys vit a totz les bayssels, lahoras cove que·ls testicols sian extragutz o que les testicols per aquo se cequo am les vayssels, per que sia privat de tot nutriment per la inscizio dels vayssels, e que sian estaborits, o que cequo per so que no sia juvament am aquels.	"But if all the veins are visible, then it is necessary to remove the testicles or to tie them off with the veins, as they would otherwise be deprived of all nourishment due to the incision of the veins. Then they should be cauterized, or else cut off so that there may be no harm from them."
Capitol .lxv.	"Chapter LXV"
De la cura de hernia entestinal.	"Regarding the treatment of intestinal hernia."
Le adveniment de aquesta hernia es per seccio que endeve en le ciphac extendut sobre le ventre de part dels angunars del mirac del ventre, per que deysendo les budels de aquela ruptura ad alcu dels budels.	"The occurrence of this hernia is due to a separation that occurs in the peritoneum spread out over the abdomen on the side of the abdominal muscles, causing some intestines from that rupture to protrude."
E aquesta ruptura es o del ciphac o de excencio de lu, e accideysso aquestas doas specias per motas causas: o percussio, o per sautz, o per clamor, o per elevacio de alcuna causa greu, o per semblantz.	"And this rupture is either due to the ciphac or exception of him, and it happens thus these two species for many causes: either percussion, or leap, or cry, or elevation from some heavy cause, or seeming."
E·l senhal de aquo, quan es per extencio del ciphac, es que accideys pauc a pauc en lonc temps, e no accideys soptament, e es apostema engual entro ves le preon per so quar le ciphac comprem le budel.	"And the sign of that, when it is by extension of the ciphac, is that it happens little by little over a long time, and does not happen suddenly, and it is an aposteme growing within the preon due to the ciphac compressing the bowel."
E le senhal de lu es quan es per seccio del ciphac, quar al comensament fa accidir dolor vehement sobtament; e es apostema divers aparent dejos la codena propdana aparent, e aquo es per eyssiment del budel, e·l cos de lu a las partidas deforo del ciphac.	"And the sign of him is when it is by section of the ciphac, for at the beginning it causes sudden violent pain; and it is an aposteme different appearing near the duodenum appearing, and that is by emission of the bowel, and its body towards the parts outside of the ciphac."
E alcunas veguadas es fora-getat am le budel la tela, e es apelada aquesta hernia entestinal zirbal.	"And sometimes it happens that the tissue is forgotten in the bowel, and this is called intestinal hernial."
E alcunas veguadas es fayta am ventositat, e alcunas veguadas corr en le budel fenda, e aqui es retenguda, e es am aquo gran pernitia3 del malaute, e alcunas veguadas fa endevenir dolor malvada e majorment quan es premut.	"And sometimes it is accompanied by windiness, and sometimes it runs in the bowel furrow, and here it is retained, and there is great detriment of health with this, and sometimes it causes bad pain, especially when pressed."
E en la curacio de las especias de aquesta malautia am ferr es temor, per que cove que sia esquivat le cazament en aquela.	"And in the treatment of these species of this illness with iron, there is fear because it is necessary to avoid cauterization in that."
E la manieyra de la operacio de aquela es que comandes al malaute que redugua le budel am la sua ma a las partidas dedintz de la sua conquavitat si obezeys al sieu retornament, e aprop sia envessat sobre le sieu col entre las tuas mas, e eleva las cambas de lu.	"And the manner of the operation for this is that you order the patient to reduce the bowel with his own hand to the parts inside his concavity if he obeys its return, and then it should be covered over with his cloak between your hands, and elevate its chambers."
E aprop sten la codena la qual siec la codena dels testicols a las partidas desus, e inscideys la codena dels testicols tota per le lonc; e aprop fiqua en doas labias de la seccio uncis segon que indigeysses a hubrir la seccio am aquels.	"And then stretch the duodenum which lies above the duct of the testes to the parts above, and incise the duct of the testes entirely along its length; and then insert two clamps of the section as you need them to open the section with those."
E si’ la seccio segon la quantitat que a tu sia possible que de aquela le huou sia foro-getat.	"And if, according to the quantity of that which is possible for you, it should happen that that part is forgotten."
E aprop excorja aquela ciphaqueth les quals so dejos la codena dels testicols, entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc dur de quascuna partida.	"And then excise that cisphac which lies near the duct of the testes until the white hard cisphac is discovered on each part."
Lahoras tu entromet le tieu dit en aquo que siec le testicol, en aquo que es entre ciphac blanc, le qual es dejos la codena del huou, e entre le ciphac segon, e absolve am aquel’adherencia que es en la partida detras del huou.	"Then you insert your finger into that which lies the testis, into that which is between the white cisphac, which lies near the duct of the bowel, and between the cisphac second, and separate with that adhesion which is in the part behind the bowel."
E aprop mau am la ma la codena dels testicols a las partidas deforo, e am aysso exten le ciphac blanc en sus am la ma sinestra, e eleva le huou am le ciphac a la partida de la seccio; e comanda al ministre que extenda le huou ensus e tu dissolveys la adherencia que es detras am solucio complida.	"And then take with your hand the duct of the testes to the parts forward, and with this extend the white cisphac above with your left hand, and elevate the bowel with the cisphac at the part of the section; and command the assistant that he extends the bowel outside and you dissolve the adhesion that is behind with complete solution."
E cerqua am les tieus ditz que lay no sia alcuna causa del budel envelopat en le ciphac blanc dur.	"And then carefully examine with your fingers to ensure that there is no cause of the bowel being enclosed in the white hard cisphac."
Mays si tu atrobas de lu alcuna causa, lahoras tu enpelleys aquel al ventre dejos.	"But if you find any cause there, then you pull it into the abdomen from outside."
E aprop tu pren una agulha en la qual sia fiel gros fayt de x fiels, e entromet aquel deves le derier del ciphac, le qual es jos la codena dels testicols, la qual siec seccio; e aprop inscideys las extremitatz las quals emineysso del fiel entro que sian quatre fiels, e aprop compausa alcus de lor sobre alcuna figura en manieyra de crotz; e lia am aquel le ciphac del qual havem dit que es dejos la codena dels testicols am fort liament de dos partz.	"And then you take a needle with which is thick thread of wax, and insert it behind the end of the cisphac which lies beneath the duct of the testes which is the section; and then incise its extremities which emerge from the thread until there are four threads, and then compress some of them over some figure in the manner of a cross; and tie with that cisphac of which we have spoken that it lies near the duct of the testes with strong binding of two parts."
E aprop envolveys las extremitatz dels fiels e lia aquelas am liament vehement entro que alcu dels vayssels que noyrrisso aquels no puscan trametre alcuna causa per so que de aqui no accida apostema caut.	"And then wrap the extremities of the threads and tie them with strong binding until some of those vessels that nourish them cannot transmit any cause through which an abscess may occur."
E pausa autra veguada liament segon foro le primier liament, lonh de lu mens tres ditz; e aprop aquestz dos liaments layssa del ciphac le qual es dejos la codena dels testicols la quantitat de la grandeza del dit, e inscideys tot le romanent segon redondeza, e osta de lu le huou.	"And pause another binding according to the first binding, distant from it three fingers; and then these two bindings leave that cisphac which lies near the duct of the testes the quantity of the thickness of a finger, and incise all the remainder according to roundness, and leave from it the bowel."
E aprop inscideys en la partida dejos de la codena dels testicols per seccio de la qual corra sanc e sania ayssi cum havem recomtat en aquo que havem dit.	"And then incise in that part near the duct of the testes through the section from which blood and pus flowed, as we have recommended before."
E aprop aministra lana submersa en oli, e pausa en la plagua; e aministra le liament le qual havem recomtat (e alcunas veguadas le ciphac blanc es cauterizat, le qual havem dit aprop la inscizio de lu temen de flux de sanc, quar motas veguadas accideys aquels) e leyssa le liament entro que per si caia.	"And then apply wool soaked in oil and place it on the wound; and apply the suture which we have recommended (and sometimes cauterize the white cisphac which we have mentioned near the incision of the bleeding point, for many times this happens), and leave the suture until it falls by itself."
Mays si le cazement de lu es tardat, lahoras de aygua cauda sia embrocat, e pausa sobre aquel entro que caia segon que havem dit.	"But if the wound closes late, then boiled water should be wrapped around it, and placed upon it until it falls as we have said."
E aprop cura la plagua am l’autra curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanat.	"And then treat the wound with the other cure for wounds until it is healed."
Capitol .lxvi.	"Chapter 66"
De hernia ventosa.	"On Ventous Hernia"
En aquesta hernia no e vist alcu que sia estat ardit sus la curacio de lu am ferr.	In this hernia, no one has been burned during its cure with iron.
E les primiers diyssero que es fayta ayssi cum havem recomtat en la hernia que es am vi; la qual es que tu lies les vayssels aprop la seccio sobre aquela am fecilitat de lu; e aprop secca en le mieg loc en enviro le apostema am aquo que obro aquel, entro que caian les vayssels.	The first step is done as we recommended in the case of a hernia caused by water: lie down on your back and raise your hips close to the section over that area with ease; then dry the middle part around the abscess with water boiled with salt.
E cura la plagua segon que havem dit entro que sia sanada.	Cure the wound as we said until it is healed
Capitol .lxvii.	Capítulo LXVII
De la disropcio que es fayta en les anguonars.	On the treatment of hemorrhoids.
Alcunas veguadas endeve ruptura en les angonars ayssi cum havem dit, e emineys le loc.	Sometimes, rupture occurs in the hemorrhoids as we have said, and it becomes inflamed.
E no deyssen als genetius alcuna causa dels budels al genetius; e si deyssen, aquo es pauc; e retorna s’en en totas horas.	And do not give any laxatives to the patient without cause; if you do give them, it is little; and they return in all hours.
Mays si es prolonguat le temps am aquo, es ajustada fissura en le ciphac entro que deysenda le budel en le ciphac; e accideys aquo per la extencio del ciphac le qual es en le angonars ayssi cum havem dit, la qual causa es quar le ciphac es estendut, e aprop es mollificat e·l loc es apostemat e emineys.	But if the time is prolonged with that, it makes an anal fissure in which the intestine opens into the anus; and this happens because of the extension of the anus which is in the hemorrhoids as we have said, which causes the anus to stretch, soften, and become inflamed and swollen.
E la cura de lu es am cauteri ayssi quo es precedida la narracio de lu.	And its cure is with cautery, as will be described later in this book.
E alcunas veguadas es curada am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: e es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos entre las tuas mas, e aprop secca le loc de la ruptura dels apostemas emineys am seccio per la latitut segon la quantitat de tres ditz.	And sometimes it is cured with iron according to this method: and that is for the patient to sit on his heels between two stools, and then dry the area of the rupture of the swollen abscesses with a cut made horizontally according to its size.
E aprop strenh le ciphac blanc que es jos la codena entro que sia descubert.	And then stretch the anus white which is below the spine so that it is exposed.
E aprop pren le ray e pausa aquel sobre le loc eminent del ciphac, e prem aquel al preon del ventre.	And then take a probe and place it on the most prominent part of the anus, and press it against the front of the abdomen.
E aprop cus le dos locs eminentz sobre la extremitat del ray del ciphac, e ajusta am la sutura un de aquels am l’autre.	And then cut both prominent parts on either side of the probe's end in the anus, and join them together with a suture.
E aprop extratz la extremitat del ray, e no inscidas del ciphac de tot, ni no extenda le huou, ni autra causa ayssi cum yeu te fi saber en la curacio de hernia entestinal.	And then extract the end of the probe, and do not insert anything into the anus at all, nor extend it further, nor any other cause as you will know better in the treatment of intestinal hernias.
E aprop cura aquela am la curacio de las plaguas, e cum inscideyses les fiels, mundifica aquela e restaura la plagua entro que sia consolidada; quar le ciphac es contrayt e no es ajustada la eminencia de ruptura.	And then treat it with the treatment for piles, and when you cut the veins, cleanse them and restore the pile so that it is consolidated; for the anus contracts and the prominence of the rupture does not remain.
E cauteri es milhor en aquest loc, quar es pus propda a salut.	And cautery is better in this place because it is closer to health.
Capitol .lxviii.	Chapter LXIX
De mollificacio de la codena dels testiculs.	Of the softening of the scrotum's cord.
Motas veguadas la codena dels testiculs en alcus homes es mollificada per aysso quar las carns que so entre aquela son mollificadas, e es fedat le reguardament de lu.	Many times the scrotum's cord in some men is softened because the flesh that is between it is softened, and it is noticeable by its appearance.
Adonc necessari es ad aquel que es preguat en la curacio de lu que fassa jazer le malaute segon le sieu dos, e enscida tota la codena la qual es mollificada sobre la codena natural; e aprop que ajuste doas labias am la sutura.	Then it is necessary for the one who is to treat him that they make the patient lie down on their side, and remove all clothing softened over the natural skin; and then join two lips with stitching.
E si vols, cus en le comensament la superfluitat de la codena mollificada am tres cozeduras o quatre e am ferma sutura.	And if you wish, at first the excess of softened skin can be removed with three or four cuts and firm stitching.
E aprop inscideys entre las suturas; e aprop cura per curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat e caian les fiels.	And then cut between the stitches, and also treat other wounds until they heal and discharge occurs.
Capitol .lxix.	Chapter .lxix
De castracio.	Of castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	Know that castration is condemned in our law, but due to the request of certain people it has been written about in this book; and its remembrance is necessary only for two ways: one because it is within the knowledge of doctors when they are consulted regarding such things, knowing how to treat them; and the other way is that we often need castration of other beasts for our own use, as with dogs, goats, pigs, and similar animals.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And so it is said that castration is done in two ways: either by crushing or by cutting with a section.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	But in that which is done by crushing, the way of performing it is that we seize the beast in cold water until its testicles become softened and lengthened and hang down.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	And then take them with your hand so that they are resolved and do not appear hard to the touch.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	But in castration done by cutting with a section, you should hold the beast and press the cord of its testicles with your left hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	And then lift up the suspending ligaments, and cut across each one with a section so that two openings result.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	And then cut those which will appear to have burst open.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	"Ignore causes related to the liver, except for a subtle liver condition that affects the veins."
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	"This method of castration is better performed by crushing because strong crushing leaves no cause for the testicles to desire copulation."
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	"And appropriately treat the plague until it is healed."
Capitol .lxx.	"Chapter .70."
De la cura de hermafrodozia.	"On the cure of hermaphrodism."
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels.	"Hermaphrodism in males comes in two forms: one is when it appears as an empty space between the two testicles, where there are two testicles but a vagina-like opening figures between them."
E alcunas veguadas de aquel corr urina le qual es en la codena dels testiculs.	"And sometimes urine flows from that spot which is in the chain of the testicles."
Mays en las femnas es una specia: e es que·l conh de la femna sobre le pentenilh es ayssi cum dos testiculs de home un pauc de tot yminiheys a la partida deforo ayssi cum le perpucii de home e dos testicols.	"In females, it is one type: when the vagina opens above the pubis just like two male testicles, slightly larger and thinner at the opening of the vulva, like the male penis and two testicles."
E la curacio es de tres specias: de dos dels homes e de una specia de las femnas.	"And its treatment is divided into three types: two for males and one type for females."
E es que cove que tu inscidas aquelas carns ajustadas entro que efuga la emprecio de aquela, e aprop que cures aquelas am curacio de las autras plaguas.	"And it is necessary that you insert those attached flesh parts so that the urine does not escape from there, and also heal them with care just like other illnesses."
E en la segonda specia dels homes de la qual yeys urina la qual es en la codena dels testiculs, no es curacio ni opperacio en lu.	"And in the second type of males where urine flows which is in the chain of the testicles, there is neither treatment nor operation for it."
Capitol .xxi.	"Chapter .21."
De lentinge e de carn eminent per causas de las femnas.	"On lentigo (freckles) and raised flesh caused by women."
Lentige fort leu es ajustada sobre causas naturals entro que es etressat e es fayt leg le reguardament; e alcunas veguadas es magnificada en alcunas femnas en tant entro que es spandit ayssi cum en les homes e perve entro al coito.	"Freckles are naturally attached, they appear and disappear according to the weather; sometimes they are more pronounced in some women that they spread like in men and even during intercourse."
Adonc cove que tu tenguas la superfluitat de lentinge am la tua ma o am unci e inscidas.	"Then you should remove the excess freckles with your hand or with oil and insert it."
E no ultimes en inscizio, majorment en le preon de la razit, per so que no endevengua flux de sanc.	"And do not make an incision in the end, especially on the front of the nose, to avoid bleeding."
E aprop cura aquela am curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanada.	"Then heal it with treatment for skin diseases until it is healed."

"But raised flesh is flesh that grows on the skin of the mother's womb and fills it up. Capitol .lxxii.	"Chapter LXXII."
De curacio de alratica.	"On the treatment of a sore throat."
Alratica es que le conh de la femna no sia perforat, o sia le trauc petit.	"A sore throat is when the woman's passage is not pierced or has a small hole."
E es o natural o accidental.	"And it can be either natural or accidental."
Accidental es per malautia la qual ha precedit, e aquela es fayta o per carn nada ajustada o per ciphac subtil o espes.	"Accidental is due to an illness that has preceded, and it is caused by excess flesh or attached skin, or thick and dense cicatrix."

Capitol .lxxiii.	"Chapter LXXIII."
De la cura de emorroydas e de tayl e de botor roja que accideysso en le conh de las femnas.	"On the treatment of hemorrhoids, prolapse of the rectum, and red tumor that occurs in the vagina of women."

E cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And treat it until it is healed."
Capitol .lxxiv.	"Chapter LXXIV."
De perforacio de eyssedura accident en la mayre.	"On accidental perforation of the bladder in the womb."

Capitol .lxxv.	"Chapter Seventy-Five"
A ensenhar las matronas en qual manieyre les enbrios bius sian medicatz quan yeysso segon figura no-natural.	"To teach midwives how to treat the drunk woman who is pregnant, when it presents itself abnormally."
Necessaria causa es que la matrona conogua en le comensament la figura del enfantament natural per senhals de lu, e es que quan tu vezas la femna expremar a las partidas dejos e desira odorar le ayre, e sobre aquo es enleujada per aquo que sobre ela es del part, e festina le eyssiment del enbrio, lahoras sapias que aquest part es segon figura natural, e es l’eyssiment de lu sobre le sieu cap, e la segondina am aquel o suspensa o pendent del ombelic.	"It is necessary for the midwife to recognize at the beginning the figure of a normal birth through its signs, namely when she sees the woman pressing her thighs and desiring to smell the air, and then she feels relieved by that which comes over her from below, and the expulsion of the child is hastened, she knows that this birth is according to nature's figure, i.e. the child comes out upon its head, and the second one either suspended or hanging from the navel."

Exitus geminorum aut foetuum multorum.	Exit of twins or multiple fetuses
Sapias que gemels motas veguadas so natz, e alcunas vetz naysso tres o quatre , mays aquo es estranh e tart s’endeve; mays v so causas foro natura, e no vivo.	Know that many times twins are born, and sometimes three or four, but this is rare and unusual. It has natural causes and does not happen often.
E conte aquelas, ja sia que sian montiplicatz, una segondina, e son seperatz per ciphac, distingen aquels enter le liguament en l’ombilic de cascun de aquels E alcunas veguadas so foro-getatz ayssi cum es un fet per eyssiment natural leugier, e so eysitz alcunas veguadas per eyssiment no-lausabla ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And count them, even if they are multiplied, as one fetus, and separate them by chiasm, distinguishing those between the ligaments in the navel of each. And sometimes they are expelled just like one fetus through gentle natural examination, but sometimes they are expelled through painful examination as we have recommended
E si son dificils alcus de lor deves le enfantament e perveno ad aquo que havem dit de las figuras no-naturals, lahoras tu cura aquels ayssi cum havem recontat.	And if some of them are difficult to bring forth during birth and they have come to what we have said about the unnatural figures, then cure them as we have recommended.
E si’ la matrona subtil e fassa aquo que fa am facilitat e subtilitat, e am tarditat, e sia ingeniat segon tota figura segon que es a lu preparat de l’engen amenant a salut.	And if the midwife is subtle and does what she does with facility and subtlety, and patience, and is ingenious according to all figures as they are prepared for her by the art leading to health
Rememoratio eius quod formatur in matrice ex embrionibus et Abortiuntur.	Recollection of that which is formed in the matrix from embryos and aborted
Alcunas veguadas son formatz en la mayre un, e dos, e tres, e quatre, e v, e vi, e vii, e mays x, e ja es deves mi verificat que una femna abortem ne getet vi, e una autra x totz formatz, la qual causa fo fayta per mensuracio dels glorios savis.	Sometimes one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, and even more than ten are formed in the womb, and I have verified that one woman aborted six, and another bore ten all formed. The cause of this was made known by the measurement of the glorious wise ones.
E tot aysso cove que sia en la sciencia de la matrona quar fort leu ad aquela parve semblant de aquo, e donc opause se ad aquo am so que cove.	And all this should be in the knowledge of the midwife that she may know what to do in such a case, and therefore pause if it is necessary to do so.
Capitol .lxxvi.	Chapter LXXVI
De extraccio del fet quan es mort.	Of the extraction of the dead fetus
Quan tu curas le fet mort am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la medicacio e no es defora eyssit, e tu yest forsat usar de opperacio am ma, lahoras cove que consideras si la femna es de sana vertut e no es am alcu dels accidentz per les quals sobre ela es temuda perdicio.	When you care for the dead fetus as we have said in the division of medicine and it is not expelled naturally, and you see that force must be used with your hand, then consider if the woman is of sound virtue and does not have any of the accidents by which danger to her may be feared.
Lahoras cove que la femna sia envessada sobre le lieyt sobre le sieu dos, e sia le cap de lu enclinat enjos e las coyssas de lu sian elevadas.	Then it is necessary that the woman should be placed upon the bed on her left side, and let her head rest in a low place and let her hips be elevated.
E·l ministre tengua aquela de doas partz o sia liada en le lieyt per so que·l cos de lu no se extenda deves la extraccio del fet.	And the assistant should hold her from both parts, or lie on the bed with her, so that his body does not extend beyond the extraction of the fetus.
E aprop tu humecta la boca de la mayre de lu am olis humitz e am mucellage de altea e de fenugrec e de semensa de li.	And then moisten the mouth of the womb with humid oil and mucilage of marsh mallow and fenugreek and linseed.
E aprop unte la matrona la sua ma am aquels olis e mucellages, e aprop entrometa la sua ma am fecilitat en la mayre, e aprop cerque am la ma loc en le qual fique les uncis en le fet.	And then the midwife should anoint her hand with these oils and mucilages, and then insert her hand gently into the womb, and then search around with her hand for where the hooks are on the fetus.
E locs convenient en aquo: adonc tu considera si le fet es preparat que deysenda sobre le sieu cap, e lahoras tu fique les uncis en les huels de lu, o en le col, o en la boca, o en le palat, o dejos la barba, o en la furcula de lu, o en les locs propdas de las costas, o dejos les ypocondres.	The convenient places for this are: then consider if the fetus is prepared to come out on its head, and then place the hooks in its heels or in its neck or in its mouth or in its palate or below its beard or in its collarbone or in the places near the ribs or below the hypochondria.
Mays si le deysendiment es sobre les pes de lu, lahoras en le pentenilh, o en le mieg de las costas.	But if it is coming out on its feet, then in the perineum or in the middle of the back
E cove que tengua le unci am la ma dreyta, e pausa la curvitat de lu en aquel loc le qual es entre les ditz de la ma senestra, e entrometa la ma am facilitat e fique le unci en alcu de aquels locs les quals havem ditz, entro que pervengua a la causa boyda.	It is necessary to hold the hook with the right hand and pause its curvature in that place which is between the fingers of the left hand, and insert the hand gently and place the hook in one of those places which we have mentioned until it reaches the cause of birth.
E aprop pause e fique en la apposicio de lu un autre unci, o le tertz si es necessitat, per so que sia atraccio engual, e no sia extencio segon la sua rectetut tant solament.	And then pause and place another hook or the third one if necessary so that there may be equal traction and not too much extension according to its straightness alone.
Ans sia maugut a tota partida, per so que l’eyssiment de lu sia alleujat ayssi cum es fayt en dent deves la eradicacio de lu.	And let it be moved in every birth so that the expulsion of it may be alleviated just as is done with teeth when they are extracted.
E cove en lu aquo que es entre lor que la extencio sia mollificada; e si alcuna partida de lu es retenguda, lahoras cove que la matrona unte alcus sieus ditz am oli e entrometa aquels espertament e revolva am aquels aquo que es retengut.	And it is necessary that between them the extension be softened; and if any part of it is retained, then it is necessary for the midwife to anoint some of her fingers with oil and insert them gently and turn around what has been retained.
Donc si la partida del fet es fora-getada, lahoras les uncis sian permudatz entra loc le qual sia pus aut; e fay aysso entro que tot le fet sia fora-getat.	Therefore if the birth of the fetus is difficult, then the hooks should be changed to another place where it may be pushed further out; and do this until the whole fetus has been expelled.
Mays si la ma es eyssida denant l’autra, e no es possible reduzir aquela per la coartacio de lu, lahoras cove que drap sia envolopat sobre aquela; e aprop extratz aquela entro que tota sia fora-getada, e inscideys aquela o en la junctura de la ma o en le coyde.	But if the hand becomes exposed before the other one and it is not possible to reduce it because of its curvature, then a cloth should be wrapped around that; and then extract it until all has been expelled, and cut it off at the junction of the hand or in the elbow.
E ayssi cove que fassas en l’autra ma e en les dos pes.	"And similarly do in the other hand and both feet."
Mays si le cap del fet es gran, o accideys a lu coartacio en le eyssiment, o es en le cap de lu aygua ajustada, lahoras cove que entrometa entre les ditz espatum spinos e fenda le cap e extragua la aygua, o que discroba aquel am un instrument le qual es nompnat “alundat”, la forma del qual vindra am las formas dels autres instruments en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	"If the fetus's head is large or if there is some constriction in the pelvis or if it is in the neck of the womb, then it will be necessary to insert between the aforementioned spines and split the head open and extract the waters, or else use an instrument called “alundat,” the shape of which will come along with the shapes of other instruments in the chapter that follows this one."
E semblantment fassa si·l fet es de gran cap per natura: e lahoras cove que inscida aquel am algematu, o que prengua aquel am alunda ayssi cum havem dit; e aprop extra les osses am les forceps.	"And similarly do if the fetus has naturally a large head: and then it is necessary to insert this with forceps, or take hold of it with an “alundat” as we have said before; and afterwards extract the bones with forceps."
E si le cap es eyssit e es coartat deves la furcula, lahoras sia fendut entro que la humiditat la qual es en le pietz sia efunduda.	"And if the head is exited and is constricted above the pubis, then it should be opened up so that the fluid which is in the uterus may flow out."
Mays si no es complicat, ni obezeys a eyssiment, lahoras tu inscideys le cap tantost segon que a tu sira possible.	"But if there are no complications or signs of imminent delivery, then you should proceed to extract the head little by little according to your ability."
E si le dejos del ventre es apostemat o es en lu ydropici, lahoras cove que tu perfores aquel entro que corro la humiditat que es en lu.	"And if the lower part of the abdomen is inflamed or there is dropsy in it, then you must pierce it so that the fluid which is within may flow out."
Mays si le fet es sobre les sieus pes, lahoras la atraccio de lu es leugiera e la direccio de lu a la boca de la mayre es leugiera.	"But if the fetus is lying on its back, then its attraction will be lighter and its direction towards the mouth of the womb will be easier."
Mays si es coartat deves le ventre e·l pietz, lahoras cove que tu extraguas aquel am drap le qual auras envolopat sobre la tua ma, e que fendes le ventre e·l pietz entro que corra aquo que es en aquels.	"But if it is constricted above the belly and the uterus, then you must extract it with cloth which you will have wrapped around your hand, and cut open the belly and uterus so that what is inside may flow out."
Mays si les autres membres so ostatz e torna le cap, lahoras la metrona entrometa la ma senestra; mays si la boca de la mayre es huberta, lahoras intrometa la ma en le preon de layre, e cerque am aquela le cap, e atira aquel am les ditz entro a la boca de la mayre, e aprop entrometa en lu un unci, o dos uncis, e atire lu am aquels.	"But if the other members are exposed and the head returns, then insert your left hand; but if the mouth of the womb is closed, then insert your hand into the lower abdomen and grasp the head with it, and pull it with those things into the mouth of the womb, and immediately insert a hook or two hooks, and pull it with those."
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada per apostema caut le qual accideys a l’u, lahoras cove que no sia trebelhat sobre lu; abantz cove lahoras aministrar efusio de causas humidas grassas.	"And if the mouth of the womb is constricted by hard adhering clots which have occurred at birth, then it should not be troubled over that; but rather it is necessary to administer a copious evacuation of fatty humor."
E aministre emplastres; e segua le pacient en ayguas que mollifican e humectan.	"And apply plasters and follow up the patient with waters that soften and moisten."
E si le fet es sobre le sieu costat, lahoras si possible es, sia agulat: e sia aministrat aquo que havem dit en le fet viu.	"If the patient is on their side, if possible it should be made flat; and let them be given what has been said for a live patient."
E si aquo no es possible, lahoras sia inscidit en pessas, e sia extrayt.	"And if this is not possible, then they shall be incised with scissors, and it shall be extracted."
E cove que non layssas alcuna causa dedintz de la segondina.	"Ensure that no cause remains within the second one."
E cum tu auras complida tota la tua opperacio, lahoras aministra aquo que havem dit de la curacio en les apostemas cautz les quals accideysso de la mayre.	"And when you have completed all your operation, then administer what has been said about the cure of burns from which this may occur."
E si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras deyssendas en ayguas stipticas e aministra l’autra curacio.	"If there is bleeding, then apply styptics in water and administer the other cure."
E yeu ja e vist una femna en le ventre de la qual era fet mort, e aprop sobre aquel foc autra veguada emprenhada, e aprop foc mort es le fet autre.	"And I have seen a woman whose fetus was dead in her womb, and immediately afterwards she became pregnant again, and the other fetus was also dead."
Accidit al u aprop lonc temps apostema en le sieu embelic; e inflat es entro que foc ubert, e comensec a getar brac.	"It happened that a long time after an ulcer appeared on his belly; it became inflamed inside the opening and began to discharge pus."
E yeu fu appelhat a la cura de lu, e medicat a lu per lonc temps, e la plagua no es consolidada.	"And I was called in to treat him, but even though I treated him for a long time, it did not heal."
Adonc yeu pausegui sobre lu de alscunas causas emplastra de forta atraccio, e eyssic de lu un os, e aprop passero alcus jorns, e eyssic un autre os; e yeu fu trop meravilhat, cum en le ventre no sia os.	"Then I pondered on some causes that might have an attractive force, and pulled out a bone from him, but after several days passed, he pulled out another bone; and I was very amazed because there are no bones in the belly."
E adonc yeu cogitegui que eran dels osses del fet mort.	"And then I realized that they were the bones of the dead fetus."
Donc yeu enguisigui la plagua, e extrayssi de lu motz osses , la femna existent en las sieuas milhos disposicios, e ja visquec en tal manieyra per lonc temps, correc de lu un petit de brac.	"So I dressed the wound and removed many bones from it. The woman was then in good health and lived that way for a long time until one day she gave birth to a boy."
E yeu no afermegui asso esser stranh, sino quar en aquo es sciensa e ajutori ad aquo que le metge artifec am la ma per curacio aministra.	"And I do not affirm that this is strange, because in this there is knowledge and aid for the physician who works with his hand in treating."
De las formas dels instrumentz que so necessaris a extrayre le fet.	"Regarding the shapes of the instruments necessary to extract the fetus."
Forma de vertitge am la qual es uberta la mayre:	"Form of treatment through which the main cause is opened:"
Aquesta es la forma de strenhedor en le qual so engualhatz les libres, al qual engualhament sian dos virtitges en doas extremitatz de dos futz.	"This is the form of stretcher on which its ropes are tied, with two handles at both ends of each side."
May empero aquesta virtitge cove que sia pus subtil de strictori, e sia fayt o de eba o de fust de boys.	"It is necessary that this handle be made more slender and tight, and made either of ivory or wood."
E sia la latitut de quascun fust quays dos ditz e le marge de quascu amdos quays un dit, e la longitut de quascu es un palm e mig; e en le mieg loc de dos fustz so dos ajustaments de aquel meteys fustz les quals ja son fermatz, dels quals la longitut es la maytat de un palm e un pauc mes, e la latitut de quascu es quay dos ditz, o un pauc mes.	"And let the width of each beam be two fingers and a half, and the margin of each one on both sides be one finger wide, and the length of each one is one and a half palm; and in the middle place of two beams there are two joints of that meter wood which are already fixed, whose length is more than one and a half palm, and the width of each one is two fingers or a little more."
E aquestz dos additamentz sian entromeses en la boca de la mayre per que sia uberta am aquels quan tu revolves las doas prescriptas virtigges.	"And these two additions are inserted into the mouth of the main cause so that it can be opened with those when you turn the two specified handles."
Forma autra semblant de aquela pus subtil e pus leugiera:	"Another similar form but more slender and lighter:"
Sia fayta de fustz de eba o de boys segon la semblansa de forceps.	"It is made of ivory or wood in the shape of a forceps."
Mays empero en la extremitat de lu so dos additament ayssi cum vezes, e la longitut de aquels additament es quays un palm, e la latitut de quascu es dos ditz.	"But nevertheless at the end of it there are two additions like these, and the length of those additions is two palms, and the width of each one is two fingers."
E cum tu vols am aquels ubrir la mayre, lahoras tu fay cezer la femna sobre le lieyt les pes pendentz, ubert aquo que es entre las coyssas de lu.	"And when you want to open the main cause with those, then place the woman on her back and lift the weights with your hands, opening what is between her thighs."
E aprop obre la tua ma am le instrument ayssi cum fas am forfexs engualment segon la quantitat que vols de la aprecio de la boca de la mayre entro que la metrona fassa so que vols.	"And then open your hand with the instrument like you do with pincers, grasping according to how much you want of the opening of the mouth of the main cause while the meter makes what you want."
La forma de vertitge la qual diysero les antics:	"The form of virtue which they say in the past:"
Forma de impellent am le qual es empellit le fet:	"The shape of pushing with which is pushed the deed:"
Forma de amisidat2 am le qual es conterit le cap gran	"The shape of embracing with which is held the large head"
E es asemblat a forceps al qual so dentz en la extremitat, ayssi cum vezes, e alcunas veguadas es fayt lonc ayssi cum forceps segon aquesta forma, ayssi cum vezes, al qual so dentz ayssi cum dentz de ressegua am le qual es inscidit e conterit.	"And it is similar to forceps whose teeth are at the end like this, and sometimes it is made long like forceps according to this form whose teeth are like those of a saw with which it cuts and holds."
Forma de amesidat pauc:	"The shape of embracing little:"
Forma de unci havent una spina:	"The shape of a hook having one spine:"
Forma de unci havent doas spinas:	"The shape of a hook having two spines:"
Forma de forceps a la qual so dentz de cerra am le qual le cap del fet sia conterit:	"The shape of pincers whose teeth close together with which the head of the deed is held."
Forma de spatum havent dos extremitatz am le qual le cap es abscindit:	"The form of a spoon having two extremities with which the head is cut off:"
Forma de dos espatums latz:	"The shape of two broad spoons:"
Totz aquels instrumentz so excersitatz, e quan mes so multiplicadas las specias de aquel e so preparadas deves le artifexs, quant es pus leugier a la sua opperacio e pus aut deves les homes per la sua quantitat.	"Nevertheless all those instruments are exercised, and the more numerous the species of it and the better prepared the craftsmen, the easier its operation and the better for people due to their quantity."
E no obres de aquels instrumentz ja sia qua sia deves tu aparalhat, quar la necessitat de aquels no es excusabla.	"And do not work with those instruments whatever they may be, because the need for them is inexcusable."
De extraccio de la segondina.	"Regarding the extraction of the second cause:"
Quan la segondina es retenguda deves le enfantament, lahoras cove que tu comandes a la malautae que retengua le sieu ale, e aprop fay aquela stornudar am condizi, e strenh la tua ma sobre la boca de lu e sobre las nars de lu, e si per aysso es defora eyssit, bo es.	"When the second cause is retained during childbirth, then you should order the sick woman to hold her breath, and then make her sneeze with a condition, and press your hand over its mouth and nostrils, and if it comes out through this, that's good."
E sino, lahoras tu pren una ola e perfora en la cuberta un trauc e pausa en aquela erbas ubrent la boca de la mayre, ayssi cum calament e ruda e anet e camamilla e scicados arabic e cassia lignea e santaurea.	"And if not, then take a cloth and make a hole in it, and place it over those herbs burned on the mouth of the main cause, such as calamus, rue, anise, chamomile, saffron Arabic and lignum casia, and holy balm."
Totas aquestas erbas o alcunas de lor sian submersas en aygua en la ola, e pausa aquela sobre le foc.	"All these herbs or some of them should be immersed in water in the cloth, and place it on the fire."
E aprop pausa una canula de canaviera en la boca de la mayre, e tengua aquela entro que la evapor vengua a la concavitat de la mayre.	"And then place a reed cannula in the mouth of the main cause, and hold it there until the vapor comes to the concave part of the main cause."
E aprop fay aquela stornudar ayssi cum havem dit, e la segondina sira fora-getada am velocitat.	"And then make her sneeze as we have said, and the second cause will be expelled with speed."
