Mays si roman aprop aquesta curacio e no es eyssida, lahoras tu comanda a la matrona que submerge la sua ma sinistra en oli sizami o en micellage de altea, e aprop entrometa aquela en le conh e queresca am aquela la segondina, e cum aquela auras trobada, lahoras pren la e exten aquela pauc a pauc Mays si es annexsa en le preon de la mayre, lahoras entrometa la sua ma segon que havem recomtat, e quan aura trobat la segondina, extragua aquela petit a petit segon rectetut per so que la mayre no caja deves la atraccio vehement.	"But if even then this cure does not work and it is not expelled, then you should order the midwife to immerse her left hand in sesame oil or in an emulsion of althea, and then insert it into the womb and search with that for the second cause. And when she has found it, then take it out little by little. But if it is attached to the front of the main cause, then insert your hand as we have recommended, and when you have found the second cause, extract it slowly according to rectitude so that the main cause does not suffer from violent traction."
Abantz cove que sia permudada als costatz dreyt e sinestre am facilitat.	"It is necessary that they be moved on the right and left sides with ease."
E aprop sia ajustat en la quantitat de atraccio, quar ela obedira e evasira de adhirencia.	"And also regulate the amount of traction so that it will obey and escape adhesions."
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada, nos ja havem recomtat la curacio am sturnutacio e am medicacio de la ola am erbas.	"And if the mouth of the main cause is obstructed, we have already recommended the cure with sneezing and with medication of the cloth with herbs."
Mays si no es fora-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recomtadas, lahoras guarda te que no fetigues sobre aquela en iteracio de abstracio, mays empero cove que aquo que es eyssit de lu a la boca de la mayre lies a la coyssa de la femna, e aprop cristeriza aquela am enguent e tetrafarmacon; quar aquel fara poyrir aquela aprop alcus dias e sira dissolvuda e sira fora-getada.	"But if it is not expelled with all the causes that we have recommended, then be careful not to tire yourself out in repeated attempts at extraction, but whatever comes out of her mouth should be placed on the thing of the woman, and then cauterize it with a salve and tetrafarmacon. For this will make it rotten right away and it will dissolve and be expelled."
Mays quan se poyreys, es de lu elevada mala audor al cap, e al estomac, e aquo ledeys la malauta; e adonc cove que sian aministradas sub-fumiguacios e convenientz ad aquo.	"But when it putrefies, it produces a bad odor in the head and stomach, and this harms the sick person. And then remedies should be administered by fumigation and whatever is suitable for that."
Mays alcus dels Antics ja so esproatz sub-fumigacio de nazitort e de figuas seccas.	"But some of the Ancients already used fumigation with narcissus and dried figs."
Forma de instrument am le qual la femna es sub-fumiguada deves la retentio de mestruas e de la segondina:	"Form of an instrument with which a woman is fumigated due to the retention of menses and second causes:"
Sia fayta de veyre o de eram.	"It should be made of brass or copper."
E sia pausada la extremitat subtil en le conh e la extremitat ampla sobre le foc, e la sub-fumiguacio sia pausada sobre las brazas del foc.	"And the subtle end should be placed in the womb and the wide end over the fire, and the fumigation should be placed on the embers of the fire."
E tengua aquela entro que sia consumida aquela sub-fumiguacio e itera·n autra.	"And hold it there until that fumigation is consumed, then repeat another one."
De curacio del cul del enfant no-perforat.	"Regarding the cure of the unopened anus during childbirth:"
Motz enfantz naysso e les culs de lu no so perforatz, les quals ya ciphac subtil e opilat.	"Many children are born with their anuses not opened, which are thin and closed."
Adonc cove a la matrona que perfore am le sieu dit aquel ciphac; e sino, perfora aquel am spatum agut, e guarda se que no toque le lacert.	"So the midwife should perforate that ciphac with her finger. And if not, then perforate it with an acute spatula, being careful not to touch the nerve."
E aprop pause sobre aquel lana enfusa en vi e oli; e aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia senat.	"And also place over that wool soaked in wine and oil. And also cure it with salve until it is healed."
Mays si temes que sia opilat, lahoras pausa en le trauc una canula per motz dias, e osta la quan le enfant voldra degerir.	"But if you fear that it is closed, then place a cannula in the hole for several days, and remove it when the child wants to defecate."
E ja accideys oppilacio del cul per consolidacio de plagua o de apostema; adonc cove que aquela consolidacio sia inscidida, e aprop sia curada am aquo que avem dit de la curacio e del plom.	"And it has already happened that the anus became closed due to consolidation of a wound or an abscess. So then that consolidation should be incised and also cured with what we have said about cure and lead."
De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	"Regarding the cure of fistulas that come from there:"
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	"The fistulas that originate at the lower part of the buttocks are usually large and thick, which originate near the anus outside or in the space between the two parts."
E es una fistula o motas.	"And it is one fistula or several."
E cum aquela nodacio es antiquada e corr de la humiditat aygosa blanca o poyridura subtil, e alcunas veguadas so de aquestas fistulas alcunas penetrantz.	"And with that thickness being old and running with moist white humors or thin putrefaction, and sometimes there are some penetrating parts of these fistulas."
E aquelas penetrantz so conogudas per aquo que es eyssit de aquelas per la egressio e per ventosetat; e alcunas vetz use le malaute de egressio, e fort leu es eyssit de aquelas verm.	"And those penetrating parts are known by what comes out of them through exit and windiness. And sometimes the illness itself is used for exit, and often worms come out of them."
E so de aquelas fistulas alcunas veguadas en l’espazi penetrantz entro a la vesica, e entro al meat de la vergua; e so de aquelas penetrantz entro la junctura de la coyssa e entro al notz de la coeta.	"And sometimes those fistulas have penetrating parts that go into the bladder and into the urethra. And those penetrating parts also go into the junction of the perineum and into the opening of the vagina."
E aquo en que es conoguda fistula penetrant entro al cul e no-penetrant, es que tu metas le tieu dit endic en le cul, e entrometas tenta subtil de eram o de ferr en la fistula quan no y es turtuositat.	"And what is known as a penetrating fistula that enters the anus and non-penetrating is this: you put your finger inside the anus, and carefully insert a thin probe of brass or iron into the fistula where there is not too much curvature."
Mays si en aquela es turtuositat, lahoras entromet en aquela tenta subtil de plom o de pels de caval entro que tu sentas la tenta o le pel en le tieu dit.	"However, if there is tortuosity in that, then introduce into that narrow tent of lead or horsehair that you feel the tent or the hair on your finger."
E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	"And if you do not feel anything with your finger and there is no evidence of obstruction, vomiting, or wind, as we have said, then you will know that it is non-penetrating, and you should cease treatment."
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	"And when the fistula is penetrating into the bladder or the meatus of the urethra, then its significance is urinary discharge from that and prohibition of it until the place is consolidated in medicine."
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	"But if it is penetrating into the junction of the hip or into the bone and accompanied by pain in the region, then its sign is that the tent has entered here if there is not tortuosity in the bone, and pain at the site of departure; and that afterwards there will always be putrefaction; and that nothing will help it, nor will it consolidate with ointment."
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	"And in all those penetrating fistulas there is no cure, and the cure of those is the labor and emptiness of the foolish physicians on which we put our faith."
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	"But in that one that is not penetrating and is not ancient, cure with iron is hoped for according to what I will recommend to you, and what I have already said."
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	"And it is that the illness goes between your thighs above its two sides and elevates its camber within itself, the hips are inclined towards its belly, and appropriately enters a lead or iron tent if there is tortuosity in the fistula, into which you should know where the tent has entered."
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	"And if that one feels the illness around the buttocks, then it is necessary for you to insert your index finger into the buttocks."
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	"If you feel the tentacle already inserted in your finger joint before the cut is opened, and if what you feel between your finger joint and that flesh is another thing, then know for certain that it has penetrated; and therefore do not work on that one, as it is not its function."
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	"However some say that it helps in some men's digestion."
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	"And of the treatment by which one hopes to be helped in this, it is that you burn cauterize subtly according to the width of the fistula, as is preceded, and insert that burning into the fistula until it reaches around the bone; and repeat it two or three times until you know that all those flesh that are fitted like a bird's feather quill have been scorched."
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	"And also cure it with hot compresses wrapped in cloth until all those scorched flesh are healed, and then cure it with medicines that generate and strengthen the flesh, and if it is healed, good. And if not, then know for certain that it will never be healed by any other treatment."
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	"And if the tentacle enters and does not penetrate into the anus that you have said is in the buttocks, and between that and the tentacle which is a thin membrane of flesh or skin, and sometimes the fistula follows along the surface of the backbone, then cut off the tail from the beginning of the fistula, and you will see it cut with the tentacle inside it, and let it be in the fistula until the section reaches where the end of the tentacle has reached, and through that tentacle it is freed and cleansed."
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	"And also cleanse those flesh fitted like a bird's feather quill, which have not been injured by any means."
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	"But if blood flows during your procedure while you are operating on those flesh, then millet it immediately and use a light instrument to cauterize with fire or with sharp medicine, for cauterizing with fire has two good habits: it is a scorching of those scorched flesh, and an incision of the blood and drying out of the humidity."
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	"And also cure it with hot compresses wrapped in cloth or in three-folds until the place is healed, and then cure the wound with hard flesh-generating and strengthening medicine."
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	"And these are medicines that have astringent and drying properties; when they are applied, it is restored and healed and there will be no recurrence."
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	"But if the fistula has already penetrated into the anus and is prolonged on the surface of the body, then insert your finger into the anus and feel it with that."
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	"And then if you find the tentacle and between it and yourself there is only a thin membrane of skin or flesh, and it approaches penetration, then it is not an operation to be done on it, but rather by means of faith and hope."
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	"And this is to be administered in one of three ways: either cauterize it as we have said; or dry it out inside until you achieve the concavity through which it is possible to enter with the catgut and perform the cure described above; and do not proceed with a section so that you do not injure the lappet containing the anus, and thus incur the sin of injury without intent. And also cure it with what we have said because even if it is strong, it will be healed quickly. Or stretch out that membrane and cleanse that pus which dried it inside near to the anus as we have said, either with a tentacle or with another instrument with a sharp point, and also cleanse those flesh fitted in the section until they are covered; and then strive to restore all the wound with a suture, and if the opening above is not healed, and the fistula remains open at the beginning of the anus, it will be easier for the disease to occur."
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	"And sometimes the fistula is finished in this way: when you insert the tentacle into the fistula, and it appears on the side of the anus around the surface of the body with the chain and at the edge of the anus, then take a tentacle with a perforated extremity, which is like a needle for preparing hearts according to this form:"
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	"and insert it into that hole wrapped in linen or around those; and also insert the tentacle with thread into the fistula until you achieve the concavity of it."
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	"But if it is penetrating into the edge of the anus close up, then pull out the thread from that track so that you can insert your finger into the anus; and pull out the extremity of the thread and tie both ends together, and stretch each one separately, and leave it like that for one day or two days. And when you see that the thread is cutting into the flesh, then cut away that until those flesh are incised which are between the two ends of the thread and release them."
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	"And also cure the wound until it is consolidated and healed."
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	"But if the opening of the fistula is not penetrating, then cause it to penetrate in whatever way you are prepared, but do not penetrate too far into the anus lest you injure the lappet. And also heal it with that until it is healed."
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	"The form of the spatula with spines with which the fistula is opened: its curvature is very sharp and the other end is not sharp, for it should not injure anything that is not necessary, as sometimes happens."
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	"Regarding the suture of hemorrhoids in which blood flows from the incision of those."
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	"Hemorrhoids are of two kinds: for some are between the buttocks resembling coal, or those which are with thick fat."
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	"And of these some are small and large, and blood flows from them constantly and they are many, and they are outside the anus, and at the extremities of it."
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	"But those hemorrhoids that are outside the anus are according to few humidity, from which flows yellow water or a little blood with continuous flow, and they are according to the color of the body."
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	"And the cure for those that are inside the anus is to tell the patient to squat down and express until the anus opens up and the hemorrhoids appear."
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	"Then you grasp them with forceps or hold them with your fingernail and also cut those off at their roots."
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	"But if the forceps are not held in those because of the humidity and softness of them, then grasp them with rough cloth or with cotton or with a wool bandage, extract those with your said fingers, and also cut those off and sprinkle some powdered myrrh on that wound to cauterize those instead; or cauterize those according to what is said in the chapter on cauterizing."
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	"And then cure them with another cure until they are healed."
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	"And if the anus does not obey evacuation, then cauterize the patient with a small biting cautery, and wash it with water that is in the anus so that it may easily evacuate when the patient strains."
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	"But if the hemorrhoids are outside the anus, then their cause is light and it is that you grasp them with your fingernail or with forceps, cut those off, and cure them with what we have said until they are healed."
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	"And he who makes an incision should administer sutures to them in this manner: take thread wrapped around and put it into a needle and also extract the hemorrhoids from their roots above, and make the thread penetrate with the needle into the root of the other side, and wrap both ends of the thread on one side further away from the needle, and stretch the hemorrhoid strongly with tension, and then tie the thread and remove the needle."
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	"And do this for all, except one, which you should not touch, so that the excess blood flows from that."
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	"And first place a cloth dipped in rosemary oil or cerote on the back, and then place it on his buttocks, commanding him to remain still."
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And then put that cloth inside a box, and when it is dried out, use those or another cure until he/she is healed."
De curacio de fistulas.	"Of the cure of fistulas."
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	"Many times this happens due to the dryness of the fissure or by nature's constriction."
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	"And when these are old and not useful in that medicine, then you should remove them with the point of a spatula or your nail until they are moistened, and wipe off the pus that is on top, which prevents consolidation. Then cure them until they are consolidated."
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	"Now you should remove that very violent pus, first making sure not to wound and to scrape until they are healed."
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	"Of the cure of hemorrhoids, this is the key."
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	"Know that hemorrhoids are like nails, and they are not red but of the color of the skin resembling a small nail head, and they are found throughout the body but more commonly in the parts below the hips and buttocks, and there pain is felt."
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	"And then that which is in the circuit of the nail should be incised and held with forceps or a hook, and eradicated from its root. Then cure it."
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	"And if you wish, cauterize the second one that is mentioned in its chapter."
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	"But a verruca is a small, rough, fistulous elevation on the surface of the body, and many times they appear in the majority of children."
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	"And its cure is that you stretch and incise it, or remove it with a file or with tweezers until it is completely removed."
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	"And if you wish, cauterize it with fire or with an acute medicine, as we have said."
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	"Already those verrucae and warts that are eradicated with the instrument that I shall describe to you."
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	"But a formica is a small, fatty or fistulous elevation on the surface of the body, commonly found on the forehead, and when it is touched it feels like the bite of an ant, and it appears around the body."
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	"And its cure is that you take a feather quill of a dove or an eagle feather, and it should be strong, and place it over the ant so that the circle of the quill contains it in its parts; then rotate your hand with the quill so as to incise what is around the ant, and press it on the flesh, and eradicate the ant from its root."
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	"And if you wish, do this with a wax or iron cautery according to this method:"
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	"Let the end of the cautery be drawn out to a fine point, smooth (i.e. not perforated), wrapped in such a way that when it is placed on the said part, its application and rotation are facilitated."
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	"And if you wish to cauterize the ant according to what has been said before in the chapter of cautery regarding the cauterization of warts."
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	"Regarding the shape of the instruments used for giving circumcision:"
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	"Sometimes circumcision is performed with silver or brass or melted wax or dough. And sometimes it is done with those instruments that are small and large according to the size of those for which they are used, because the one used in the cure of young children should be small; and those whose glans are short or retractile, their circumcisions should be small."
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	"The form of a large and rare circumcision:"
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	"The head of the catheter at its upper end, where the foreskin is tied, should be wide in this manner; and it should be distinguished from where the foreskin is tied like this."
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	"And the lower extremity of it, which is inserted into the glans, should be smooth (i.e. not open) and round, tapering to a fine point; and on one side of it there are two slits, and on the other side one slit, and the width of the slit should be according to the thickness of the glans and foreskin."
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	"And let the bag in which the medicines of bladder or wool are placed be about a span long."
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	"And it should be pierced with many slits so that as it rotates, the space between the slits is equal to the thickness of the finger."
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	"And then insert into those slits a strong thread of raw flax, or envelope them with it, and attach the bag to it. And when the bag is placed on it, tighten it at the head of the catheter between two distinctions with a strong constriction, and then cauterize with that each slit: But the manner of cauterizing with it is that you fill the bag with warm medicine, according to the amount of tolerance of the patient; and take care that it is not too hot nor too cold."
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	"And then the patient should lie on his back, raise his hips up, and place underneath him either cloth or linen. And then anoint the extremity of the cautery with oil or albumen of egg or mucilage of fenugreek or similar substances; then insert it into the glans easily, and then the assistant takes the bag and squeezes it with both hands and presses it violently until everything that is in the catheter is evacuated into the bladder. And then remove the catheter and the patient raises his hips to the wall."
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	"And if the medicine forces him to urinate, let him hold back as much as he can. And if he sleeps with it all night long, it is more likely to be helpful."
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	"But if you circumcise him in the case of diarrhea and frequent urination, then repeat the cautery until he is healed."
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	"And if there are hemorrhoids or painful abscesses in the glans, then use a small and round catheter like those with which children are circumcised."
De curacio de las plaguas.	"Regarding the treatment of plagues:"
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	"I have already said in the division of the treatment of plagues what was appropriate for this book, and I say now the treatment of those with maimed limbs using medicine according to their condition."
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	"Therefore I say that plagues are differentiated according to how they are caused and according to the place where they occur."
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	"And the causes by which plagues often occur are such as penetration of a dart or incision with a scalpel or knife or blow with a lance or club or arrow or similar causes."
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	"But the plagues that occur in the limbs of the body are such as plague that falls on the head, neck, foot, belly, thigh or similar ones on the members."
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	"And I am recounting the treatment of some plagues because this reasoning and rule applies to other plagues as well."
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	"And I will begin with simple head wounds, for the memory of compound ones will come at the beginning of the third chapter."
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	"Therefore I say that when a simple wound occurs on the head and it is not a fracture, then consider: if it is due to penetration by a dart or something similar, and only the scalp has been injured and it is a large wound, you fear that an abscess may form as a result of this illness. Then quickly perform cephalic phlebotomy and do not delay in doing so; and remove from him as much blood as the force of his strength allows, if no other cause prohibits phlebotomy, especially if the blood that comes out of the wound is little."
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	"The lobotomy is the opposite of the plague's departure, keep the patient from drinking water or eating heavy foods."
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	"If you prohibit any cause during the miniaturization process, it would be reduced in size and not approach meat nor wine."
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	"And pause over the plague, if it happens to cause an aposteme (abscess), it is customary to cut it open and dress it with oil mixed with roasted rose or wine in which it becomes thicker/stoptical."
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	"But if you are sure of an abscess having formed, then pause over the plague (abscess), if it is fresh and its blood has not yet changed from that which caused it."
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	"And if the air has already changed from that, then pause over the inflamed ulcer until it is healed."
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	"But if the plague is large or caused by an incision of space and similar ones, and its lips are not properly closed due to dust, then adjust them with a suture according to what I will recommend for the stitching of the lips."
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	"But if the plague is already uncovered by bone and skin, and it is not retention of it but only a small suspension, then incise it and treat the plague with medicines and restore the flesh in place of sinew. Command the patient to be fed foods that are coarse: heads of cabbage and similar ones, until he/she is restored."
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	"And if you find putrefaction in the sinew and it does not adhere to the bone, then incise all that is corrupt and remove it. Then treat it."
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	"But if in these plagues there is an artery or vein from which a flow of blood can come about, and it is not cut off by medicines, then inquire about the artery. If you find that it has not been incised, then incise it with a scalpel, or tie it. And if necessity prompts that what has been said does not work, then cauterize until the blood flow is stopped."
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	"And if these plagues are simple and small, then their cause is light. Therefore, powder them with this powder, so that it may solidify before the air changes them."
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	"And the manner of making the powder is as follows: Take one part oil of sesame, two parts dragon's blood resin, three parts myrrh resin; all well-ground and sifted. With this powder fill the ulcer, and bind it with a good binding so that it may adhere to it and coagulate with blood."
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	"And properly bind that above with powder and leave it alone. Do not remove it while it is still moist, so that the medicine does not lose its efficacy before it is healed."
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	"And sometimes one may use cauterization alone when oil of sesame and dragon's blood resin are not available."
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	"And this same procedure is done in large ulcers when it is convenient to pause upon them and bind them tightly, especially fresh ulcers with their blood, which the air has not yet altered."
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	"And if the air has altered them, and especially when it is summer time, then it is not suitable to apply this powder. In that case treat those ulcers with what has been said: pause upon them with some ointments made from digestives, or pause upon them with flour paste made with water and honey until they become dry; then treat them with the other cure until they are healed."
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	"But if a fracture of bone occurs in the ulcer, and it is small, then extract it with a gesture [i.e., manual manipulation]."
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	"And I say the cure for fractures of the head in what follows."
De las plaguas del col.	"On ulcers of the neck."
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	"But if an ulcer occurs on the neck, then there is no difference in treatment between that and a simple ulcer of the head."
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	"But if the nerve of the neck is incised or an artery, then if it is a nerve, there is nothing to do but avoid treatment with anything that causes violent contraction, such as vinegar and vitriol and similar things because they numb the nerves and contract them."
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	"And do not apply to the ulcer any hot thing, because the substance of nerves is hot and their continuity is with the brain, which is the chief part of all members."
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	"And if it is treated with light medicines, such as a clean wound washed with sweet water, sometimes infused in rose oil or not, and turpentine when washed with sweet water, and other minor stones according to this manner, and moist ointments."
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	"But if the ulcer is large, then apply stitches or draw together the lips of it and properly treat it with powder until it is healed."
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	"But if there is depth in the ulcer or some purulent matter has accumulated at its bottom, then pierce it with something pointed and depressed."
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	"But if an artery is incised in the ulcer and bleeding occurs, then separate it or dry it up, tie it off, or cauterize it if necessity requires it."
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	"But if the vertebrae of the nape or all are injured and the veins of the neck are saved, then adjust the lips of the wound over the spine of the nape with stitches and do not touch it. Then equalize it and reduce it to its natural figure, properly bind it with suitable strapping, leave it for a few days; then treat it with ointments that have astringent and stimulating properties until it is healed."
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	"But if the ulcer has already reached the bone, then percuss it. And if there are fragments of bone in it, remove all that you can; and what cannot be removed, leave it until the ulcer purges itself, separates and its inflammation is alleviated."
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	"And if the ulcer is fresh, then powder it with that powder which I have recommended to you."
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	"But if there is a fistula in the ulcer, then treat it with that of which the memory will come properly in its chapter."
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	"On ulcers of the neck or similar ones when they are between the shoulders and are made with a razor or with a scalpel or with a lance or similar."
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	"If it is a wound from a lance or scalpel and its depth is uncertain, then consider whether there is any wind in the ulcer when the patient breathes out. Then know that the ulcer is fatal."
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	"And if there is no depth and the ulcer is fresh with its own blood, then pause upon it with the first hour powder, and do not bind it tightly so that blood does not remain in its depth and return to the heart and worsen the illness. Rather, pause upon it with attractive ointment and wash it twice a day."
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	"And if the ointment is not at hand, then pause upon the ulcer with cotton wool so that it may suck up the humidity. And make the patient sleep on the ulcer so that what has been applied to it may run."
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	"But if three days or more have passed since the ulcer and there has been no spasm or cardiac tremor nor rigidity of breath in the patient, and other conditions are good, then know that the ulcer is safe; then treat it with linseed and other remedies until it heals."
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	"But if the healing of it is delayed and all time has passed, then know that a fistula has already formed. Therefore treat it according to its chapter."
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	"And if the ulcer is from an incision with a razor or scalpel and is simple on the surface of the foot or hand, then treat it with what is mentioned for suturing if it is large, or with powder if it is small."
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	If there has already been injury to the bone, and it is already incised, then twist the tweezers and gently attempt to extract those pieces if they are separated.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not separated, then leave them where they can be easily reached, as their extraction is facilitated that way.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for other accidental wounds in the other members, the treatment in cure is what we have said
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of the wounds of the belly
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The condition that occurs in the belly is either great, small, or moderate.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Regarding large ones, sometimes the bowel or nerve of the bowel is seen, for which there must be intervention and suture of them to be more forceful and subtle.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And a small disruption is done differently, and indeed it is often difficult to reduce them, unless you quickly intervene with their return to their proper place, because they open up and become swollen so that entry becomes difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best disruption is moderate, because in that one it is not difficult to reduce the bowel, just as it is difficult in both species mentioned above.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And know that suture of the belly is done in four ways, but two sutures are common and convenient for sutures of other wounds of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other sutures are proper to other wounds, but they are more proper in the suture of the belly.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I recount each one with its exposition and explanation.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore I say that when the wound is small and some cause of the bowel comes out through it, and it is difficult to reduce it, then this is in one of two ways: either because of the smallness of the disruption, as we have said, or when inflammation has come to the bowel due to the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when this is the case, then you should scrape it so that you immerse a sponge or moist cloth in hot water alone, or take some water with squinant, and cypripedium, and spikenard, and myrrh with which to moisten the bowel inside until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes it is good to use wine in which there is astringency, and it is better than water alone in the resolution of inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And therefore when you see that the inflammation is resolved, then you moisten the bowel with water in which there is a lot of salt and mallows, because by this means entry becomes easier with little cause.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if the entry of it is not facilitated by this cure, then cut open the disruption a little with an instrument with which you have made incisions.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first cure is better, when it is appropriate that it is not sectioning, and there is no need to cut open unless it is necessary and urgent.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Of the instrument, see its shape:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	Sharpen one part of the knife acutely, and make the other part blunt; let its extremity be subtle but not too sharp-pointed.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore when the hernia has been pushed out and comes forth through the anus, it is necessary to reduce it again according to its natural form in its proper place if this can be done.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the rupture is wide and situated in the lower part of the belly, then you should make the patient lie on their back and elevate their hips as much as their head; but if it is in the upper part of the belly, then you should elevate the head and feet as high as possible.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	Similarly if the rupture is in one of the two sides of the belly, then always have your intention and attention directed towards that side where the hernia is located so that it may be elevated higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And this should also be done in both large and moderate hernias.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	"In small plagues, pause what is prepared for you, and immediately make your servant be between your hands with his entire disruption held in one hand and adjust the lips of it."
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	"This is the common method of suturing: take the needle, or count needles according to the amount of the plague's width. Then leave from the extremity of the disruption of the said finger, and thread the needle once, but do not insert it in both extremities of the skin with two knots that remain outside the skin on both sides of the parted flesh, until you have made it penetrate one side; then you have joined both extremities of the skin and both extremities of the ciphac, and now make four stitches."
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	"And again thread with double thread around the needle, and sometimes take both parts together, and then join both lips and the plague decently. Then leave the thickness of the finger and put another needle in it, and then tie it with thread like you did with the first needle; do not stop doing this if necessary until all the contraction of the plague is complete."
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	"And the needles should be between thickness and subtlety, for subtle needles hardly cut into the flesh, while thick ones are difficult to insert in the skin. Therefore they should be of medium thickness."
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	"And it is not necessary that the needle should be inserted in both extremities of the skin too much, lest the flesh be lightly cut and the wound opens before its consolidation."
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	"And do not make the stitches too long so that the wound is not prevented from healing."
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	"And then cut the extremities of the needles so that they do not leave the wound open during sleep. Then press over the stitches powdered with a little of each herb, which will hold the extremities of the needles in place; and leave them until you know that the wound has healed."
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	"And these kinds of stitches with needles are more suitable for small wounds, where one needle or two may be enough to close them."
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	"But the second stitch is common: it consists of bringing together with a single stitch all four extremities of the skin and both extremities of the cicatrix, using a needle with thread wound around it in subtlety and thickness."
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	"And when the needle has passed through these four extremities, you will reduce it from that same side where you started, so that the thread draws back and brings the edges of the wound together in order to make a stitch like sewing with cloth, with which the edges are strengthened."
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	"And pause between each stitch the thickness of the little finger."
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	"And this stitch is known by men."
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	"And with this stitch I closed a wound that had been caused by a knife to a man in his belly, which was about two palms long and wide. The disruption of the wound was more than one palm, and it had exited from the bowels around two palms near the middle of the member. And then I reduced that part where the bowel had been torn for 24 hours."
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	"And the wound was healed in the space of about fifteen days or so, and the man was cured. And he lived many years after that, and is still alive today."
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	"And other doctors had judged that he would not be healed; and by miracle he was healed, for I did not cure him with any ointment, because it was a place where no ointment nor any medicine could be applied. But I put cotton soaked in honey on the wound twice a day and washed it assiduously with water of honey until it was healed."
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	"But I will tell you two kinds of stitches proper according to the narrative of the Word."
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	"And it is that you begin with a stitch on the skin edge, and insert the needle from without inwards."
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	"And then, as the needle penetrates into the skin and through the length of the wound, leave the extremity of the cicatrix in which you inserted the needle; and make the needle pass through the other extremity from within outwards in the other extremity of the member."
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	"And then, when you have made it penetrate once more, now make it penetrate again in the same extremity of the member from without inwards; and leave the extremity of the cicatrix that is on this side, and make the needle pass through the other extremity from within outwards."
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	"And then, with that same penetration with which you made it penetrate into the cicatrix in the extremity of the member which is on the inside so that all may penetrate."
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	"And then begin from this same side and pass it with the extremity that is of the cicatrix on the other side, and withdraw the needle from the skin which has penetrated, and reduce it in that skin and attach the extremity of the cicatrix which is on the other side with this extremity of the member; and withdraw it from the skin which is on its part."
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	"And do this once or twice, and do it once again just as often until you close all that is without according to that example."
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	"And the sum of this manner of stitching is that you close with a skin stitch by which you close the skins, so that you close the cicatrix once from the side of the skin edge, and leave it open again until it has completed."
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	"But the second kind of proper stitching which you have especially taught by Galen, and this is of speech concerning it and recommended by him, is that you close it in such a way that certain physicians close it, namely, bringing together all parts to their corresponding parts by nature; and they apply the extremity of one part to the extremity of another part, and this is done according to what I have told you."
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	"That you leave the needle in the extremity of the member near the skin edge, and make it penetrate from without into the depth of that same place, leaving two extremities of the cicatrix; and then turn the needle round and make it penetrate again from without to within through both extremities of the cicatrix."
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	"And then turn those loops round, and make them penetrate from the depth outwards in two extremities of the member on the opposite side."
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	"And this manner of stitching is better than common loose stitching, and it is the stitching of which I have previously spoken."
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	"This is the speech of Galen"
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	"And some say that stitching of the belly is corrected with two needles, so that you insert in each a thread, and begin with needle insertion from where it is necessary for you to begin, and make it penetrate inwardly towards the other side according to stitching of those who close the veins by this method."
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	"And know that when a disruption is in the middle of the belly, then stitching of it is more difficult than that of other places on the belly."
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	"But judgment about treatment of wounds is judged by other wounds also."
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	"The reason for which is that when you close a fresh wound with its own blood before the air alters it, and reduce the bowel and close it and apply to it a suitable poultice, then you put dust upon that healing powder."
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	"And if the air has already altered the wound, then you put upon it some such things as are present which make a hard scar and join together the threads, and are consolidated cicatrix and member; and then cure it thus as is the curing of other wounds until it is healed."
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	"However, if you are not present with the medicines, then pause over that immediately, for it begins to emit a strong odor twice daily. Thus, as you have taught me, between times when it is healed, you do not need another medication in many dispositions when the plague is simple."
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	"If you fear that the plague may communicate to lesions in the principal limbs, then it is necessary that you submerge lion's oil in oil of high quality, or olive oil, and place those on the circuits of the joints between the elbows and armpits."
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	"And if you feel pain or putrefaction in its bowels, for many times this occurs, then crystallize it with black treacle vinegar and even more so if the corruption has reached the bowel and it is difficult to penetrate into its concavity."
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	"And know that that which is of the large intestine is of easier healing than that which is in the subtle intestines."
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	"And it is difficult to heal that bowel which is called 'gegunu' because it does not receive healing from any plague that falls into it; and this is due to the large number of veins that are in it, and its magnitude, and its subtlety, and its proximity to the nature of nerves."
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	"But if what proceeds from the plague is flesh, and you obtain that recently, then reduce it according to your discretion with which you also reduce the intestines equally."
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	"But if it has passed some time and it is already green or black, then strengthen it with faith on the spot that is darkened by it, so that blood fluxes may come, for in the flesh there are veins and arteries."
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	"And moreover incise that which is other than that limb, and pause at the ends of the thread hanging from the parts of the plague, so that over you may be relieved the attraction of it, you must cut off the skin and express the branch of the plague."
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	"Remembrance of the plagues when they occur in the bowel."
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	"When there is disruption in the bowel and it is small, then it is possible that it may be restored in some men, for example that one who was struck in his belly with a lance blow and the plague was on the right side of the stomach, and the plague was old and without fistula, and it had issue and wind."
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	"Therefore I followed the cure of him although it was not finished in the healing of it, but ceased to subtly examine that interior which had been healed and the place was consolidated."
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	"And I then saw that the place was already consolidated, so I spoke to him about the ailment that might occur because of the accident in his belly; and he did not become ill at all because of that accident, but remained in his usual dispositions eating and drinking, and indeed entered a bath and exercised himself in his sayings."
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	"And already some experienced ones say that when there is plague in the bowel and it is small, then it must be tied in this manner: take frogs with large mouths; and indeed adjust the two lips of the plague and place one of those which has its mouth open over the two lips of the plague. Then when it takes hold on those and opens its mouth, cut off its head, for it adheres and is not dissolved."
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	"And moreover place another frog near the first one, and do not cease doing this with frogs according to the quantity of all the plague."
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	"And moreover reduce that and close the plague, and those attached heads will remain in the bowel interior when the bowel is healed, and it does not occur any harm to anyone."
