E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	"And already it is possible that the bowel may be tied with a subtle thread which is made from the bowel of an attached animal, because it is more like a needle; and take the end of these bowels, and let it be much cleaned, and indeed tie the end of it with thread of linen, wrapped, and moreover insert that thread in needles and sew with that bowel, and reduce it in the disruption."
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	"And this manner of suture with frogs is only a way of trust and hope."
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	"But if the plague is large and extensive, especially if it is in one of the small bowels, for then it is only a subtle examination, and not the healing of it altogether."
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	"About the cure of dropsy and fistula."
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	"Know that every plague and abscess when it opens and becomes old, and is not consolidated and gives off branch at all times and is not cut off, then in whatever member it may be, universally it is called a fistula, and we call it that ulcer."
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	"And according to truth, a fistula is a hard, thickened, white nodosity without pain and with a cavity like the cavity of the navel, for this reason it is called that ulcer which is wrinkled, that is, a navel."
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	"And in some men it is humid and gives off branch, and when the humidity is cut off within certain hours."
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	"And sometimes this humidity is much, little, thick, and subtle."
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	"And I have already said before in the division when I spoke of plagues that every ulcer which is not healed or not on bare flesh is due to one of these causes: either because of lack of blood in the body, or its malice, or because between it and its lips there is hard cartilage prohibiting the birth of flesh, or because it is too large, or because it contains putrefaction and the matter that passes through it is of bad quality, or because medicine is unsuitable for its cure, or because corruption begins in the region and there is pestilence, or because of the property of the region as at Saragossa where difficult digestion of diseases occurs and there is delay in the healing of abscesses by nature, or because there are bones in it, one or many."
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	"I have already shown all those causes and their symptoms and the cure of them with medicines in the division."
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	"And it is proper that I should make you know the cure of fistula which is done by way of operation with a knife."
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	"And know that fistulas occur in all the members of the body because there are those which pertain to large veins and arteries, or nerves, or the caecum, or the bowel, or the bladder, or to some of the ribs, or to some of the vertebrae of the back, or to certain composite joints by composition like that of the hand and foot; and there are those which give nearness to the principal member and similar ones."
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	"And therefore those fistulas among these which are in this manner are of difficult healing and do not receive cure, and occupation with them is labor and ignorance."
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	"And if there is among the fistulas one whose depth does not pertain to those places which have been mentioned and you hope and trust in its cure and want to come to knowledge of it, then take a probe of earth or iron, and if the fistula goes straight, examine it with that."
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	"But if the fistula is tortuous then investigate it with a probe of subtle lead because lead by its lightness is alleviated and bent according to its tortuousness."
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	"And if the fistula has many horrific branches, then you cannot examine it with a probe."
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	"Therefore dilate the horrific part by its horrific parts because the moisture with which you dilate that will go down towards the other horrific parts and their course."
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	"Then inquire carefully, according to the manner you are able, whether here has been bone or nerve damage. Determine if this is a distant or nearby fistulous cavity, or if it is a fistula with multiple openings and lies beneath all of this with great force, upon which you must examine the patient's complaint with your full strength. With this examination comes the discovery of pain, which you should compress with your hand over the area."
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	"And when you have examined all those causes with true steadfastness, then proceed to the treatment with confidence: first consider whether it is an apparent fistulous opening near the skin surface or far from joints, nerves, arteries, veins, or any other location you find."
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	"Then dry the fistula according to what is mentioned earlier about its nose, and remove that which comes from this filtration of rotting flesh, and that which is born in the opening of the flesh or of the skin and similar things. And cure that wound so it may be healed."
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	"But if the fistula is of great depth and runs perpendicularly, then you must insert your finger into it as far as possible and carefully clean out all rotting flesh. Then apply compresses soaked in acrid medications and place them inside the cavity of the fistula which you have grasped with forceps."
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	"And do this several times until the acrid medication has eaten away all the rotting matter in the cavity of the fistula."
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	"Then restore it with dressings that produce healthy flesh, until it is healed."
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	If it is not healed by this, then cauterize according to what we have recommended.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	If the cause of the fistula is bone and it needs to be certified, then you should explore that and dry it according to what we have recommended, provided that you do not harm any vein, nerve or main member as we have said.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	If the bone is exposed and there is some corruption and blackness in it, then remove that flesh within which the corruption has spread entirely; afterwards treat it with this medicine until it heals.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it does not heal and casts out flesh like before, then know that you have not yet reached the complete eradication of corruption; therefore uncover carefully and examine the cause of it and cleanse it with your last strong remedy, and afterwards restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And if it is healed, then good! But if not, know that the corruption is in the deep and remote parts of the body which you have not reached, and therefore you should leave it alone.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the corrupted bone is small or can be extracted, then extract it using fine forceps suitable for that purpose.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if there are many bones, then carefully extract all of them and do not leave any cause untreated with your strength.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if there is any difficulty in removing the cause due to humidity or flesh or sinews, and there is no fear of error in its incision, then incise those membranes or flesh if it is nearby, and deliver the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if you are not able to extract the bones at that time, then close over the wound with a dressing that will keep it moist. Leave that in place until that dressing is absorbed and the wound becomes consolidated and healed around those flesh and sinew-covered bones. Keep the dressing clean so that it does not become contaminated.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	When dressing the wound, if you fear infection, cover it with a dressing soaked in olive oil or Egyptian pitch or one of the green ointments, for when those membranes are dried out, they will separate from the bones and their attraction will be alleviated.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	But if it is a large bone such as the thighbone or shinbone, or one similar to them, and only the surface of that bone is corrupted, then scrape off that corruption with a curette until all the blackness and corruption have been removed, and then restore the dressing.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	But if a large portion of the bone is corrupted and the corruption has already reached the marrow of the bone, then it is necessary to close that wound and incise it at the location where the corruption has penetrated. Then treat it until it becomes consolidated.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I recommend to you that when operating on the thighbone of a man, you use this model and assistant for your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	A young man of about 30 years old presented with pain in his thigh. Upon examination, it was found that the inflammation was on the inside of the thigh and had extended to the bone. There was a large abscess with no external cause.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And so the time was prolonged with that patient due to the error of the physicians, who allowed the abscess to become hard. Much material had accumulated and its treatment was suspended until the thigh became fistulated. Then it was opened in many orifices from which pus and humidity of the body were discharged.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And so he consulted many doctors for about two years, but none of them knew how to treat it except me when I was called.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And I saw the thigh of that man and the material that flowed from those orifices for a great distance. The whole body of that man was already emaciated, and his complexion was yellowish.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And then I inserted a probe into one of those orifices and reached the bone with it.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	And then you examined all the orifices carefully and found that they originated from all parts of the thigh.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	And then I took courage and incised one of those orifices until I discovered a portion of the bone. I scraped off that corrupted part, which was earthy, corrupt and discolored. And already a portion of the thigh had been corrupted, having penetrated into the muscle
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	Then I removed what was discovered and prepared from the bone that was uncovered
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And you should have seen that it was not in the bone but only that corruption which you could excise and remove, as I had already removed.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	Then he paused the dressing with a consolidation medicine for a long time, but it did not consolidate.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then I reopened and discovered over the bone again according to the first discovery, and scraped off continuous corruption from the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And I removed what appeared to be that corruption, and yet you continued with the treatment and dressing of him, but it was not restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And then you discovered it again and did not cease incising the bone little by little particularly and continuing the dressing of him, but it was not restored until you incised about a palm's length, and then you extracted it with the marrow itself, and then you restored it with medicines, and it healed lightly and became consolidated.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	It was not necessary to repeat the operation and section of that thigh except for the disposition of his fearlessness and lack of tolerance, and his fear of death. For he was lazy in all hours due to excess evacuation and fainting badly.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	Therefore, he healed completely, and there was nothing in place of hard bone and flesh. He had good posture in his body and regained his strength; he changed his ways and did not cause any harm or damage in any way during walking nor by any cause.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if the bone is prominent in place of the flesh and causes pain, then you should cut it off in this manner: Take a strong thread and tie it at the end of that prominent bone, and command someone to stretch it out. Then take another piece of thick thread and bind it over the first one. Then bind it over the flesh that is next to the bone, stretching the end of it so that you draw the flesh aside from those parts where you want to cut, and then uncover the flesh over the place where you want to saw so that the saw does not touch the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And place a piece of wood or a board beneath the bone neatly, for when you do this, it prevents the saw from cutting into the corrupt flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	The sawing should be done little by little over the corrupt place, because if there is corruption in the concavity of the bone and it does not appear in its appearance to the touch, it may be necessary to saw again later.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	But if the bone is corrupted but not prominent, then it means that one part is continuous with another, and the corruption is in the middle or in a part of it. In this case, you should uncover all the flesh from every side; place wood beneath it, and saw off the first part where the corruption begins so that the sawing continues to the other part.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	The sawing should be done according to the location of the corruption, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is at the joint, incise that corrupted joint and saw off the bone where it continues with the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	But if the corruption is in the continuity of two joints, then it is not in reason but by chance.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the palm of the hand or foot, it is very difficult. But you should investigate how the corruption appears to you and abrade it accordingly, cleaning it according to each position that is possible for you, so that with each operation, you rectify what you can without harming any vein or nerve.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	"And you should know what are the incidors and saws used to cut these bones. They must be appropriate according to the situation of the bones, their preparation, thickness, subtlety, size, smallness, hardness, and rarity; thus, you must prepare all kinds of tools suitable for that operation."
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	"You should know that this operation involves the use of tools of which you stand in need; when your knowledge and experience in the ways of this art are great and long, and you have seen many cases of illness, then it is fitting for you to know what tools are convenient for each illness."
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	"And now, at the end of this chapter, you will learn the number of instruments that you will use with ease to perform your prohibition, which you will experience on others."
Forma de serra:	Here are some common forms of saws used in medicine and their uses:
Forma de autra serra:	"Another method:"
Forma de autra serra:	"Another method:"
Forma de autra serra gran:	"Another method for a large hernia:"
Forma de ray:	"Method of Ray:"
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	"The head of this awl is shaped like a star-headed key, and its points are shaped like the points of a drill."
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	"And it is not necessary except that with this (instrument) the heads of the joints should be rubbed when they are spoiled, or if the mouth is too wide."
Forma de razori major dels autres:	"Form of a larger razor than the others:"
Forma de razori menor:	"Form of a smaller razor:"
Forma de razori lat:	"Form of a broad razor:"
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	"A well-made form for another saw: let it be made in the shape of a semicircle with sharp edges like a knife blade."
Forma de lu:	"What is its shape?"
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	"Form of razor with concavity:"
Forma de razori autra subtil:	"Form of another subtle razor:"
Forma de autra razori de curvada extremitat:	"Form of another razor with a curved end:"
Forma de rasori petit semblant a tenta:	"Form of small razor resembling a tent."
Forma de incisori am le qual so inscidit les osses:	"The shape of the cutter used to cut bones:"
Forma de inscisori autra minor:	"Form of another smaller cutter:"
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	"Form of another cutter; this one resembles an awl and has a serrated end. It is used in many places for cutting bone fractures."
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	"The shape of the awl which is suitable for use on those who are pierced by bones:"
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	"And its end is triangular with a sharp point."
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	"And it is made of Indian steel, and similarly for all the cases that we have mentioned concerning razors, cutters, and saws."
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	"For cutting through extremities and for the serration of bones."
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	"Extremities can be injured due to intrinsic causes or extrinsic causes. If, after treating the corruption with medicinal remedies, there is no improvement in the condition, sometimes the corruption may spread to other parts without any apparent cause. In such cases, it becomes necessary to cut into that member at the point where the corruption has reached, so that the illness may subside and not result in death or harm, which would be a greater loss of the member."
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	"And the sign of someone in whom this has occurred is that the member becomes black where it was burned or scorched, or the blackness spreads to where the putrefaction entered that member which extends and takes over the entire body. Therefore, it is necessary to cut into that."
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	"And similarly, if corruption occurs due to the bite of some venomous creatures such as scorpions, marine animals, vipers, or similar ones."
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	"And if the corruption or bite is at the tip of the finger, then cut off the finger so that the corruption does not spread to the hand."
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	"And similarly, if it reaches the hand, then cut off the hand at the wrist joint so that the corruption does not spread to the arm."
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	"And if it affects that person, then cut off the arm at the elbow joint."
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	"And if corruption passes beyond that and sometimes reaches around the elbow joint, then death from this illness occurs. Administering any other cause for treatment at that stage is merely a matter of quantity of virtue."
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	"And similarly, when corruption affects the toe of the foot, then cut it off at one of the joints."
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	"And if it affects the ankle of the foot, then cut off the entire foot."
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	"But if it can go into the knee, then cut off the leg at the joint of the knee."
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	"But if corruption has already spread to the knee, then there is no remedy except for release, and let the illness take its course to death."
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	"The manner of cutting off the member or sawing it is that you stretch a bandage on the side where you want to cut, and another bandage over that place. And let the assistant extend one bandage to the sides below, and let him extend another bandage above. And you separate the flesh which is between the two bandages with a wide blade until all the flesh is exposed, and then it can be cut off or sawn."
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	"And it is necessary that linen cloths be placed on all sides to prevent infection from occurring, and that the wound be dressed properly with clean bandages."
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	"But if bleeding occurs while working, then cauterize the place carefully, or apply some absorbent powders to stop the bleeding. And then return to your treatment until it is complete."
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And then bind up the member with linen cloth in a convenient manner and care for it until it heals."
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	"And I report to you something that happened to a man in his foot, which I and you are reporting here. This is the fourth case where blackness appeared on his foot with burning like fire."
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	"And this corruption occurred first on his toe and then spread throughout his entire foot."
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	"Therefore that man decided to cut off his foot because of the intensity of its corruption which caused him great pain and burning. So he cut off his foot at the ankle joint, and it healed."
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	"For a long time afterwards that same corruption appeared on the tip of his finger."
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	"And then it came upon me, and that surplus which I had placed on the hand of medicines, immediately returned to cleanse the body; but the surplus did not return, and it began to flow into the other finger before it even reached the hand."
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	"And he ordered me to cut his hand, but I did not want to do that hoping for the return of that surplus, and more so fearing the death of the patient, because the force of the disease was overwhelming."
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	"And after he left me, he returned to his land and I heard that the man was prepared and had cut off his whole hand, and he was healed."
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	"And I do not now narrate this story except to be helpful regarding what can be said about this illness, and that it may have meaning according to which it is interpreted and acted upon."
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	"De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis" can be translated as "On the treatment of diseases of the spleen and the quality of cleansing with medicines by enema". This phrase suggests that it is a medical text discussing the treatment of diseases related to the spleen, and the use of medicinal enemas in such treatments.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	"When an apostema occurs in some fleshy members and the space of the apostema is prolonged until it collects pus, and then it bursts and perforates, and the pus is discharged from it, and the place remains void as if it were a vessel, and the skin that is above it appears like finely woven cloth, and it has not reached ultimate corruption, and does not print on bone or nerve or ligament, it is called 'sinu', and it is not called fistula."
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	"But if the space is prolonged until corruption prints on some member, then it is called 'fistula' and not 'sinu'."
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	"And the treatment of it is that you cut away that skin entirely as it is turned back over itself, especially when it is thin and made like cloth, so that it does not adhere to the place because of its corruption."
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	"But if you hope that the skin will adhere and that that corruption has not yet reached its ultimate conclusion, and there is some opening in the skin, then you treat it with an enema."
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	"And when you consider the sinu, if it is large and the arm that comes out has a fetid odor, then you administer an enema with the Egyptian medicine which is made of oil and vinegar and cinnamon received in equal parts, and they are ground together in a vessel, and cooked over the fire until the medicine becomes hot and reaches the consistency of honey."
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	"And then you take as much of that as is necessary and dissolve it with water and honey; and administer that enema to the sinu, and strengthen the opening of it, and leave the medicine in it for the duration of two hours."
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	"And then you remove that with a sponge; and do so for however many days are necessary until the sinu is cleansed and the corruption is removed."
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	"And sometimes an enema is administered with water of ashes when this medicine is not available; and you take the ash of vitriol, and place it on the water; and then cook that and administer that enema with it until you are assured that the sinu is now healed."
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	"And if the patient does not tolerate the Egyptian medicine or the water of ashes, then you administer an enema with warm water and honey mixed together with three parts cinnamon, and also administer it with wine and honey mixed together; for the property of honey is to cleanse and wash, and wine makes the sinu adhere, especially when there is excess of astringency and dryness in the wine."
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	"And when you do this sometimes and you are assured that the sinu has been removed, then you administer an enema with that which causes flesh to grow in it."
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	"And when you take of the ointment called diafinicon and dissolve it with sweet oil and astringent wine; or whatever other medicines and ointments you administer that have properties which I have already written about in the treatise on ointments."
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	"And if the opening of the sinu is narrow and the cannula of the enema cannot be received, then you dilate it with a small iron gradually, and pause in it with a hot cloth wrapped in Egyptian ointment or basilicon ointment until it has been dilated."
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	"And similarly, if the opening is wide, then you gather together its lips with a suture and leave in it the amount which enters between the enema without addition."
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	"And if the opening of that from which the arm emerges is elevated above its parts, then you dry it at its base where it enters into it so that the arm may run freely; for when the arm is restricted by the narrowness of the sinu, flesh can be generated there."
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	"And if it is not possible to dry the sinu at the entrance of the os near its base as you wish, then have the member prepared with such preparation that the arm may emerge from it lightly according to your desire and that there is in it no cause for the arm to be retained."
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	"And take medicines which are consolidative and suitable for the purpose that you wish, and apply those over a cloth of lint."
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	"And the cloth should be of such a size that it covers all of the sinu; and then you insert with forceps on the right side of the opening of the sinu a strip of linen a little wider than the opening of the sinu, and then you extend over another piece of linen some of the ointments mentioned above according to the size of the strip, and apply it over that for a distant position from the opening of the sinu so that the exit of the arm from it is alleviated, and do not leave the cloth on any longer than about three days once."
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	"But that which is over the opening of the sinu, you remove it at all times so that nothing may be adjusted to the arm."
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	"And in order that you may know whether that which emerges from the arm is much or little, or digested, or undigested:"
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	"And with this you also consider the place of that sinu, whether the patient feels pain there or not, and if there is an abscess."
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	"And when your treatment has been prolonged in this manner and you see that the matter which is poured over the opening of the sinu adheres or approaches adhesion, then you remove it on the third day, and when you remove it, then change the cloth for another and renew the ointment."
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	"But if the sinu is far apart from space and there is subtle virus, then do not despair of its adhesion, for its healing is near; for some people in whom flesh is slowly generated in their wounds, and among them are those in whom it happens conversely."
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	"And if from the sinu after many days an undigested arm emerges, then you know that the sinu does not adhere; and if the adhesion of the sinu is delayed and the cause is prolonged, then you apply medicines which are drying, and if the medicines are humid in their substance and virtue, they are dry like diafinicon ointment when there is excess addition of sage."
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	"And the last most effective thing with which it is treated is that you take diafinicon ointment and dissolve it in sweet oil, and mix it well with old wine in its substance, and then apply it over there and use it."
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	"And in that action, if there is no arm present, use diafinicon ointment mixed with honey, cooked until it thickens, or take myrrh and aloe wood and incense, triturate all of them and powder over the honey when it is hot on the fire, then line this over cloth and apply it over the sinu; and also line that with honey which you have cooked until it thickens, and powder over cloth."
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	Sometimes a long and rough broth of heaven's lilies (and it is the lilies of heaven) and flour of barley and centaurea is administered, and use those simples or adjust them, sieve them and sift them and powder them over the honey which has been recommended.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the wound is prolonged and not healed by this treatment, you will know that corruption has spread to the bone itself, and then you must investigate whether it has reached the joints or other hard parts or even ligaments. Then you should treat it with fistular cure, as described above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Of the treatment of blisters and nails rubbed raw and cutting the tip of the finger added and sectioning.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	A blister is an abscess that appears beneath the nail of the thumb or another finger and grows more quickly on other fingers. If it is prolonged its treatment is more difficult, either it is an abscess from a cauterized abscess, or it is corrupt and throws out pus which corrodes the root of the nail, and often the whole of it becomes corrupted, and often its corruption reaches the bone within, which then has a foul odor, and the tip of the finger becomes blackened, and its color becomes dark.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And therefore, when you have that which has been said in the division and your treatment is not effective, then you must incise with iron all the superfluity that remains of the nail, and immediately cauterize the wound with it, for cautery is very useful in this case.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, but the growths at the edges of the nail begin to compress the flesh within, and they start to pierce and cause pain there, then you must make a thin cut from the angle of the nail that pierces the flesh, and push it out and incise that flesh easily, and place over that which remains of the flesh medicines corrosive enough to remove everything; and immediately treat it with ointments until it is healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if the corruption has already entered into the bone, then you must incise the bone there and extract it, for there is no time when the bone can be healed if it is corrupt.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the corrosion and corruption extend to the finger, then you must incise it at one of its joints according to how far it has spread, and immediately treat it until it is healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if the nail receives percussion or attrition and there is intense pain in that place, then at the beginning you must bleed the sore, and immediately dry the nail with a sharp spatula with a transverse section from top to bottom, taking care that the section does not reach the flesh that is under the nail, for you will cause intense pain to the sore, and it will be the cause of the formation of excess flesh in that place; and immediately treat that place with something that relieves pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	But a finger that is swollen, which occurs in many men, is usually all flesh and very painful to the bone, or it may be very painful in the nail.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them are born at the root of the joint, or the formation is in some joints of these fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	But that which is formed in some joints of the finger is not painful, but that which is formed at the joints is usually very painful.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And those that are born fleshy, the section is easy, and it should be incised there near its root with a wide spatula.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	But that which is born at the root of the joint is difficult to cure; therefore beware of the amputation of it.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But that which is formed in the finger near the joints must be incised at the beginning with a round incision into the bone, and immediately saw it with one of those suitable saws for that, and immediately treat it until it is healed.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	But consolidation which occurs in these between their visible veins or by the nature of the person who is born that way, or by consolidation of phlegm or by burning with fire, or by similar causes, then you must dry that consolidation until those fingers return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And immediately place between their bands of linen soaked in rose oil to prevent them from becoming consolidated lightly, and separate those, or place between those a thin sheet of lead so that they are consolidated according to what is necessary.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly if consolidation occurs in some of these with the palm, then you must dry that consolidation according to what is prepared and suitable for the figure of the member.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Of incision of veins, there are two kinds:
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Vices such as varicose veins are caused by thick, engorged veins full of melancholic superfetations which occur more often in the legs, especially among those who travel, work hard or carry heavy loads.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Then you should administer a purge of the black bile from the body several times with strong expulsion, and also bleed the patient from the basilica vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	But the treatment of varicose veins with iron is done in two ways: one is that it should be incised and the black blood drawn out, and the other way is that the vein should be elevated and all of it extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The procedure is as follows: first, insert a sharp instrument at the beginning of the vein with cold water so that the thick blood may be resolved and liquefied. Then, tie off the unhealthy part of the vein below the swelling using a bandage, and then cut the vein open wide in one or two or three places. Next, elevate the black blood from the vein at the upper end of the unhealthy part, using a tube, and draw out as much blood as desired, repeating this process several times until the vein is emptied of its harmful properties.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then ligature that vein, and command the patient to abstain from foods that generate black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And repeat the treatment by phlebotomy when the veins are filled again and it is necessary for the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	But the elevation of varicose veins is done in this way: first, remove any bandages from the affected area and then have the patient bathe and insert cold water into the vein until it becomes reddened and the veins are dilated. Alternatively, you may exercise the limb vigorously if bathing is not available, until the member becomes fatigued.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then cut the cord in the direction of the vein on the right side at its length or at its end above the knee joint, or below it at the ankle.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And then tie off the cord with a ligature and strip away the vein from all around it until it appears at the surface of the skin. This should be done while the vein is still pulsating, because sometimes it becomes dark-colored after being tied off.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	Then carefully remove the ligature and tie again with a white thread that is strong enough to hold together.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then place some lint there until it becomes elevated and freed from the ligature, and suspend it with a linen bandage.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then cut another section near that section three days later, and strip away the vein from its attachment above it until it becomes visible.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And then elevate that again and incise it in another section below the ankle, and then extract it from that section until it is emptied by the second section, and also extract it from the section that is above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do this until you have extracted all of it from the section that is above or below all the sections, so that everything is emptied. Then stitch it closed.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you are unable to extract and elevate the vein completely, then insert a strong doubled thread needle into it and ligate it and remove it. Otherwise, place some lint there and roll your hand around it until it is expelled.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And be careful not to cut into the vein, because if it breaks, it will become difficult to elevate and will cause harm to the patient through that injury.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when all of it has been removed, then apply to the wound a dressing made of wool soaked in rose oil and unguent roseum. Cover this with another dressing and let it heal.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the vein is contracted and twisted in such a way that it has no straightness to it according to what we have said, then you must make incisions along all of its tortuous parts and at the points where it is adhered. Then suspend it with ligatures until you have elevated it completely.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And be careful when making your incision that you do not cut into the vein or damage it, because it will then be difficult to elevate. Use caution and skill in this procedure.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Form of the Incision with which a Vein is Cut:
Forma de unci orp:	Shape of a Ligature:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	"It is not sharp like needles and does not have a pointed tip so it will not pierce the vein. It has thick flexibility like that of a lion. If it were thin, it would cut through the vein due to its fineness."
De extraccio venae cruris.	"Removal of a leg vein."
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	"This vein is found in the calves of the legs, especially in hot lands like those inhabited by Arabs and in dry, arid lands with little tenderness where neither grass nor herbs grow."
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	"And it is also generated in other places on the body besides the calves."
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	"And its movement is one of putrefaction that extends from the spine like venom, coming from within the body, causing serents and worms to appear between the spine and the flesh."
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	"And a sign of the onset of this condition is inflammation in the calf, with swelling at that location. The vein begins to emerge from the site of that swelling, appearing like a plant root."
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	"And then when the vein appears at its end, you should take a piece of lead weighing as much as two dragons [an ancient unit of weight] and tie it around that area. Leave the lead hanging from the calf."
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	"And whenever it happens that some cause appears outside it, cover that with lead and leave it tied in place."
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	If the condition persists, then cut off a part of it and wrap up the remaining; do not cut that which has not yet come out, for if you cut that, it will constrict and enter the flesh causing an abscess and putrefaction in the area leading to bad ulceration.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	It is necessary that it should be treated slowly and extracted little by little, until it is completely removed from the body and no remnant of it remains in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And some men have told me that this vein is as long as 20 fingers, and I have even heard that one man has had it as long as 30 fingers.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is cut at the time of its treatment, then insert a probe into its track and pierce that with a long probe through the body until all liquid is evacuated from the matter, and apply putrefactive medicines to the area for several days; and afterwards treat it as you would treat an abscess.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes has many branches, especially when it appears at the junction of the leg or in the leg itself, and it comes out with many openings; it is said that there are almost as many branches as openings.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And so treat it thus as we have said in its division, along with what has been said above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	On the section of worms generated under the skin, also called bovine disease
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This disease is called in some lands the bovine disease because it often affects cattle and there are many worms that are born between the skin and the flesh, which crawl throughout the body and cause swelling of member after member until they break through the skin and come out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And its generation is due to putrefaction of some humors, just like the occurrence of worms and serpents and earthworms and roundworms in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared because of its harmfulness, for when it goes into the body and rises to the head, then it often enters the brain and causes damage to it, and this happens very often.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And therefore when you wish to treat it and remove it, first find out its path and appearance through the senses, then take what is on top of it and what is below it with pressure and constriction, and then dry it off and pull it out.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is embedded in the flesh and you cannot grasp it, then apply a cautery with fire to the spot where it resides, for its greatest danger is corruption of that area, as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	And if it has reached the head near the brain, then press over the eyebrow with strong pressure and dry out that area, and remove it; and the patient should use medicines to cleanse their body of putrid, harmful humors, and avoid foods that cause putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	On the section regarding the disease known as "nafir"
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is called "nafir" in our land, and it is a pain that comes on suddenly in certain members of the body, and then changes from member to member.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And now I will tell you about it as I have promised you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to see a woman who was ill in a village, and when I examined her arm, I saw a small inflammation on the vein of the arm. And after about an hour, I saw that inflammation move just as if it were a living worm crawling along, but more softly than it should have been, like molten silver flowing from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	Then the pain went away from that spot and appeared in the muscle nearby, and then it remained there for about an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then it moved to the other side of the body and reached the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And she told me that it was moving throughout her body, as I had seen. And she was greatly amazed by its changes and the speed with which it moved from member to member.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had already seen something like this in my own hands before, but I have not seen many people who can grasp the pain as it moves from member to member.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But I did not see it so clearly with my hands as in this woman's case.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I do not think it was anything but this because the woman was old, with dry skin and visible veins, and in this appearance to the senses there was that movable windiness.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that this does not appear according to its course in those who are delicate and have moist bodies with concealed veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And when you wish to treat it and the patient feels that pain, then do not grasp it with your hand as we have said, but press on it lightly and dry out that area where that blocked windiness has come out, and apply a cautery to that spot.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you cannot grasp it with your hands, then treat it by purging the body and using medicines that expel windiness. And apply plasters made from foul-smelling herbs and those containing serpentaria and similar substances.
De extraccio de sagetas.	On the extraction of arrows
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are various in their species and also vary according to the parts of the body where they strike. For there is great diversity among them: some have large points, others small ones, concave or blunt points; some are solid. Some have three angles, others have tongues, while still others are star-shaped.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And those that strike the limbs and other parts of the body are of two kinds: those that strike principal limbs or organs, such as the brain, heart, liver, lungs, kidneys, intestines, bladder, and similar ones. And when one of these members is struck by an arrow and signs of death appear, which I will tell you about shortly, then it is necessary to avoid extracting that arrow in cases where death is imminent due to the patient's constitution. But if those signs do not appear and the arrow is not deeply embedded in the member, then extract it and treat the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And the signs of an arrow striking the brain are: when it pierces the bone and comes out through the fontanelle, which is on top of the brain. This happens due to sudden violence, leading to blindness (scotomia), dizziness (vertigo), redness in the hands, inflammation and redness of the tongue, spasms and confusion of understanding, vomiting bile, and severe difficulty speaking or loss of voice. And there is an exit point for white, powdery fluid like milk from the wound site, and it resembles the moisture of flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And therefore, if these signs appear, then refrain from treating or attempting to extract the arrow, unless it is external.
