Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	But the signs of an arrow striking the heart are: it is near the left nipple, and there is pain where it has been driven into hard flesh, not soft. The movement of the arrow feels like a pulse, and black blood flows from the wound. There is sudden coldness in the extremities, followed by sweating and fainting; therefore, know that death will come suddenly without delay.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when an arrow has struck the lung are: frothy sputum of blood coming from the wound, and the vessels near the collarbone become congested. The patient's complexion changes, and they exhale with great force or pant for breath, demanding cool air to breathe.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if the arrow strikes the pleura (the lining of the chest), then pain will be felt near the lower ribs. There is great difficulty in breathing with violent pain and sighing, and all the members are affected by muscle weakness.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	"And if the arrow strikes the stomach, then swiftly remove from it any undigested food."
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	"And if the arrow enters the belly and remains stuck there, then some rent of the skin, or the flesh, or bowel may be torn; and there is little hope for recovery through the extraction of the arrow."
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	"And if the arrow strikes the bladder and urine is passed outside, and there is pain in the external parts, then you know that it is fatal."
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	"But other members such as the face, neck, throat, shoulders, arms, spine, collarbone, hip, knee and their corresponding limbs are saved according to the best practices when the arrow does not strike a vein or an artery and is not poisonous."
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	"And I will tell you what I have seen about these arrows, so that you may know how to treat them."
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	"It happened that an arrow entered the tear duct of a man's eye and I extracted it from the other side through his nostril, leaving behind the feather of the arrow in his ear, and he was healed without any harm to his eye."
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	"And I extracted another arrow from a Jew which had entered his eye through the upper eyelid, leaving behind the eyelid and extracting only a small part of it with which it adhered to its shaft, and it was a large pointed arrow of the Turks with a lion's head on it without feathers."
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	"And the Jew was healed and suffered no harm to his eye."
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	"And I extracted another arrow from a Christian man which had entered his throat, and it was an Arabic arrow with feathers on it. And then I incised over that between two guides and it was already submerged in the man's throat. And then I carefully extracted it and the Christian was healed."
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	"And I extracted another arrow from a man which had entered his belly and I thought that he would die because of it. And since thirty days had passed and there was no change in him due to its condition, I incised over the arrow and extracted it, and he was healed without suffering any great harm."
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	"And I saw a man in whom an arrow had entered his back and the wound had healed over it. And because it was about seventy years old, I extracted the arrow through the opening of the wound."
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	"And I saw a woman in whom an arrow had entered her belly and the wound had healed over inside her without any change in her condition. And the woman suffered no harm to any of her natural functions."
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	"And I saw another man in whom an arrow had entered his face and the wound was healed over it. And he broke off the arrow without suffering much pain, and appeared to be very brave."
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	"And I extracted the arrow from the nose of one of the king's princes which had entered into the middle of his nose and had already inclined slightly to the right. And the whole arrow was hidden."
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	"And I was called for his cure about three days after the arrow had entered him."
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	"And then I opened the wound of the arrow very tightly. And then I carefully probed it with my finger and did not feel anything; but he felt a pricking from behind the right ear. And then I suspected that this prick was due to the tip of the arrow."
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	"And I widened the opening with an ointment in which there is attractive and digestive virtue. By doing this, I knew that the place would be opened so that it would appear to me the place of the arrow and I could cut on it."
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	"And there was no significant injury where the arrow had reached that place. And I continued to apply the ointment on it for many days without causing any harm, and meanwhile the wound healed up and the swelling from the extraction of it went down over many days until one day he felt the arrow inside his nose and recognized this before me."
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	"And then I applied a corrosive medicine to the wound for many days until it opened up. And with my finger I felt that and extracted the tip of the arrow subtly, which adhered to the shaft."
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	"And precisely I applied that corrosive medicine to the opening of the wound until I saw the tip of the arrow visible. And it took me about four months' time with this."
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	"And precisely when the wound was enlarged and I could insert the forceps into it, but it remained stuck and did not come out easily, then I continued subtly to pull and manipulate on it with various methods of extraction until one day I began to pull it out with forceps made for this purpose, according to what is described at the end of the chapter. And precisely I restored that wound."
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	"And some physicians judge that the cartilage of the nose cannot be restored. But I restored it and the wound healed up completely, and the illness was healed entirely without any remaining cause."
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	"And I recount to you the details of extracting some arrows because you should pause and consider this rule and meaning about what I have not said, since the parts of this art and its definitions are not understood by narration alone, nor is that book comprehended."
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	"And the skilled artisan says little about many things; and about what is present, he compares it to what is absent. And he achieves new operations and new instruments depending on the removal of foreign causes of the art when they occur."
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	"And therefore I say that arrows are not expelled from the limbs into which they have entered except by two ways: either by attraction of the place where it has gone in, or by the opposite direction of its path."
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	"And that which is expelled by the place through which it entered, or is an arrow proceeding in a fleshy location, and is attracted and expelled."
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	"And if it does not come out at the time when it was shot, then you should let it be for some days until the flesh around it becomes softened, and its attraction and exit may be facilitated."
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	"Similarly, if it is stuck in bone and does not come out easily, then let it be for some days and repeat the attraction and movement each day until it is finally expelled."
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	"If it still does not come out even after some days, then you should bore into the bone around the arrow with a subtle awl so that the place may be enlarged by the arrow and thus you can extract it."
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	"If the arrow is stuck in one of the bones of the head and has already proceeded into one of the ventricles of the brain and some of those accidents appear which I have mentioned above, then abstain from extracting the arrow and let it be until his state is equalized for some days; because if the arrow reaches the cerebellum, death will not be prolonged."
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	"If the arrow is stuck only in the flesh of the bone and does not pass into the brain cavity, and the illness remains for some days without any cause from those accidents, then you should endeavor to attract the arrow and attract it."
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	"But if it is deeply embedded and does not come out easily, then you should administer awls around the arrow as we have recommended, and thus cure the place until it is healed."
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	"But if the arrow is already hidden in the location of the heart and is hidden from sensation, then you should seek it with a probe, and if you find it, then attract it with some instruments which are suitable for its attraction."
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	"If the patient's wound is too narrow and deep to operate on directly, and there are no bones or major blood vessels or nerves in the way, then open up the wound further until it is wide enough for the arrow to be safely removed."
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	"If one of the patient's ears is injured and needs to be removed, then carefully cut through all the flesh in which it is embedded using all the skill you can muster. Use all your ingenuity if you cannot remove the ear due to its fracture or torsion."
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	"When extracting the arrowhead from any location, use gentle twisting with your hand and forceps in all parts until you can grasp it. Use extreme care to ensure that the arrowhead is not broken and is easily extracted."
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	"If you cannot extract the arrowhead at that time, then leave it in place for a few days until the surrounding tissues have had a chance to heal. Then try again when the patient is feeling better."
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	"If bleeding becomes profuse during surgery, then follow the procedures for treatment of hemorrhage as described in the chapter on wounds and injuries."
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	"And be careful when incising veins, nerves, or tendons. Use all your skill and care to extract the arrow smoothly and calmly, without hurry or hesitation, as I have instructed you."
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	"And once the arrowhead has been extracted, contract it to its original shape according to the figure indicated on the casing of the arrow. This is more helpful."
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	"But if this is not possible, then do whatever you can based on the figures available."
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	"But when removing arrows that have been shot from behind, or when there is no wound channel present, or if the arrow has pierced through to the exterior of the body, feel along the path of the wound above the rib cage until you find the emerging point. Then grasp it with forceps according to its size and pull it out gently."
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	"But if the arrow is stuck in bone, then twist it gently in the opposite direction until you feel the arrowhead give way. Then push it further in and extract it."
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	"And if this does not work, leave the arrow in place for a few days to allow the surrounding tissues to heal, then try again when they have recovered."
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	"And if the shaft of the arrow is still inside, then push it further in with it."
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	"But if the shaft has broken off and you wish to apply traction, then insert a probe into the wound cavity and find the tip of the arrowhead. Then place it in the concave end of the probe and gently pull it out with the probe."
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	"But if the arrowhead is barbed or has a broad head, then forcefully insert an instrument into the wound cavity to push it back in, for such arrows are easier to extract this way."
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	"And if the arrow is poisoned, then it is necessary to excise all the flesh around the wound, if possible, and then treat the wound as appropriate."
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	"And if the arrow has struck bone, or entered the abdomen, bladder, or chest cavity and is close to vital organs so that you can touch it with your hand, then carefully grasp the arrowhead with forceps without injuring veins or nerves, extract it gently, and suture the wound if necessary. Then treat the wound until it heals."
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	"Method of extracting arrows using forceps:"
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	"Limbs like bird beaks seize arrows in such a way as not to let them go."
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	"Their grasp varies greatly: some arrows are seized firmly, others loosely, depending on the size of the arrowhead and its narrowness, as well as the width of the bowstring and the tension on it."
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	"Shape this concave end like a bird's feather to ease the insertion of the arrowhead and strengthen its force."
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Translate the sentence into English.
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	As rays pass through it, may it alleviate the pain within him in the hollow of his side.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	Of phlebotomy of the veins
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins of phlebotomy which are most commonly opened are 30, among which there are those in the head numbered XVI, namely two pulsating veins near the ears called "temporal"; two veins located in the temples appearing like herbs; and two veins located at the corners of the eyes called "canthi". There is also a vein prepared in the middle place of the forehead, and one which is at the end of the nose. Then there are two on the neck, and two veins on the upper lip, and two veins on the lower lip; and these are those called "angle" [veins]; and finally two veins behind the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	In the arms, five veins are commonly opened for phlebotomy: among these there is one cephalic vein which runs along the wild side of the arm; the people call it "the vein of the head". There is also a median vein called "sorda" composed of a branch of the basilica and another branch of the cephalic. The basilica is a vein placed on the inner side of the arm, called "cubitalis", which the common folk call "the vein of the belly". The funis of the arm rests upon the elbow joint and this is the vein commonly opened for phlebotomy. It appears above the pulse in a manifest way. The salvation vein is that which lies between the aforementioned auricular and the little finger; it has two branches.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	In the foot and leg there are three veins: one of these lies on the outer side of the ankle joint on the wild side of the leg, another is the saphenous vein located behind the knee joint on the inner side of the leg. The third is the sciatic vein located behind the knee joint on the outer side of the leg. There are also other veins in the leg which resemble these.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The benefit of opening the veins near the ears is for treating ancient head colds, headaches, migraines and ulcers of the head from ancient times.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And the quality of letting blood from those veins is as follows: it should be done after removing the hair from the sick person's head. The head should be anointed with oil in the occipital region where both veins are located, using a wide cloth and good friction. Then tie the sick person's shirt tightly around their neck with a bandage so that both openings appear near the ears on two slightly elevated points of the head. Take hold of those with your index finger and if you feel the pulse there with your own finger, then proceed with caution.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Approach thou taketh the lancet scalpel, which is sharp-pointed, and thou insert it beneath the vein in the elbow until the phlebotomy comes to the bone.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	Then lift up thy hand with the vein and the elbow above and cut through the vein with an incising incision.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And let the length of the incision be the size of two fingers or thereabouts, and cause as much blood to flow out as thou wishest.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then apply powder and bandage it so that it may heal.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	As was stated at the beginning of this book, some wounds are incised and cauterized.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	Most of the two veins called arterial are to the temple, the help of phlebotomy is in ancient migraine and evil humors and frequent ophthalmia and sharp pains from excess fluid accumulated in the chest.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	And the quality of phlebotomizing them is according to what I recommend to you: constrain the illness with a vein in such a way that both veins appear clearly under the skin and show their pulse, and then proceed gently.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	Then lift up the elbow above the vein at its beginning with your little finger, insert the phlebotomy lancet into it, and raise up the vein thus; and incise it just as you did in the other two veins, and cause blood to flow according to your necessity.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then release the constriction of the illness, and place your finger over the vein for an hour, then place cotton and powder and strengthen it above with a tight bandage, and leave it alone until it is healed.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	As was mentioned before in the beginning of this book, the memory of these veins, their incisions, and their attraction.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	And thus the help of phlebotomy of the frontal vein is especially useful for the cephalic veins in ancient illnesses of the face and migraine and rigor and fetid ulcers.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the quality of phlebotomy of it is according to what I recommend to you: thus, the illness should be strengthened with a bandage so that the vein appears; and then take the instrument called "fossor", the form of which is this:
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	Place your finger on the prominent point that is at the head of the vein and strike it with a pestle or another tool in the manner you desire, allowing blood to flow according to the quantity you wish; then immediately relieve the patient's perforation and strengthen that area so it may heal.
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	And sometimes it is opened with a flebotomy knife, however it is not necessary that the flebotomy knife have an acute tip like other flebotomy knives, as long as its side edge is sharp; and thus open it crosswise, for the bone is close by and might break the flebotomy knife if it is thin.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	But the benefit of these two veins that are near the lacrimal canals of both eyes is for the itching of the eyes due to heat and sebaceous matter in the eyes, and for illnesses of the face.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	And the quality of bloodletting is that after the patient has strengthened their neck with a bandage, then perform the bloodletting, and you should be standing on the head of the patient.
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	And perform the bloodletting crosswise along the length of a little bit with a blunt flebotomy knife, for there is not much flesh in that location; and if the flebotomy knife is thin, its tip will break easily.
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then make the blood flow as much as you need, and pause on that spot, and strengthen it for one night with a bandage, and then remove the bandage.
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	But bloodletting from the vein of the nose is beneficial for acute fever and sudden sneezing, and for illnesses of the face and migraine and heat that occur in the face, especially when it is chronic.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	And the quality of bloodletting from there is that the patient strengthens their neck and then places their nose in your left hand, and take a thin flebotomy knife that is long and place it in the middle of the head of the nose straightly, for the vein does not appear to the touch here, and because the blood begins to flow soon.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	Be careful to gradually withdraw your hand with the flebotomy knife and make the blood flow according to your necessity; and then bind it for one night, for that wound heals easily.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	But the benefit of bloodletting from both carotids is for the cure of dropsy and the beginning of leprosy, and for many illnesses and impotence and malignant ulcerations that are like herpes zoster.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	And the quality of bloodletting from there is that each patient strengthen themselves on their neck with a bandage; and the operator stands over the head of the patient, and the patient sits on a seat.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	And then bloodlet the vein along its length with an ample flebotomy knife little by little; and then remove blood according to a moderate quantity or according to what you estimate is necessary; and then do the same for the other vein.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	And then remove the bandage and strengthen both veins with a middle ligature so that the patient is not fainted, and leave them like that until morning for the wound to be healed.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And the benefit of bloodletting from the veins of the arms is for small abscesses and pustules of the mouth and corruption of the gums and malignant ulcerations and fissures, and for malignant ulcerations that are in the nose and around it.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	And the quality of bloodletting from there is that you make the patient sit in front of you, and strengthen their neck with a bandage, and then turn their lips and observe both veins of which one is on the right lip and the second on the left; and the demonstration of each is by its darkness, and more so because in the circuit of those there are small dark veins; and then cut each with an incisive incision.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	But if there is doubt about which one it is, and you do not know which one it is, then you can make an incision in the largest of those, and from the manifest pus of those.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And do the same for both veins that are in the upper lips.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	But it is more customary to cut both veins that are on the left lip.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	"Of the two veins that are left of the tongue, it is appropriate for phlebotomy to be performed on the cephalic vein at the forehead, and on the malady of the uvula, and maladies of the mouth."
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	"And the quality of phlebotomy to be performed is that which follows the malady between their hands in front of the sun, raises the tongue of them, and watches left of the tongue, one side of the vein and the other side of the vein, and the color of each declines towards blackness."
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	"And then phlebotomize each one; but be careful not to end your hand in phlebotomy of those who have arteries left."
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And the veins that are phlebotomized in the elbow are those in which blood usually flows in all men, and the phlebotomy of them is done according to two methods: either they put with the flebotomy lancet mirtle or olive oil of subtle inclination; or they cut with flebotomy knife, and call if necessary, and this is the form of it:"
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	"And this alnessil (tourniquet) is that which is appropriate for section, and of those are special sides and subtle according to the width of the veins and according to the narrowness of those."
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	"Form of phlebotomy lancet with mirtle:"
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	"Let the side of it be like this: when veins are full and convex, it is appropriate to open them with an apparent large incision, and those that contain thick and turbid blood."
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	"And this is the form of phlebotomy olive:"
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	"And this flebotomy is of lesser width and more subtle point, and it is appropriate for phlebotomy of thin veins that contain subtle citrine blood."
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	"But the benefit of phlebotomy of the basilic vein which is one of three veins, is that it extracts blood from illnesses that are on the left side and neck, and from those that affect the feet and belly."
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	"And it is appropriate for the phlebotomist, when performing phlebotomy on that one, to guard well that one and be cautious about it, because there is an artery left of it; if he errs in adjusting the puncture of the flebotomy needle, he will cut into that artery and cause blood flow; therefore it is not appropriate to phlebotomize that with a puncturing flebotomy lancet, but rather cutting without tourniquet."
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	"And if the basilic vein does not appear by manifest appearance, then you should leave that one and move to another, or seek some of its branches; or you can phlebotomize in place of it at the end of the arm where it is manifest; and cut it with flebotomy tourniquet as we have said."
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	"But if you want phlebotomy of the median vein, then before the narrowness of the arm where you touch the place within that you know the pulse's place, and press firmly with your thumb on it; and raise the arm and cut the vein with concave incision with flebotomy tourniquet as we have said; and guard against hitting the artery by some space in the place."
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	"And when you compress with strength the limb, if swelling occurs in the place that you have pressed with your thumb, then that swelling is swelling of the artery, therefore avoid it."
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	"And if blood flows in the phlebotomy like urine of a child, and the blood is thin red, then you know that it is blood from the artery; then you stop and pause your finger on that for some distance; and then remove your finger, and if the blood stops, because many times it stops, then you compress the arm and leave that one."
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	"And guard against the wound of the incision, and be careful with it and do not move it for some days until it is healed."
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	"But if the blood does not stop flowing, and you see that there is no remedy for it, then you have cut into the artery; because the point of it is contracted, and the blood has stopped; therefore take some lint and fill that one, and press a linen bandage over the place of the vein with narrowing descent with limb and powders within another day."
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	"And then if the blood stops flowing, good. And if not, then cure it with that which has been mentioned before for stopping flow of blood."
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	"And the cessation of blood flow from it is difficult in many dispositions because of the smallness of the vein and the possibility of movement of the arm."
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	"But regarding the black vein, phlebotomy is beneficial for removing blood from the upper part of the head and from the left side of the body; because it is composed of branches of the basilic and branches of the cephalic, as we have said."
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	"And the phlebotomist should be careful in phlebotomy of that one because left of it is a nerve; therefore if he errs in adjusting the puncture of the flebotomy needle and touches the nerve, numbness will occur, and healing will be difficult, and sometimes it is not healed completely. And this nerve often appears at the sensation; and if it is hidden from some people and is thin and does not show up, then you should pause the flebotomy needle with which you phlebotomize with tourniquet incision, and avoid the nerve with your strength."
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	"And if the vein is between two nerves, then cut the vein along its length."
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	"Bleeding from the temple vein offers relief by drawing blood from the head, thereby alleviating headaches."
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	"Do you wish the phlebotomy to be performed with an olive-shaped lancet or a myrtle-shaped lancet? For it is safer than all other veins, as neither artery nor nerve is left behind."
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	"But you must ensure that the phlebotomy does not merely puncture the lizard's head and that you seek out the most suitable location. Do not strike it too hard if it is not immediately affected by the initial percussion, as some attempts may be necessary for a successful phlebotomy."
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	"But even if a boil forms in some people after the first attempt at phlebotomy, do not strike it again."
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	"However, the quality of that phlebotomy and its complications are matters that require your consideration for their correction."
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	"The first [consideration] is that you should know that phlebotomy should only be administered for the conservation of health and with hope and caution of avoiding illnesses, and that it should be performed on one of the veins in the elbow area, such as the cephalic, basilic, or median cubital vein; and that it should be performed at the beginning of spring, after fasting during spring and autumn, and around mealtime during winter, when signs ofpletion appear."
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	"And phlebotomy should be performed either on the third day or at least one hour after breakfast."
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	"However, phlebotomy should be performed whenever it is deemed convenient and necessary, whether during the night or day, at any hour and at any time."
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	"And children should not be phlebotomized until they are at least 14 years old; pregnant women should only be phlebotomized from the fourth to the seventh month; and elderly people who have already surpassed their sixtieth year of life should not be phlebotomized."
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	"And when someone wishes to be phlebotomized for any reason whatsoever, they should cleanse their bowels beforehand with a lion's-claw purgative; if there is much retained fecal matter in them, so that the veins do not draw the superfluities during the phlebotomy of the purified intestines, which would harm the principal members."
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	"And patients with sacred sickness and drunkenness should not be phlebotomized until they have recovered from their illness or sobriety. And phlebotomy should be avoided near colic pain, vomiting, and stomachache; and during multiplication of coitus, work, and exercise after fasting or vigils, or any cause that weakens the body or soul."
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	"And it is important to consider the subtleties of humors beforehand if the blood is thick; with foods and drinks, and with medicines if that is possible."
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	"And it is appropriate to take a bath beforehand if nothing prohibits it, or rather if one has been exercised for the sake that blood may be subtilized."
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	"And pause the phlebotomy before noon, especially around the hour of Terce, as we have said."
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	"And continue only if that part is protected from all animal accidents such as distress, anger, fear, and from all corporal accidents such as work, excessive exertion, coitus, and similar things."
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	"And at his seat, let there be present the causes used in the usual practice of men with aromatics and fragrances and balms and similar things according to their quantity."
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	"And let the phlebotomist sit on a cushion that is higher than the cushion of the person who is to be phlebotomized."
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	"And let him first extract his arm and rub that with his hand the phlebotomist two or three times; then let him strengthen the limb with a bandage and wrap it twice."
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	"And let the bandage be tied moderately, for if it is not equitable or if it is with superfluity, then it hinders the flow of blood; or if it is too loose, it hinders the course of blood entirely."
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	"And after tying off the bandage, let the person to be phlebotomized rub his hands together until the veins are engorged and clearly felt."
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	"And let the phlebotomist anoint his lancet with a little old oil specifically; then pause his left index finger on that vein where he wishes to perform the phlebotomy so that the vein may swell slightly and he may feel which vein he should pierce for blood flows from veins like strings under the skin, and it is also important to avoid those veins that are full of windiness because when one presses the lancet upon them they contract beneath the lancet."
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	"Therefore, let the phlebotomist be firm and attentive to all these causes."
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	"And then pause the lancet if the vein is filled in one stroke, that is good. But if not, repeat this another time nearby there or on it with haste if the location is not inflamed."
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	"And if the location is inflamed or the illness worsens, then let it be left alone for a day or two and do not tighten the bandage, because that would draw out an ulcer. Nor should one take a bath."
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	"And repeat the phlebotomy if necessary."
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	"And if the incision is small and blood flows subtly, and you fear that not enough blood will flow out, then repeat the lancet in that same furrow according to correctness and adjust the aperture slightly, but do this quickly before the location becomes inflamed because many people become inflamed with a small opening."
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	"But if the location is already inflamed, then do not repeat upon it because that will serve no purpose. Rather, pause on some part of the oil furrow for that alleviates the course of blood."
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	"And it is better in this location to use oil than any other oils."
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	"Similarly, administer an oil furrow in all phlebotomies where veins are pierced with the prohibition of blood flow, and they do this with Tyriaca Alfadoc and Sagzenea when pausing on one of those over the location because blood is subtilized and revolved when it is thick."
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	"And if a large ulcer is generated in the location of phlebotomy because many times this happens, especially to those who have not been bled for that day or whose vein opening was small, then coitus and pause upon the location with a sponge infused in water and salt slightly scalded, and tighten it there for an hour because it will be dissolved."
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	"And this should be done immediately after the letting of blood from that vein with the completion of it or another vein."
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	"If there remains in the location for some days a blackness or greenness, do not heed this. But if you wish, pause upon it with some cause of Aloes and Myrrh dissolved, or some cause of mint juice or chamomile or similar things."
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	"Many times ulcers and elevations occur because of phlebotomy at the basilica."
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	"Therefore pause your hand upon that [the ulcer], and if you should press too much with your compression, then that elevation is harmful and bad. And therefore guard yourself to pause upon it with some cause of what we have said because much blood flows from the artery."
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"The affected area should be made rigid using a plaster containing an astringent substance to toughen it. Then treat this with another remedy until healing is achieved."
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	"Remove blood from every person according to their strength and the prevailing color above their blood, as it appears."
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	"If the blood is black, let it flow until it becomes red. Similarly, if it appears thick, allow it to flow until it becomes thin. Likewise, if it is sharp, wait until its sharpness is relieved."
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.	"For those who are full and strong, and require bloodletting at one sitting, the vein should be opened widely, and the incision should be long."
E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	"In the case of the lean person, do the opposite. Bloodletting should be done in several sessions and the opening should be narrow."
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	"The best way to perform bloodletting from a vein is through a transverse cut, not a puncture."
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	"This method of bloodletting is safer from bleeding and injury to nerves. It is more praiseworthy and safer than bloodletting done according to length and width."
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	"If syncope is likely to occur during bloodletting, you should prepare the patient beforehand with a little bread soaked in wormwood wine or simple oxymel. Remove blood at that location in three or four sessions."
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	"If the patient is cold in temperament, then before bloodletting, give them bread soaked in myrrh syrup or aromatic honey syrup spiced with pepper, cinnamon, ginger, and similar spices, or highly fragrant syrup."
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	"If syncope occurs during bloodletting due to the loss of too much blood, then you should give them water made from meat and fragrant honey syrup to drink. Use aromatics such as aloe and apply it topically around the area."
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	"And use the other causes that have been mentioned in the division under the chapter of syncope from evacuation."
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	"For those who wish to raise their arm and dissolve the blood on the second day, bloodletting should be done for excessive evacuation. The strength of the bleeding will be weak, gradually evacuating the blood according to the quantity of the strength over several days."
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	"However, for those who wish to raise their arm and draw blood again on the second day, and have a strong constitution, they should do so approximately 7 to 9 hours after the first bloodletting."
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	"But those who wish to draw blood from their body in opposition to the direction of the part that declines, it should be done on the second or third day."
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	"But for those bodies in which there is already scanty blood and it is sharp and causes fever, blood should be drawn from them once, drawing out a large quantity. Attention should be paid so that syncope occurs, as you will have conserved all the conditions of bloodletting. Place your hand on the pulse of their body to prevent death occurring instead of syncope, for many times this happens due to ignorance and negligence."
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	"And when you wish to release the arm and evacuate blood again on the second day, even if the vein opening has closed and it is difficult to draw out blood, do not press upon it with violence. Rather, press gently with the hand slightly curved, as this is too harmful."
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	"Let the bloodletting be done a second time until it flows freely. Or remove the acuteness of the bloodletting that has coagulated in the vein opening with a gentle pressure using tragacanth gum or saguenaria. Pause upon it and press gently until the blood flows out."
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	"And if the vein is inflamed, then leave it alone and do not touch it until the inflammation has subsided."
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	"And if there is a necessity to provoke evacuating blood again and it is not an excuse, then perform bloodletting on that location or on the other arm in another vein."
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	"And the vein called 'funis of the arm' is bled in place of the cephalic or basilica veins when they are not prominent or are hidden. For it consists of those."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	"And the quality of bloodletting from it is that the patient places their hand in cold water until the vein becomes red and appears clearly."
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	"And bloodletting should be done gently with a ligature made from woolen thread with moderate tightness. And bloodletting should be performed transversely in small sections, not latitudinally nor lengthwise."
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	"And let the opening be wide and let your bloodletting with which you bleed that person be done just above the junction of the hand."
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	"And if the flow of blood is prohibited, then immerse your hand in cold water again and let the blood run into the water until your need is satisfied."
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	"But if it is summertime, then you are excused from immersing your hand in cold water. And the mesh is paused for bloodletting in cold water during wintertime."
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	"And bloodletting from this vein is safer than all other veins because it has neither a palpable vein nor nerves."
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	"And bloodletting of the little vein on the right hand is beneficial for diseases of the liver."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	"And the quality of bloodletting from it is that you should tighten the hand with a ligature or your hand, having placed it in cold water until the vein becomes inflated and clearly visible. Perform bloodletting transversely on it; and if some of it remains, do not worry about it."
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	"And take care not to finish your hand during bloodletting, because there are nerves in these veins that are bare of flesh."
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	"And again immerse the hand in cold water and let the blood run into it, because if you do not immerse it in cold water, the blood will coagulate in the vein opening and the flow will be prohibited."
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	"And when blood is drawn according to the necessary quantity, then press upon the vein with oil and salt so that it does not close suddenly. And do likewise for any other wound."
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	"But the benefit of bloodletting from this vein on the left hand is that it is beneficial for diseases of the spleen."
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	"And do likewise in bloodletting this one as you did the other."
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	"And the benefit of bloodletting from the vein called 'sephena' is for diseases that are in the parts below the body, such as diseases of the womb, and retention of menses, and diseases of the sinews, ulcers of the skin and old sores, and their like."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	"And the quality of bloodletting from it is that the patient should place their foot in cold water and make friction over it until the veins become clearly visible. Then tie a ligature around the junction of the foot; the location of the vein appears just below the said knee, and it branches out into many small branches on the face of the foot."
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	"And then bleed the thickest branch or one of those below the knee towards the ankle joint because it is better and safer."
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	"And if you bleed this vein on the face of the foot, then beware of the nerves that are near it on the face of the foot, and pause your bloodletting with that which you use for bleeding across, as if you wished to cut it."
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	"And let the bloodletting be moderate."
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	"But if you cannot draw blood, then immerse the foot in cold water again and let the blood run into it until it is evacuated."
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	If the flebotomist errs in the first attempt, then try again with the flebotomy a little higher up, for the vein is swollen; and do not fear the malignant humor, but guard against damaging nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	Similarly do the same to the other leg.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And of the saphenous vein, the location is as we have said, behind the ankle joint below the head of the fibula.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	The benefit of bloodletting for this condition is to relieve pain in the hip when it is used to remove heat.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	The characteristic of bloodletting for this condition is that the patient enters a bath, and quickly and firmly binds the vein on the inner side of the thigh above the ankle joint with a long thin bandage so that it does not become visible except through that.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And then when it appears, immediately flebotomize according to each vein that you are able to and according to the traverse, and it is better; or else incise that with an incision or cut that one with a section, for the location of this one is swollen.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is more common in men and less so in women. And if you find that one, and it does not appear to the touch at all, then immediately flebotomize some branch of this one, and it is that which appears on the back of the hand towards the little finger and the ring finger.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And beware of the nerves, and let flow as much blood as you wish.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	And moreover untie the ligature and press on the place of the bloodletting firmly for a short time, for it heals easily.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Concerning venesection and the qualities to use that one
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Bloodletting is done with a lance, or a needle, or a vein-opener.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And bloodletting is done in two ways: one of them is with scarification and extraction of blood, and the other is bloodletting without scarification.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this bloodletting that is without scarification is done in two ways, for either it is with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.
