And the places on the body where bloodletting is administered with scarification and extraction of blood are fourteen in number, among which one is where bloodlettings are paused: at the nape of the neck, which is the last part of the head; and the middle place of it on both parts of the neck equally; and bloodlettings on the chin, below the jawbone but above the mouth; and bloodlettings on the two spatulas; and bloodlettings on the hollow of the hand, which is at the end of the wrist; and bloodlettings on the two elbows, which are on the two arms; and bloodlettings on the two knees; and bloodlettings on the two ankles.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And bloodletting does not extract blood except from the small veins scattered in the flesh, and for this reason it does not cut off virtue by those means, just as it is done by phlebotomy; nor is it necessary that bloodletting be done with fire or without fire in any illness caused bypletion until the whole body has been evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if bloodletting is provoked by illness or by continuity, we administer it at any hour at the beginning of the month and at the end of it, and in the middle of it and at any time.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause of this is that in men the blood multiplies within them until they need extraction of it by bloodletting and they become heavy and bloated. And there are those who have repletion and heat in their face and head, and neck. And there are those who have pressure in their face and forehead and darkness and dullness in their eyes. And there are those who vomit the place of their bloodletting. And there are those whose laughter is multiplied. And there are those who have a taste of blood in their mouth, or whose tongue is inflamed and spits blood. And there are those whose sleep is multiplied, and those who see blood in dreams, redness and blotches and plagues and other similar causes according to their appearance.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore when there are times in any of those causes, and particularly if it is at the third or mid-month, we command bloodletting to be done after two or three hours have passed since that time.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the benefit of bloodletting from the nape of the neck is that when it alleviates heaviness in the head and prevents collapse on the eyes, but it is necessary that this be an appropriate evacuation of the whole body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this bloodletting is located at the site of phlebotomy of the cephalic vein
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	It is not right to use this [bloodletting] in those who have a feverish condition or catarrh, for it gives great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And therefore it is not necessary to use that bloodletting on the elderly, and on those whose heads have feverish illnesses
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But above that, if it is continued upon it, forgetfulness occurs; and therefore you should command the bloodletter to pause his hand slightly after the bloodletting at the places where forgetfulness is generated.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But bloodletting from the armpit is located at the site of phlebotomy of the dark vein and the basilica vein: and therefore it alleviates asthma, and constriction of the breath, and the division of the windpipe of the lung, and coughing, and repletion.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it is necessary that the armpit bloodletting be done gently, for if it is done forcefully it generates weakness in the body and stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And bloodletting from the temple alleviates accidental pains in the head and ophthalmia, migraine, and pleurodynia, and toothache; and it is located at the site of phlebotomy of the basilica vein
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And you should command the bloodletter not to press his hand during scarification lest he wound the artery and cause bleeding
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And bloodletting below the chin alleviates hoarseness in the mouth and corruption of the gums, and it is similar to those illnesses that are in the mouth; and it stands at the site of phlebotomy of Alephairic, which are on both lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But bloodletting that is done over the two shoulder-blades alleviates headaches, which are caused bypletion of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And bloodletting from the two places below the eyebrows alleviates the benefit of phlebotomy of three veins, that is, the basilica, dark, and cephalic veins, for it attracts blood from all those veins multiplied in the flesh, and those small veins from the other veins more thick until attraction reaches the three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And command the bloodletter not to proceed with scarification, for that place is devoid of flesh, and thus it has nerves and arteries there
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is a bloodletting with which blood is let from the buttocks and alleviates hemorrhoids of the anus and ulcers that are there
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And you should command the bloodletter that it be a large bloodletting, and of iron, for that place requires strong sectioning; and many subtle bloodlettings are drawn out by strong suction, and it should be scarified with scarification
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	But bloodlettings from the calves diminish by diminution evidently for they draw out blood from all the body and alleviate old pains of the kidneys and abdomen, and bladder; and they provoke menstruation and alleviate botch and dimple; and they stand at the site of phlebotomy of two saphenous veins, Alachoben, and two cavillas.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	But they greatly weaken the whole body and cause fainting in many men
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And bloodletting at Alachoben has benefit similar to that of bloodletting from both calves
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	"The position of the windpipe is such that it begins wide and gradually narrows due to suction. Do not prolong this position excessively, but rather pause gently and remain quietly so that the humors can come together evenly."
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	"And do not stop iterating this until you see the spot already reddening and swelling, and notice the appearance of blood's color."
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	"And then you shall slowly scratch and irritate the skin little by little, taking care with the position of the body."
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	"And that man who has tender skin from few hairs, it is necessary that you scratch him once and not twice, for the place not to become ulcerated."
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	"And command the blower to amplify the scarification, and press gently, and keep the suction easy."
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	"And if the blood is thickened, then it is necessary to scratch twice, for in the first time the way of subtleization in the blood and its moisture is opened."
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	"But on the second occasion, with careful scrutiny, the extraction of thick blood should be obtained."
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	"And if the blood is too fetid, then the third scratch should not be done so that it can succeed."
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	"Finally, when we want to extract blood little by little or a little bit, one scratch is enough for us."
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	"And if we want to extract much blood, we scratch with much scarification; and if we know that the blood is thick, then it is necessary to scratch for a strong scarification."
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	"The term 'scarification' refers only to the depth of the cut."
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	"And if the skin of that person is thick, hard, dark, and its pores are narrow, then the places where the cups will be used should be anointed with lenitive, opening, and dissolving substances; if it is in summer, thus as oil of aloe or violet oil, or oil of bitter almonds, or oil of cumin seed; and if it is in winter, then narcissus oil, lily oil, camomile oil, or blood should be used for those similar."
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	"And if the superfluity is thick and fatty, then the oil should be bitter almond, balsamite oil, aloe oil, or aneth oil, and similar ones."
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	"But if the person being cupped has wide pores and tender skin, then it is prohibited to use oil; and for this person, the places where the cups will be applied should be washed with warm or hot water of solatrum, cumin seed water, or pennyroyal water, and similar ones to those."
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	"And for the person whose blood is very moist, wash his cups with sour wine, or myrtle and sumac water, and similar ones."
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	"And for the person whose superfluities are thick, wash his cups with old wine, or water of sansuc (majoram), or decoction of aneth, or chamomile, and similar ones."
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	"And it is necessary that the cupping be done before a bath; having to administer it close to the moment of bathing for one or two hours, and it is necessary that he/she sleeps close to the cupping."
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	"What is this: that it is necessary for the person being cupped to be regulated before cupping."
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	"And it is necessary to consider at the beginning: if the person being cupped or the one who should bleed him/her has a choleric nature and vents over sharp blood and inflammation, then he/she should take causes of cooling, such as sour apple milk, chicory with vinegar and lettuce, and secanolabum, julep, and similar ones."
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	"And pause their foods such as pheasants, birds of prey meat, and sour seasoned foods, and similar ones."
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	"And for the person whose complexion is cold, it is necessary that he/she drink rosehip syrup with honey, or syrup of fennel seed, sumac, and myrrh, and let him/her be advised to use sparingly of drinking and eating, and avoid foods of pheasant, rabbit, partridges, small birds, and pigeons."
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	"And it is necessary that on the day of cupping and bloodletting, drinking should be greater than eating."
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	"And it is necessary to give some men tyriaca altharca or muscatel medicaments, such as musk powder, or alcelet before cupping or bloodletting, so that the principal members are comforted and that the blood be subtilized; but those who have scabies should not take it."
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	"But the cupping that is not done with scarification are those that are done to pause its liver, and on the navel and gout, and on the umbilicus, in the joints of the elbows, and the armpit of the axilla, because these members do not suffer scarification upon them."
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	"And it is not desired for these except the attraction of blood from the member, such as pausing cupping on the breast in disease of flux of bloody blood from the nose; and they use it so that cold hard inviscid cupping may be dissolved from the member, such as pausing on the abdomen and navel; because this rarifies the member and scratches it and removes pain by resolving the cupping."
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	"And already cupping is paused on the temples when there occurs in them oppression or dizziness, because by virtue of strong attraction it draws out oppression and expels dizziness from its place."
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	"And similarly, it does when cupping is paused on the liver and spleen to resolve that which is enclosed therein."
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	"And these cuppings are administered with suction only; but some are also administered with fire."
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	"And sometimes they are administered full of warm water in the diseases of the spleen."
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	"And this is why the cupping should be filled and made larger, that is cold water alone or water in which suitable herbs are cooked."
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	"Form of cupping administered with fire: let the width of the opening be that of two fingers, according to how we have formed it; and let the quantity of the pitch be at most a palmful; and let it be on his side, in the place that is in the circuit, as much as him/her, and let the wick be small according to the quantity that enters into it like a needle."
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	"Let it be made of wormwood or citrus with thick margins, lion's tooth, hawthorn and myrtle, so that the member does not hurt from its position upon it."
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	"And let it be placed in the middle of the transverse line of wormwood or iron where the candle with fire is paused."
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	"And already this cupping should be much larger than that which we have recommended, and the lesser one according to the diseases and state of him/her who uses it."
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	"And the cuppings of children and weak ones are different from those of young people and robust ones."
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	"And the quality of pausing this cupping with fire on the member is that it extends the mecha with fire from decently burned wood before a small candle of wax, and pauses it on the middle of the transverse line in the middle place of the cupping, so that the fire may be kindled around the edge without burning the body of the sick person."
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	"And immediately it should be paused on the member of the sick person, and let the wick that we have said be on top, until when we have the cuppings and do not need to hold the wick, then the vapor will rise over that wick, immediately the cupping will be dissolved."
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	"And soon after, extinguish the wick according to its manner, and repeat it if necessary."
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	"But in cupping that is administered in the disease of pleurisy with water, there is neither transverse line nor wick, and it is not administered except that it should be filled with water, and it is paused on the member alone."
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	"And this is its form: And this cupping, the larger it is, the better, for it can receive a large quantity of water."
Capitol .xcvii.	"Chapter 97."
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	"Bloodletting is not performed on certain members except in cases where the use of cupping glasses is impossible due to their small size, such as the lips, gum and similar areas; or on members that are devoid of flesh, such as the fingers and nose, and their like."
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	"And the quality of using those bloodsuckers that are found in clean waters from ponds."
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	"And they should be let loose during the day and night in clean water until they are hungry, ensuring that there is no cause for vomiting in their stomachs. And first, the body should be emptied with phlebotomy and cupping glasses. And the limb of the patient should be rubbed until it turns red. And then they should be placed on it."
E cum son umplidas e caso.	"And when they are full, they should be removed."
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	"If it is possible to suck out the location with cupping glasses, this is preferable in treatment."
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	"And if not, then wash the location with vinegar and hot water. And rub it and press on it."
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	"If the body's blood flow is prolonged near the skin's blood vessels, and this is prominent, then you should immerse a cloth in hot water and apply it on top to cover the prominence."
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	"If blood is abundant, then sprinkle on it vitriol trisulcated, or powders and substances similar to those of the stiptics, until the blood has ceased. Or place on the spot many pods of cooked broad beans, and leave them there until they adhere to the spot and the blood has ceased."
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	"If necessary, repeat the application of leeches when it is possible to change those that have been used."
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	"If bloodletting by leeches is prohibited due to suspension, then the spot should be rubbed with fresh blood or a needle inserted into the spots until blood flows; and these should be applied immediately when any blood is felt."
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	"When you want them to fall off, sprinkle on them a little powdered aloe, salt, or ash, and they will soon fall off."
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	"This is how the chapter of the third part begins: On restoration."
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	"This chapter is often necessary in the art of medicine, and concerns the restoration of fractures and accidents of dislocation in bones."
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	"Oh, son, know that those who boast of this chapter are foolish doctors and the common people, and those who have never regarded the books of the Ancients nor read a single letter from them."
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	"And because of this reason it happens that this method is private among the learned in our land; and I have not forgotten this during all my life; nor have I added what follows except for the length of reading the books of the Ancients and study over their understanding, so as to extract science from them."
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	"And therefore I direct this to experiment and study throughout my life's duration."
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	"And I have already described in this chapter all that my science contains and about which my experiment has passed; since here I have briefly for you others and relieved myself of the occupation of lengthening it; and abbreviated it to the point of abbreviation; and shown it to the point of declaration; and formed many forms of instruments administered therein, as is done by addition of declaration, as I have done in two preceding chapters."
Capitol primier.	"Chapter One."
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	"Summaries and collections of the essence of bone fractures, from which a preamble is necessary before we begin to remember the members that are broken and diverse if each one."
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	"It is therefore necessary that I say in the prologue of this chapter the summaries of the discourse, and the chapters under whose understanding the artisans are forced to stay at rest over their truth, so that you and those who are eager may know or learn this noble art besides you."
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	"And therefore I say that when some fracture or dislocation or torsion or concussion happens, it is necessary at the beginning to bleed that one with flebotomy or to alleviate him, or whatever ensemble you may prohibit any cause, as debility of virtue, or if he is a child or old in decrepitude, or if it is time of violent heat or cold."
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	"And therefore it is necessary to content him with his food of fresh herbs and meat of birds and crayfish; and prohibit gross meats and full viandas and all vianda that fills the veins with blood, so that you may be sure of avoiding an abscess, and if you are not afraid of effusion of matter in the member."
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	"And therefore it is necessary to return the patient to his first regimen with which he was accustomed to live."
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	"And therefore when the bone begins to be restored, it is necessary that the patient be nourished with nutrient foods rich and heavy in which there is viscosity, such as foods made of wheat cooked with water, rice, chicken, eggs, beef, butter, fresh fish, thick wine, and similar ones; and with this regimen coagulation of fracture is performed more easily and better."
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	"And know that the bones of those who are in their first vigor and those who are old do not have it possible for them to be joined and consolidated according to their nature due to the dryness of their members."
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	"And they are consolidated and joined according to their nature throughout time due to the dryness of those members, and they are joined and consolidated those that are of them at the end of longevity, as the bones of young children."
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	"But nonetheless nature adjusts and adapts itself to the bone broken in any part whatsoever, as glue that adheres and strengthens it insofar as it is conglutinated and united together, until the end of fortitude and firmness comes, as fire at the beginning, insofar as no cause prohibits it from its works."
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	"And for this reason it is necessary that you suspend the patient's foods, foods in which there is gravity and viscosity and thickness, as we have said."
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	"Great diversity of fracture according to diversity of member."
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	"And know that the species of fractures are diverse according to the diversity of members, for a fracture of the bone of the leg is different from the fracture of the bone of the head; and the fracture of the bone of the foot is different from the fracture of the bone of the hand; and similarly all other members are diverse among themselves."
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	"And I come with a reminder of every species of fracture, explained in its own chapter distinguished from the others."
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	"Great diversity of fracture within itself."
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	"And the species of fractures of the bone are diversified within themselves; for an arched fracture occurs in some other way than stellar ones do; and sometimes it is made according to the length of the bone: these are the fractures of the satagia and stars and additional ones that occur and do not occur, as happens in the pen when it is prepared to write, and a fracture with plugging and disruption in the head, and a small fissure fracture."
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	"And to each species there is a proper pain or torment in its restoration, according to what will come later the reminder of it distinguished in its places."
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	"Great sign of fracture of the bone."
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	"And for this reason a fracture of the bone is known: its tortuosity and prominence and depression at touch, and it also happens when you press it with your hand."
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	"And therefore when there is no apparent tortuosity nor does it happen that any pain is made upon touching the bone with agitation and the patient does not find great pain, then there is no fracture here."
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	"It is possible that there may be tortuosity or a small fissure, therefore you should not move it with your hand and compress everything; rather pause upon it regarding the medicines of which reminder will be made at that moment which is convenient for the place; and especially let there be straightening through subtle restriction."
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	"And know that the place where it is arched and not split into two or other than stellar ones do, since all its parts are removed, then you should begin at your hour to straighten it insofar as an abscess may happen."
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	"And if an abscess occurs there, then leave it for some days until the abscess stops; and then splint it according to each manner that you can of elevation and binding."
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	"And know that restoration of it and binding of it is easier than the bone in which stellar ones occur."
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	"And then strengthen it according to what will come the reminder of it."
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	"But if there are stars in the bone, then it is necessary to extend this broken member in two parts, if it is the hand or foot; or with your hand if the member is small; or with two strings or with one string and your hand."
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	"The position you take to pause the affected limb should be according to its natural shape, while the parts are extended. Then you should endeavor to return those additions with ingenuity and according to each manner that you can in their places."
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	"And be careful, according to your knowledge, not to cause harm to the patient through your operation of their limbs or injury. And endeavor, according to your ability, to apply one bone with another in its best forms."
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	"And it is necessary that at that opportune time you touch him with your hand firmly, and if any different cause arises, correct him and equalize him according to the quantity of your strength."
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	"And avoid violent extension and compression, as many foolish doctors do who often cause an abscess to cauterize by their operation or cause contraction in the limb, as we have seen happen too often."
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	"And apply appropriate bandages, appropriate dressings and proper operation, and strict compression of that limb, and rest and tranquility. Instruct the patient on this and have them avoid moving it during their watch and sleep times, and observe its movements and agitations, and direct all his movements with all his strength; and await until the position of the limb is one in which pain is assured, which is when he feels in the disposition of the position of the affected limb or injury. Then it is necessary to change that to another position where there is no pain. And be careful that the position of this is straight and equal, so that the limb does not become twisted when restored."
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	"And the quality of compression for a limb in repose is that which I recommend, because you should know that broken limbs are diverse in their smallness and greatness, and in their shape."
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	"And for those that are small, like the arm, hand, and foot, and similar ones, it is necessary that the wrapping be of very fine cloth."
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	"But for those that are large, like the thigh or calf, it is necessary to have a wrapping that is thick and strong, because tight wrapping connects the limb well and compresses it equally on all sides, so that nothing enters inside."
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	"And at the beginning, begin your compression of the dressing, pause appropriately according to what is necessary, over the location of that fracture with three wrappings or four, depending on how much the limb deserves it. And tighten your hand a little with the bandage."
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	"And when you have wrapped up to that point beyond the highest part of the fracture location, then tighten more so that your compression is not lessened by what you have used to compress the fracture site."
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	"And then extend yourself with wrapping from the fracture site a little way, and gradually loosen the compression until you reach about half the length of the limb."
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	"And then take another bandage and wrap it again over the broken site with wrapping, and extend yourself with wrappings beyond the fracture location. And your operation should be in tightening the wrapping and loosening it gradually according to what was said earlier about the first wrapping."
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	"And then pause between the wrappings with a layer of wool or cloth with which to equalize any twisting of the fracture, if there is any twisting in it. And otherwise, do not pause for any reason."
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	"And then pause over the other bandage, and then press down upon those wrappings carefully made at that time, if there is no inflammation or cauterized abscess in that location. And otherwise, pause over what covers the abscess or inflammation; and leave it like that for a few days. And then tighten over those wrappings."
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	"And the splints should be made of thin, fine reeds, well-shaped; or they can be made of wood from a fig tree, or branches of palm. And each splint should be about this width and shape:"
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	"However, the splint placed over that fracture should be thicker and wider than the other splints, and its length should be proportional to the size of the limb. And then tighten over those splints with another bandage according to your first compression; and then lay above it with felt carefully, according to what was said about compression, so that your compression is stronger at the fracture site, and as it goes further from the fracture, the compression should be lessened."
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	"And the threads should be medium in thickness and fineness, and made of wool. And if the threads are thick, like those used by some foolish people who use cords of twisted flax for their operations, it is a great error when compression is uneven."
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	"And very fine threads are not suitable, because you will not achieve compression with them as you wish. And there should be less than one finger's breadth between splint and splint."
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	"And if the pain is felt at the ends of the splints near the compression in those places, then pause with wool or carded lamb's wool between them until it stops hurting."
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	"Sometimes a fracture occurs with plague, and disruption of the knee joint happens. I have spoken about this in Chapter 18 on singularities."
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	"And know that not all broken limbs are bound with splints on the first day; because when a limb is large, you should wait for about 5 or 7 days, or more, according to your certainty of the appearance of a cauterized abscess before binding it with splints."
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	"And this is the method used by plasterers to restore fractures, dislocations, and distortions."
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	"The method of plastering commonly used for the restoration of fractures is convenient for many complications, especially for women and children because it does not bring heat or friction. And you should take powder from a millstone; that is, the bran left over after the movement of the millstone against the walls of the mill."
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	"And it is ground like that, but sifted with chalk and water, and used thickly and coarsely."
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	"Another method of plastering for the restoration of fractures, dislocations, and distortions: take assafetida, ladanum, acacia, enula, and miguel, which is the resin of wild mastic, all of them ground and sifted and mixed with aloe or chalk water if the condition is scaly. And use this plaster because it has a good composition and restores lightly broken bones, suitable for many people."
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	"Another method of plastering that suits fractures and distortions: Take miguel resin and white wax, each one dragma x; myrrh and aloe each dragma v; acacia dragma vi; and Armenian bole dragma xx."
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	"All of these are ground together in a mortar with great care, sifted, mixed with water or chalk water, and applied."
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	"Method of plastering for joints and separated bones in their locations, and also useful for pain accidentally occurring in those areas, as well as for cracks and fractures: Take clean wool, immerse it in vinegar and cooked oil, and apply it to the location."
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	"But this plaster does not have the virtue of restoration nor does it prevent or cure cauterized abscesses and does not properly expel pains."
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	"Another method of plastering that restores broken bones: Take leaves from wild fig trees and poppy pods, mix them together and make a plaster out of them."
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Mix in equal parts of ale root, chamomile flowers, and violet flowers. Add ground iris flour until thickened. If the limb is not scratched, boil with wine and apply as a plaster for bone fracture restoration or to resolve remaining abscesses.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	If it is scratched, then soak it in coriander water made wet with water and apply the plaster.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method of plaster that is even stronger in resolving than the first one when an abscess occurs during bone restoration: Take equal parts of ale root and seed, balm, melilot, marjoram, violet flowers, chamomile, and ground iris. All are crushed and cooked with willow water or sweet water or wine, according to the quality of the limb and the rest of its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	However, Hippocrates does not specify in his book that it should be plastered on the broken limb during its restoration, but rather recommends a cerote made of wax and oil, and nothing else. He advises that it should be medium-soft between thickness and subtlety.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	However, it is seen that in Galen's book, plasters are applied on the broken limb during its restoration and the causes of drying with slight heat are such as myrrh, frankincense, and similar ones for those same causes that we have recommended.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Method of plaster that relieves injury and pain: Take equal parts of niter, cypress, human hair cuttings or bird feathers, and ale root. All are ground together and sifted, then cooked to make the plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	However, if the amount according to how much remains of the plaster and it is appropriate to be loosened, it should be considered that if there is no pain or swelling nor has the bone broken, then it should not be removed too soon.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if there is severe pain or swelling or inflammation at the location, then you should remove it immediately in that hour and take off the plaster from it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And then take some linen and a wet sea sponge, immerse it in hot water, and with that wash the area inside until the swelling stops and the pain is relieved. Then let the limb rest for an hour. Then plaster it again with wool submerged in sour wine and oil or rose oil, laying it on top of it for one night to ensure the formation of a dry abscess and that the inflammation of the limb has subsided and its pain has disappeared.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat that gentle strapping with a small plaster again, not tightening too much the first time, and gently until it is healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if at some point the abscess, redness, pain, inflammation, and all other accidents have disappeared completely, then you should again plaster and strap it as you did at the beginning.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if no cause of those that we have mentioned appears on the limb, then you should not remove it before three days or four or five or seven. And sometimes all this is left for twenty days according to what you see through the loosening of the limb, as we have said, until the fracture adheres and joins together with the coagulation of the flesh above it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then adjust the strapping more tightly than the first time, according to how much the swelling of the limb has decreased by remembering it.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you find the location of the fracture already dry and shrunken more than it should be, then know that nutrition is prohibited from reaching it. Therefore, immerse it every day that you remove the plaster with hot water until all is done in three days. Then loosen the strapping a little, and through this operation the limb receives nourishment and heals easily.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But what foolish restorers of the fracture of the limb do again when it was not restored at first, according to how it should have been restored, and is restored crookedly, that is an error according to their operation, and great fear. And if they were right, the Ancients would have enlarged upon this in their books and practiced it.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen any of them do that, which is why it is more reasonable that they should not do it.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter Two: On fracture when it occurs in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	Fracture types are many, and their appearances are diverse, and their causes are distinct. For some fractures are caused by blows that break all the bone within the cavity, leaving the bone like a log, thus this type is called compression; or the blow cuts some part of the bone without cutting deep into the flesh; and this type of fracture is called avulsion.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	The plague of these two fractures is either great or small, and it occurs in compression or tension fractures. The cause of this is a blow accompanied by force or impact on bone, and they appear similar to each other.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	This fracture is either penetrating, nearly reaching the surrounding soft tissue around the bone, or it occurs on the surface of the bone. The severity of these two fractures can be either great or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And there is a fracture that occurs within the bone itself, in its smallest detail resembling a hair's breadth, and thus this type of fracture is called capillary fracture.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	There is also a fracture that occurs from impact or blow by a hard object which causes some of the bone layers to enter into the inner parts, and this happens at the concave location like what happens to eggshells when they are struck and their inner parts break open.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	This usually occurs in the bodies of human bones, especially the heads of long bones such as femurs or tibias.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And therefore all these species of fractures appear like stars separated by lines.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I have brought all this to your attention in its proper place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	Know all these types of fracture by their detection on the surface and by inquiring about them through touch and examination of corrupted flesh around them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	Capillary fractures are recognized by the fact that they appear as small dark lines on the surface of the bone, which can be wiped clean and felt with the fingertips. These lines appear black when examined closely.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	"In treating fractures, consider initially the patient's symptoms. If you find them significant due to manifest fear, such as vomiting from cholera, diarrhea, loss of consciousness, fainting spells, high fever, discharge from the eyes and ears, and similar symptoms in severe conditions, then healing is doubtful."
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	"If you find non-life-threatening symptoms, then proceed with treatment."
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	"If the patient comes to you already injured, especially if it happened during winter days around December 14th, then you should examine the bone before treating according to proper procedure."
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	"If it happens during summer days, then you should examine the bone on the 7th day, ensuring that the surrounding flesh is not corrupted and that symptoms as recommended have occurred."
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	"If the fracture has already reached the muscular tissue covering the brain and is in pieces with attrition, then you should insert the comminuted and attritional fragments as I will instruct you."
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	"And after shaving the head of the patient, uncover the bone according to your custom and ability following the shape of the injury, making it easy for the patient."
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	"If you detect the bone through skin wounds or pus accumulation, then pause your procedure according to what is necessary. If you see fluid oozing from the wound, place cloths soaked in wine and rose oil on it until the inflammation subsides and blood flow ceases. Then begin with the circumcision of the bone and its removal."
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	"And this is according to one of two operative methods."
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And one method is that you insert the bone with a narrow-bladed incision knife, and this is its shape: Then administer another incision knife, slightly wider than the first one, and this is its shape:"
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	"And then use an even wider incision knife."
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	"And you should have different types of incision knives available in various sizes, some wider than others and some shorter than others with sharp tips made of iron or steel."
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	"Use them skillfully to strike the incision without hitting the head or hurting the patient."
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	"If the bone is hard and tough, then you should first drill around it before administering the incision knives with the handles, which are called non-penetrating handles."
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	"However, these are not called non-penetrating handles but rather those which do not penetrate the end of the bone at that point where it is about to be cut. For the handle has a round tip or edge on that side which is left behind with an acute head similar to a small margin or circle, which prevents being submerged and passing through the thickness of the bone."
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	"And it is convenient for you to take many of these handles, each suitable for the thickness of each bone. So that you may have them ready during all surgeries on the brain, with tips that are sharp and their length and width according to the thickness of the bone."
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	"And this is the shape of three types of handles:
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	E approprincipitally cut with scissors what is between each trace of the bone, and collect that subtle pus which you can gather at the end of the incision, as we have said, before you remove the bone, either with your hand or with some other cause through certain instruments which you shall have prepared for this purpose, such as tweezers and forceps.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	E que tu gardas que l'inscissori non tocave null'am causa del ciphac.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	E donc cum auras circuyt lo os perforat, e sera separat del ciphac si es continuat amb ell, e auras aquell extrayt, covent et engualhar aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en lo os amb altra esturment semblante a inscissori, però covent que sia pus teon i pus subtil que las altres incisors.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	E si roman alguna partida dels ossos petitos i satajas, llavors pren aquella amb facilitatz amb aqüell que és deves tu dels esturments; e aprop aquò cures la plaça amb liniments i engueix els quals havem dit.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	E l'altra manera d'operació és més lleugera i llunyana del pau, la qual diu Galien i l'elogia per gran elogista; i aquest és el seu discurs: és necessari que al principi comencis a discoverir la partida de l'os del lloc on hi ha la fractura més visible i evident, entre que quan haves descobert aquella partida i haves posat de banda l'extremitat d'aquest incisi lent i alegre, el qual aquesta és la seva forma:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	E és que la partida lenticular és llarga i no incideix cap causa, i la partida aguda és de l'altura de les dues cares davants en longitud, així com es veuen; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac amb la cara de l'incisió aguda a l'os.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	E després, percuteu sobre l'incisi d'una partida amb un petit martell fins a tallar tot l'os amb facilitat com si girés, i tu estàs segur que el panicul no es podrà produir en aquest accident que temis de cap manera; i si el metge era el més bo de tots els homes i el més ignorant d'ells; certament, i si fos dormit.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	Ara, si hi ha cap causa annexada a l'os del panicul en alguns llocs de l'os, talla aquella amb l'extremitat d'aquest incisi lenticular i allibera-la d'aquell lloc amb facilitat, perquè és alliberada d'aquell lloc sense nociu ni por.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	I si la fractura de l'os no penetra dins el panicul i allò que es abscis o es ostenta de l'os és la seva cara i roman amb aspereza i petites arrugues, llavors cal que arrasin aquesta aspereza i erradiquin aquestes arrugues amb rasuradors subtils dels quals tu has preparat diversos nombres de diferents quantitats perquè sigui possible aplicar-ne els més convenients en tot lloc segons allò on haures d'actuar aquest os trencat i la seva figura.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	I cal que administres en la teva raó quan rasures l'os al principi els més amples dels rasuradors i després els més subtils, i no deixis de fer-ho fins a arribar a aplicar els més aguts i subtils de tots.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	però en cadascuna d'aquelles altres petites fractures capil·lars i fractures subtils, cal que apliques cura segons com tu has trobat per rectificar-ho.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	I és que no s'ameguda sobre tots aquells que han estudiat en aquesta art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	I això és el que hem demostrat en fractures grosses.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	I si el panicul es reté quan tu erradiquis l'os, llavors cal que agafis drap segons la quantitat de la ferida, i sumergis aquell en oli rosat, i posis-lo sobre la ferida; després pren altre drap doble o triple, sumerge'l en vi i oli rosat i posar-ho sobre un drap prim, i fa-ho tan lleugerament com puguis sobre aquest, sense gravar el ciphac; i finalment aplica-hi un liant gruixut, però no estrenyis aquest només per la quantitat que tinga la ferida.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	I deixeu-lo amb aquesta cura durant un dia o dos fins que esteu segur de l'apostema caut; després, retireu-ho i aplica-hi medicaments per evitar la siccitat excessiva, com ara raig d'oli de llinos i farina d'erba, pols d'henna i aristologia, i altres semblants.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.
