I també pots fer d'aquestes medines pols que s'hagin aplicat a la ferida de manera seca; i, generalment, aplica-hi tots els medicaments que tinguin la propietat d'aseure i no de morder.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	I mantingues la netedat de la ferida durant el teu tractament i no deixis que s'omple de suc o d'altres coses; i no deixis que es faci virulent a causa del teu tractament, perquè quan s'aplica sobre el panicul del cervell, es corromp i pot produir malaltia greu.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	I també pot ocórrer al ciphac del cap quan l'os és mondificat i més encara quan se'n fa el tractament; i si això passa, apareixerà una negror a la superfície d'aquest. En aquest cas, si s'han produït les accidents que hem mencionat abans, sabràs que ha estat un cas fatal.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas iii, e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	I si no s'hi ha produït negror, sinó només a causa de la medicina aplicada sobre ell, és per la virtut d'aquesta medicina que s'ha produït aquesta negror. En aquest cas, cal prendre una part de mel i tres parts d'oli rosat i barrejar-los amb un drap; després posar-lo sobre el ciphac i aplicar-hi especis de curació fins que s'hagi guarir.
Capitol .iii.	Capítol III
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	Quant al capítol III, parla de la restauració del nas quan es trenca. Es diu que si el nas es trenca per una caiguda o un cop, cal aplicar-li una cura immediata perquè no es produïsca una ferida profunda. Si això passa, s'ha de netejar la ferida amb aigua bullent i després es pot aplicar un liant fet amb mel i vi. També es recomana l'ús d'unes pinces per estirar els extrems trencats del nas fins que s'ajunten perfectament; després cal aplicar-hi una bèndiga feta de llana impregnada en oli d'oliva, i fixar-la amb un cotó. Finalment, es diu que cal esperar tres dies abans de retirar la bèndiga.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Has de saber que el nas no es trenca en dues parts alhora i més amunt, ni en una d'aquelles ocasions que es veuen, perquè té dos ossos. La partida esquerra és cartilaginosa i no es trenca; només hi ha atricció, tortuositat i sinuositad.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	però si es trenca una de les dues parts del nas, llavors cal introduir el dit petit dins del seu nas i empènyer l'os trencat amb el dit índex i el dit polze de fora, fins que el nas torni a tenir la seva forma natural.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	I cal fer això amb cura i evitant causar dolor al pacient.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	I si la trencada és a l'os més alt del nas i el dit petit no arriba fins allí, cal usar l'extremitat d'un ganxo de mida petita.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	I si la trencada afecta les dues parts del nas, llavors hauràs de fer el mateix que s'ha descrit anteriorment.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	Cal actuar amb rapidesa per a restaurar el nas en el primer dia després de la trencada, si és possible. Si no ho és, cal esperar fins que s'hagi resolt l'hematoma i aplicar un cataplasma càustic.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	"And then insert into the tip of the nose a cloth plug, if the fracture is in one part, or two cotton balls, if it is in two parts, and ensure that the cloth or cotton is thick enough to fill the passage of the nose."
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	"And some of the ancient restorers say that cotton balls should be wrapped in linen and changed throughout the day, but this is not visible to me; however it is necessary that the plug should be inserted into a piece of alum and powdered myrrh."
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	"And sometimes it is placed in the nose instead of cotton, a piece of linen wrapped around it; even if there is strong fracture and inflammation preventing inspiration."
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	"If this method is not necessary for you, then do as you wish, or use cotton balls instead."
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	"And if there occurs another time an abscess, plaster the nose with wax or fat melted in vinegar and rose oil, or with diacylon."
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	"But if there is no abscess formed, then you should plaster it from the outside with sesame flour and powdered myrrh mixed with alum; and also apply a piece of linen soaked in warm water over it, without ever washing the nose for any reason."
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	"But if the bones of the nose are broken with a small fracture or crushed, then it is necessary to split them and extract those that are convenient using appropriate instruments; afterwards stitch up the wound and treat it with something that incises and consolidates, along with appropriate plasters."
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	"And if there is inflammation inside the nose, then it should be treated with cotton balls and lead cannulae administered until it is completely healed."
Capitol .iiii.	"Chapter Four."
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	To restore the jaw when it is clenched.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	If the jaw is broken but the fracture does not extend across the entire length and is not displaced or fragmented inward, then its reduction will be easy.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	Therefore, if the fracture is on the right side, insert your left index finger into the patient's mouth and do likewise for the left side with your right index finger. Push the bone fragment gently inward with your finger until it aligns properly with the outer edge of the bone using your other hand.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the jaw fracture is already separated into two parts, then you must apply traction to both segments in a straight line until it is possible to achieve reduction.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if teeth are loosened or displaced due to the fracture, then strengthen those that you expect will break with a gold, silver, or copper wire. Then apply pressure on top of the broken jaw using cotton wool, folded linen, and a large sterilized gauze pad or a piece of wood cut to the length of the jaw. Then tie it securely in place according to your preference and the situation at hand, ensuring that it is not too tight as to cause further damage.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	Tell the patient to rest quietly, avoiding any movement of the jaw for about 10 days and to eat soft foods that do not require chewing.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	If you notice that the jaw's position has changed in any way after the reduction, then on the third day, carefully remove the splint and check if there is any alteration in the fracture site. Then pack it with iodoform gauze or plaster of Paris powder mixed with egg albumen or flour paste, ensuring to remove the cotton wool first. Finally, apply a bandage made of linen around the jaw.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And when the splint is securely attached and the position of the bone has not changed, leave it in place until the fracture has healed and strengthened. Often, this type of fracture takes about three weeks to heal completely.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if an abscess forms later on, then apply warm compresses frequently to the affected area until the abscess is drained and healed. You may also use hot saline rinses to help relieve pain and promote healing.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is comminuted (i.e., broken into multiple fragments), then determine whether there are any loose bone fragments or bone spicules present. If so, carefully remove them using appropriate instruments designed for this purpose.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	If the wound from the fracture is large, then you should widen it further with a curette or rongeur according to your needs. This will allow for better visualization of the fracture site and facilitate reduction.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And once you have removed any loose bone fragments, if there is still some debris present in the wound, then carefully clean it out. If the wound is large, pack it with gauze soaked in an antiseptic solution or a suitable dressing and apply a bandage to keep it in place until healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter Five
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	On the restoration of the clavicle when it is broken.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	The clavicle (collarbone) is often fractured near its midshaft and this fracture typically occurs in one of three patterns:
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	Broken or separated, or in two parts without accidents; it is easy to restore. Or thus: it occurs with accidents and is difficult to restore.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	In that case, when the fracture is without plague, you should have two ministers present: one to hold the assistant and follow the broken clavicle, and the other to extend the neck towards that part.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	And appropriately align the fracture with these said tongs so that it may be made according to its proper shape, and without prominence or concavity.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you need more extension, then it is necessary that you place on the skin of the patient's chest a compress made of cloth or wool, and its size should be according to your need; extend and raise the clavicle and compress the compress with your hand while aligning the fracture as needed.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot bring the end of the clavicle to the outside edges of the fragments, then it is necessary that the patient be raised up on their back and place a bolster made of cloth or wool under the shoulder muscle.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the assistant presses on the muscles at the fragments from below until the bone of the clavicle is raised up to its proper position; then you can correct the fracture and align it with the tongs mentioned earlier.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	But if you feel resistances from the clavicle and they are painful, then it is necessary that you cut over that area and remove those resistances with ease.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is retained in the bone, then you should perform an incision on it with one of the scalpel blades that you have prepared for this purpose, as you had placed over the clavicle the instrument called "cophac"; and this instrument is made of wood or iron, and its shape is like this:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it resembles a spoon whose concavity looks like this; and its width should be according to your need, according to the size of the bone or the prominence of it.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	But its length should be according to what is possible for you during the operation; that it has two extremities like this, and one extremity is wide and the other is narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the disruption of the skin wound that you made when removing the bone resistance is large and you are sure about causing an abscess, then you should approximate the two lips of the wound with suture.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the disruption is small or you fear causing an abscess, then you should fill the wound with dressings and powders according to the quantity of the wound opening.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if an abscess occurs, then you should take a cloth soaked in vinegar oil and rose oil and wine, and place it on that area.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	But the tightening of the bone when it is without skin and sectioned off is that you place a poultice made of wheat flour with egg white on it, and then place a lion's skin cloth over that, and then press the bolster from below the collarbone if necessary, and then take a long turban-like cloth used by Saracens that is one palm or around that in width; and then place doubled powders over the poultice and emplaster; and then take a thin table board whose width is three fingers and length similarly; and then wrap that with cloth, and then wrap that cloth with the board on the location of the fracture; and then apply humetate like this as it revolves, and then revolve that over the bone from below the collarbone to below the patient's armpit, and reduce it onto all fragments, and thus you will tighten the fracture by tightening downwards, and this is what you should not hide.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And all of that, make sure the board is not placed on top of the fractured bone; and for this reason it is important that you see the patient every day, so that when you notice that the bandage has softened or observe that the board has already moved out of place, then you should correct that and tighten the binding.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And then place the patient's sleep on the collarbone and place a small pillow below the armpit at night so that the elbow joint is elevated above that side, thereby elevating the clavicle fracture due to the elevation of the muscles, or else the arm should be tied to the neck.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not remove the bandage unless you see that it is healed without any wound or abscess, within twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And then renew the emplaster if you have seen signs of improvement in that area, and adjust it to fit the tightening and restore that and leave it until it has been restored and the clavicle fracture has coagulated.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And it is strengthened and comfortable in about twenty-eight days, although sometimes in some men it may take less time than that.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter .VI
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	On the restoration of a fracture of the shoulder blade.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	"The spatula was broken in the right side of his head, but it did not break him, only its edges."
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	"And therefore when the head of him is broken — and it is broken in the middle of his head — and not known except by touching, then according to what is the figure of the fracture, force the preparation of him and reduce that according to the natural figure in every way you can."
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	"And first apply powder of ground aloes with egg-white and stop the wound; then apply poultice of doubled cloth; and then apply a layer of subtle table salt according to the quantity of the whole spatula or a little more."
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	"But if the wound is concave in some places of the spatula, then you will fill that concavity with wax, and then apply the layer according to equality."
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	"And then strengthen it above with a long humid bandage with proper constriction and with firmness of the layer within that it may not be removed from its place."
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	"And consider the bandage every day; and whenever it is softened, change it again and strengthen it and equalize the layer if it has been removed from its place."
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	"And heal the wound on his own face."
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	"And the bandage is restored in 20 days or 25 days."
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	"And then when this number is completed, you will dissolve the bandage, and know for sure which are those bones of which the beginning was not touched nor their dissolution."
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	"And if you proceed to the place of the heavy bone and put down the shoulder, then cut upon it, drain it, and do according to what we have said in the fracture of the clavicle of separation of abscess if any occurs here."
Capitol .vii.	**Chapter VII**
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	**On the Restoration of Fractures of the Foot.**
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	"Sometimes the foot is broken in its middle part and then it becomes twisted; but the extremities of it are more often shattered and comminuted."
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	"And when the middle of the foot is broken, its accidents are that it declines towards the inner parts and there occurs great pain, difficulty in breathing, coughing, fever, and vomiting blood; and it is declared in the cavity of the broken bone and is not concealed from sensation."
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	"And its restoration is that the wound be elevated on its own back, and a bolster placed between its sole; and properly press the muscles of it, and adjust its sides with the aid of two boards, and perform the operation of it and equalization according to all manner that is possible and convenient for it, until the figure of the bone returns according to what is fitting."
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	"And then place over it a plaster and gauze, and place over that a thin slice of wood or linen or clay, and wrap that in cloth; and carefully apply that to the broken bone so that it is not moved; and bind it on the back sometimes with a round bandage, and strengthen it with proper constriction; and carefully consider the bandage at all times, and when it is softened, strengthen it."
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	"And if it is necessary to remove that bandage due to corruption or pressure or pain or abscess that occurs in the place, then carefully cut and loosen that and eradicate the plaster and correct that which has occurred there according to the manner of curing it; and then replace the plaster, sometimes changing its face; and adjust the constriction until it is healed."
Capitol .viii.	**Chapter VIII**
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	**On the Restoration of Broken Ribs.**
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	"Know that fracture of the ribs occurs only in thick places on the back, and their extremities at the front part are not subject to such injury except for those that are cartilaginous."
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	"And its recognition is not concealed from sensation by inquiry with them."
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	"And the reduction should be done thus: align the fracture with these [tools] in the most possible manner, until it is aligned as necessary. Then plaster and strengthen the broken bone with starch if needed."
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	"If the rib fracture is displaced inward, then it causes severe pain and puncturing, similar to what happens to someone who has been pierced. And because the bone presses on the lung's veil, it makes breathing difficult, coughing, and vomiting of much blood. This condition is difficult to treat."
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	"And already the Ancients used this for many purposes."
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	"And they said: whenever foods pause the sick person who generates inflammation and flatulence, so that the abdomen may be inflated and extended, then the fracture will be pushed outward."
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	"But we would not advise this because it could cause a wound infection if not done carefully. And if an infection has already occurred, then this method will not help."
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	"And some of them said that it should be paused from above with force and sucked out. And this is like reasoning, but nonetheless it is feared that the suction may draw the superfluities into the lungs due to weakness."
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	"And some of them said: whenever that place is covered with wool that has already been immersed in hot oil, and powders are paused between the ribs until it is filled up, then let the bandage be tied around as tightly as possible according to its roundness; and let the sick person be treated with food and medicinal cure for pleurisy."
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	"And if the sick person feels violent constriction that cannot be endured, and the bone pierces the lung's veil with painful punctures, then we fear for the sick person. Therefore, it is necessary to cut over that place, uncover the broken rib, and pause on top of it the instrument that preserves the cyphac, the memory of which has already been given, and gently chisel away the bone and remove it."
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	"And moreover, if the wound is large, let us join its edges together with stitching, and treat it with plasters until it is healed."
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	"And if an abscess occurs internally, then quickly and gently pour powders mixed with rose oil onto the place, pause it there, and let the sick person be treated with what is appropriate for internal abscesses."
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	"And let him lie on his back while sleeping until he is healed."
Capitol .ix.	Chapter ix.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On the restoration of fractures of the spine and neck.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Sometimes fracture occurs in the bones of the neck, and tartar forms on them, similarly to the spine of the back.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	"And when this happens to someone and you want to know if it will be healed or not, then consider: for if the sinews are already softened, stunned, deadened, and cannot be moved nor extended nor stretched, and when they are constricted with your fingers or pricked with a needle there is no pain felt in them, then you should know that it will not heal, and such conditions are mortal."
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	"And if they can be moved and feel constriction with your fingers or punctures, then you should know that the nape of the bone is saved and that the illness will improve with treatment."
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	"And if it looks similar to this in the spine of the neck, and you want to know whether it will be healed or not, then consider its weight."
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	"Therefore, if you find that the sinews are already softened, it is like what happens in the muscles. And moreover, when he lies on his back, there is difficulty breathing and excretion without his will, and sometimes he lies on his back and wants to urinate but cannot, then you should know that it is mortal, and therefore do not try to treat it."
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	"But if none of these causes occur, the cause is better and easier to treat."
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	"And the treatment for this is that you should perforate the seat of the internal abscess that has formed on the broken spine with rose oil alone, or mixed with mulled eggs; pause it there several times a day until the abscess is sedated."
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	"And then pause one of the comforting and exiting plasters on it, stretch it with linen; and command the sick person to use rest and tranquility and not to sleep on the part where he feels pain until he is healed."
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	"And if the inflammation of the bone becomes sagging or some cause is already separated from it, then it is necessary to cut over the backbone and remove that bone. And moreover, join the edges of the wound together with sutures if it is large; and moreover treat it with some incensory of herbs until it is healed."
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	"But if the end of the bone is broken off, and it is the end of the coccyx, then you should insert your left thumb into the anus, and grasp the broken bone with your other hand according to what is possible by equilateral grasping; and moreover pause an emplaster and astel on it, if necessary, and stretch it."
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	"And if you feel broken sagging bones in it, then cut over that and remove them, and treat the wound with the treatment described earlier until it is healed."
Capitol .x.	Chapter x.
De restauracio de la ancha.	On the restoration of the ankle joint.
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	"The bones of the ankles are easily broken, and when they break, their fracture is not other than communion at the ends of them and are inserted in the length and decline towards the inside. And it happens that the sick person feels pain and puncture in that place, and the ankle becomes stunned when there is a fracture."
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	"And the restoration of this is that you should stretch your hand over it until it covers the fracture which has the figure of it."
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	"And if the fracture is only at its end, then you should grasp it according to what seems equal to you by grasping until it fits with its natural figure."
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	"But if the fracture is in the length or has already declined towards the inside, then have the sick person lie on his stomach until you are ready to restore that fracture."
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	"And then when you have grasped it, pause an emplaster on it, and moreover pause a splint of wood or bone on it, and stretch it with great tightness so that there is no fear of puncture from fracture nor removal of the splint."
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	"And grasp the concavity with whatever fills it until that grasps takes on its proper tightness, and command the sick person to sleep on his back or on his side."
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	"But if an internal abscess forms, then cease the extension of it and its restoration until the internal abscess is sedated, and pause on it what sedates that according to what has been described earlier. And moreover return to restoring it and stretch it as much as necessary."
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	"And if the sagging bones or they are comminuted, then remove them."
Capitol .xi.	Chapter xi.
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	On the restoration of the fracture of the fibula.
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	"The fibula is that which is between the thighbone and the head of the shoulder."
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	"And if it is broken, then its restoration is in one of two ways. One way is that you should take a flat piece of wood with medium thickness like this:"
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	"And let there be tied at both ends two strips of linen, and moreover it should be suspended from the elevated place."
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	"And have the sick person sit on a chair, and then gently lay his broken arm on the wood so that it reaches its little head in the middle place where the curvature of the wood is attached."
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	"And then suspend some heavy weight on it, or let the assistant gently extend it towards its outer side. And then the doctor should carefully place the fracture together with his hands until the fracture returns to its proper place."
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	"The other method is to have the patient lie on their back and suspend the hand of their neck with a bandage. Then command two assistants, one of whom should hold what is above the fracture with their hands, and the other should hold them from below; each extending their part."
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	"And if you want the extension to be stronger, then stretch over the fracture with a bandage and over that another one. And each of the two assistants should extend their part."
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	"And if the fracture is close to the extremity of the bone, then half of the bandage should be placed over the joint and the other half below the fracture."
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	"And likewise if the fracture is close to the elbow, then the bandage should be placed over that spot and over that elbow."
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	"First of all it should be done with ease and without trouble; and immediately after, if it is tied correctly and applied properly, then stretch that bandage but avoid causing an abscess."
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	"But if an abscess occurs, then leave the bandage on for about seven days, and apply over it a compress made of thread soaked in vinegar and rose oil until the abscess reappears, and then stretch that bandage."
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	"And the way to stretch that bandage is as follows: apply a plaster over the fracture, and then apply a wrapping of wet cloth over the plaster; and also adjust the arm over that support, and place their hand wrapped in linen over their muscle."
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	"And apply the cloth and stretch it over that support for the arm so that the arm is in a still position; unless there is some cause preventing it due to the broken bone."
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	"And then use splints."
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	"And then apply over the fracture that splint which should be placed wider and stronger than the others. And place between each splint the width of a finger; and let the length of the splints be according to the fracture, adding three fingers on either side."
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	"And also stretch over the splints with the bandage which was mentioned at the beginning of this chapter."
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	"And then your bandage over the location of the fracture should be made tighter."
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	"And as the fracture becomes longer, so the bandage should be looser."
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	"Therefore, if you arrange the splints and bandage in that way as we have said at the time when you restore the limb to its proper position, then do so."
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	"And if you fear an abscess occurring, then leave the bandage and splints on for about seven days as we have said."
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	"And also consider the limb in all cases for three days so that no swelling or inflammation occurs there due to excess bandaging; otherwise, regulate the diet according to what we have said."
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	"But if you are worried that nothing will happen due to this, then do not remove the bandage but leave it on for at least three days or more."
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	"And let his sleep be on his back, and let his hands be placed over his stomach."
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	"And place over the elbow joint a pillow full of wool wrapped in linen. And keep watch at all times during the night or day to ensure that the figure of the broken limb is not displaced nor dissolved, and that the limb remains warm; otherwise, adjust it with your skill."
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	"And arrange the diet of the patient according to the order which we mentioned earlier. Thus, in the beginning the food should be subtle until it is time to begin stretching [the limb]; and then you must gradually increase the amount of food."
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	"As for the custom of removing the splint and changing the bandage, this should be done after forty days. And then it is necessary to remove them and administer baths and medications which heal that [injury]."
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	"If the fracture is already consolidated, then do not remove the bandage from that limb nor the splints for about one day or two months."
Capitol .xii.	"Chapter XII."
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	"Of the reduction of fractures of the arm."
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	"The arm is composed of two bones which are called the two elbow bones. Of these, one is small and it lies next to the thumb; the other is large and it lies above the little finger on the outer side."
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	"And sometimes only the larger elbow bone is fractured, or the smaller one, but often they are both broken together."
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	"And when the small elbow bone is fractured at its upper end, then its reduction will be easy and its healing will also be quicker."
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	"But when it [the small elbow bone] is fractured on the outer side, its fracture is severe and its healing difficult."
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	"And even worse than that is when both bones are broken together."
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	"Therefore, if the bone that is fractured is the small elbow bone at its upper end, then it is advisable for the physician to perform the reduction with ease and gentleness until that [bone] is completely reduced."
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	"But if it is the large elbow bone that is broken, then you must perform the reduction with greater force."
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	"And if both bones are broken together, then you must apply the traction much more forcibly."
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	"And you must keep the figure of the hand in its proper position during the reduction and traction, extending it upon a couch. And let the thumb be placed above all the other fingers, with the little finger below them, and let the patient lie on a pillow."
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	"And place a cushion in front of him at his head or feet so that he does not make any effort."
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	"And then the assistant should extend the arm from the outer side with one hand and hold it there with bandages; another assistant should do likewise above."
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	"And then the physician should gently reduce the bone until he brings it back to its best position."
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	"If there is any displacement of the bone in the fracture, then you must carefully reduce all the displaced fragments back into their proper position with your skill."
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	"If there appears during the reduction any separation of the fragments that pierces the elbow joint and you are not able to reduce it, then proceed as we have said above."
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	"But if the fracture is accompanied by a wound, I have already spoken about that in another chapter, and therefore I will not discuss its treatment here."
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort.	"And if an abscess forms at the beginning of your reduction, then you should take a piece of linen smeared with cerate made from rose oil and white wax, of medium thickness between thickness and thinness. Then stretch this linen over it with gentle pressure until the abscess yields. And then remove the cerate and apply a plaster prepared from powdered myrrh with a little honey; and then apply splints; and let the splint that is placed upon that fracture be wide and strong."
E sapias que·l nombre de las stelas del bras so vi en las majors disposicios, o sia la fractura en un focil o en dos focils ensemps.	"And know that the number of splints used for the arm is usually greater in the major positions, either when there is a fracture of one elbow bone or of both bones together."
E aprop pausa la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura pus fort e pus vehement, e quan mays sira la extrictura a las partidas desus de la fractura o a las partidas pus bassas de lu, pausa la strictura un pauc pus molh segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu en le comensament del capitol.	"And then apply the pressure upon the site of the fracture with great force and violence. And if you observe that the traction pulls more on the upper side of the fracture or on the lower side, then apply gentle pressure according to what is written at the beginning of this chapter."
E les draps que so envolopatz sobre la fractura sian draps mols humitz, e no sian durs ni aspres, e·l fiel am le qual es strenhut sia de li propriament migier entre subtil e gros, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	"And let the bandages wrapped around the fracture be soft and moist, not hard or rough. And let the linen with which it is stretched be of medium thickness between thinness and thickness, as we have recommended."
E considera le membre e·l liament aprop alcus dias.	"And observe the limb and the bandage for a few days."
E si accideys alcuna causa de la qual rectificacio es necessaria, ayssi cum prusiment le qual accideys al membre, e lahoras cove que tu enbroques le membre am aygua cauda entro que cesse aquel pruziment.	"And if any cause arises which requires correction, such as swelling in the limb, then you should immerse the limb in warm water until that swelling ceases."
E leysses le membre no costreyt entro que repause, e aprop torna la strictura.	"Then allow the limb to rest without being too tightly bound so that it may recover; and then apply traction again."
E si la extrictura ja es mollificada e l’os ja es remaugut e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras rectifiqua tot aquo am la tua vertut.	"When the extraction has softened and the bone is dislodged, appearing as such, then correct all this with your power."
E considera mays si le nutriment es prohibit pervenir al membre per superfluitat de strictura, quar lahoras cove que mollifiques aquel un petit e laysses aquel per alcus dias entro que corra ad aquel le nutriment, e aprop strenh aquel.	"If you find that nutrients are prohibited from reaching the limb due to excess stricture, then soften it a little and allow it to rest for a few days until proper circulation is restored. Then strengthen it."
Mays si al malaute no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no cove que sia desliat entro aprop xx dias o enviro de aquels.	"However, if the illness has not been caused by any of the conditions mentioned earlier, it should then be released within approximately 20 days or so around that time."
E aprop sia suspenduda la ma del malaute per la sua vertut de movement agitatius, e fay aquel dormir sobre le sieu dos.	"Then hang the limb of the patient with their own strength and move it agitatedly, and let them sleep on their back."
E sapias que aquesta fractura es restaurada en xxx dias o en xxxii dias, o fort leu es restaurada en xxviii dias, e tot aquo es segon la disposicio de las compleccios e las disposicios de la vertut.	"Know that this fracture takes 30 or 32 days to heal, but in some cases it heals in 28 days. All of this depends on the complexion and strength of the patient."
Capitol .xiii.	"Chapter XIII"
De restauracio de fractura de la pinche de la ma e dels ditz.	"On the restoration of fractures of the hand and fingers."
Sapias que a la pinche de la ma e als nuzes dels ditz tart endeve fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio motas veguadas.	"You should know that in the case of a hand pinch or nutcracker injury to the toes, it is not always fracture but often merely contusion."
E quan accideys a la ma fractura o atrissio, lahoras cove que·l malaute segua cayrat e denant lu lies cezent segon equalitat, e aprop pausa la ma de lu sobre aquela extenduda.	"And when it occurs with fracture or contusion, you should have the patient lie down and place their hand on that extended [arm] at shoulder height."
E aprop le ministre extenda les osses trencatz e·l metge engualhe aquels entro que sian congongitz am bona congoncio.	"The minister should then extend the broken bones, and the doctor should align them together with good alignment."
E lahoras cove que pause emplastre e estopa, si no accideys apostema caut; e aprop pausa stela desus segon la quantitat del loc, e tu ja has envolopada aquela en drap de li.	"And then you must apply a plaster and cotton, unless there is cauterization to prevent pus. Then place a splint on top according to the size of the location, and wrap it with linen."
Mays si la trincadura es en las partidas dedintz deves le ventre de la palma, e lahoras fay semblant de spera de drap, e comanda al malaute que strenha aquela am la sua palma trincada; aprop sia strenguda am drap lonc.	"But if the fracture is in the bones within the palm of the hand, you should make a bandage like a splint from cloth and tell the patient to press it with their clenched palm. Then wrap it tightly with cloth."
E sia la stelha de cuer am drap en le qual sia levitat, per so que le cuer sia aplicat a la palma; e strenh aquela segon que cove.	"And let the splint be made of leather covered in cloth to allow for elevation, so that the leather can adhere closely to the palm. Then bind it as needed."
Mays si la fractura es a las partidas defora, lahoras cove que pauses desus stela e autre estela de la partida dejos en la palma, per so que la ma sia uberta e dreyta; e aprop pausa la strictura, ayssi cum es revolvuda la ma a la rateta entre les ditz am liamentz.	"But if the fracture is on the outside of the hand, you should place splints above and below the joint of the fingers on the palm to allow the hand to be upright and straight. Then bind it as when wrapping a wrist between the fingers."
E si accideys fractura a alcu dels nozes dels ditz, lahoras si es le dit pous, sia engualat segon que cove e aprop sia strenhut am la palma e si·t voles, pausa a lu astela petita dreyta per so que sia elevada la fractura e no sia mauguda.	"And if there is a fracture in one of the knuckles, you should align it properly and bind it with the palm. And if desired, place a small splint on the outside to elevate the fracture and prevent movement."
Mays si la fractura es en les autres ditz, ayssi cum en aquel del mieg loc, o en le indic, o en le auricular, o en le anular, lahoras sia engualhat e liat am le dit sa le qual siec aquel; o sian totz liatz segon continuacio, e es milhor; o pausa sobre aquel stela petita, ayssi cum havem dit en le pous.	"But if the fracture is in another knuckle, such as that of the middle finger or the index finger, ring finger, or little finger, you should align it and bind it with the corresponding finger. Or they can all be bound continuously, which is better. Or place a small splint on top as mentioned for the thumb."
E considera, en la tua restauracio, e aprop aquela, la disposicio de apostema caut e oppose — am la tieua operacio — am aquo que cove quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, segon que es iterada la narracio de lu.	"And consider, in your treatment, the condition of the wound and its opposite side – with your operation – according to what is necessary when such causes arise, as described in this narrative."
Capitol .xiv.	"Chapter XIV."
De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	"On the Treatment of a Fracture of the Bone of the Thigh."
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	"The bone of the thigh is often fractured and it is felt when it becomes displaced at the articulation in front and the pus accumulates above."
E la restauracio de lu se fa enayssi que·l liament es strenhut sobre la fractura e autre liament dejos la fractura, e le malaute sia prostrat sobre le sieu ventre e sobre la cara.	"And its treatment is done in such a way that the muscle is bound above the fracture and another bandage is placed below the fracture. And the patient should be made to lie on their stomach and face down."
E aprop le ministre extenda tot le liament a la sua partida segon la qualitat, quan la fractura es en le mieg loc del os.	"And then the minister should extend all the muscles to their insertion when the fracture is in the middle of the bone."
Mays si es propdana a la razitz de la cueyssa, lahoras sia le liament propda al denolh a la partida del pentenilh, per so que la extencio caja en sus, e le autre liament dejos la fractura.	If the thigh is fractured, then bring the ligament close to the bone at the start of the penis, so that the extension goes downwards, and the other ligament leaves the fracture.
E semblantment si la trencadura es propdana al denolh, lahoras sia fayt le liament propda al denol, e sia la extencio a las partidas dejos.	Similarly, if the bone is fractured near the knee, then make sure that the ligament is close to the kneecap and the extension goes upwards.
E aprop le metge enguale le os am amduas las sieuas mas entro que reduzesca aquel segon la semblansa natural e l’os es conjungit per bona conjunccio; lahoras cove que pauses emplastre e strictura, si no accideys al membre apostema.	And then the doctor aligns the bone with both his hands so that it reduces naturally and the bone joins together in good union. Afterwards a plaster cast and bandage are needed to prevent swelling of the limb if there is no suppuration (pus formation).
Mays si accideys en lu apostema, lahoras tu layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que l’apostema caut sia cedat, e aprop retorna a la tua curacio.	But if pus forms then allow it to drain for several days until the inflammation has subsided and then return to your treatment.
La strictura de lu sia ayssi fayta: cove que envolopes sobre la fractura una benda dura, e dobla aquela dos o tres veguadas, e remaugua de lu superfluitat; e aprop envolopa la camba entro que pervengua al talo e a la razitz de la cueyssa.	The plaster cast should be made in this way: wrap a firm bandage over the fracture and fold it twice or three times, removing any excess material. Then wrap the leg so that it reaches the ankle and thigh.
E intromet lonc fiel entre la cueyssa e la camba prop del denol a las partidas dejos, e venguan las extremitatz del fiel de la partida pus sobirana de las doas partz, e aprop revolveys sobre la camba e la cueyssa aquo que superflueys de la benda.	Then insert a long strip of adhesive tape between the skin and the plaster cast near the knee joint. The ends of the tape should come out above the two parts of the fracture and then wind them around the plaster cast and leg to remove any excess bandage material.
E aprop pausa sobre la cueyssa en le loc de aquela fractura astelhas, e pausa de aquelas una stela sobre le os de la camba.	Then place a splint on the skin over the location of that fracture, and attach it with a safety pin to the bone of the plaster cast.
E aprop uempli las vacuitatz entre la camba e la cuoyssa am draps mols, per so que sia coagulada la extrictura.	Then fill in the spaces between the plaster cast and the skin with soft cloths, so that the bandage can set properly.
E aprop comensa am strictura fort del mieg sobre le loc de la fractura am tres envolucios o quatre, e quant mays tu te alonhas am liament del loc de la fractura, la tua strictura sia menor e pus leugiera e pus molha.	And then start with a firm bandage on the middle of the fracture location with three or four turns. The more you wrap around the fracture site, the tighter and stronger the plaster cast will be. But also make sure it is not too tight or too loose, but rather comfortable and moist.
E aprop exten a doas extremitatz del fiel a las partidas dejos entro que pervengua a la cavilha del pe, e strenh amdoas las extremitatz de las stelhas del autra part per so que·l liament no sia remaugut del sieu loc.	Then extend both ends of the adhesive tape to the foot and ankle on either side until it reaches the heel of the foot. Then fasten both ends of the safety pin to prevent any movement or slipping of the splint from its position.
E aprop leyssa la strectura sobre aquel, don esta ayssi que no accideys al membre corrosio ni apostema caut ni emflacio e semblantz ad aquels; e si accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, adonc cueta te am desliament de lu, e rectifica aquo que accideys tot aprop, segon que havem dit motas veguadas.	Then leave the plaster cast on until it sets properly, making sure that there is no rubbing or irritation of the skin, nor any inflammation, swelling, or redness. If any of these symptoms do occur, then remove the plaster cast immediately and correct whatever has caused them, following the steps outlined above several times.
Mays si en le os es pessa del os la qual pongua, lahoras cove que tu engualhes aquel segon que a tu es possibla; e sino, fen sobre lu e remau aquel, e cura am aquo del qual es precedida la rememoracio entro que sia sanat.	If there is any pressure on the bone that causes pain during movement, it is important to try and relieve that pressure as much as possible. If this is not possible, then place a pad over that area and remove any excess plaster cast material that may be causing discomfort. Then follow the steps outlined previously for treating a fracture until it has healed properly.
E alcunas veguadas es strenhuda aquesta fractura de la coyssa otra aquo que sian ajustadas a lu stelhas, ayssi cum havem dit en le adjutori e·n le bras.	Sometimes the plaster cast on the thigh may cause pressure on the fracture site. If this happens, then make sure to adjust the safety pins on both sides of the plaster cast as described in the previous instructions for treating a fractured arm.
Mays empero en la restauracio de lu en tal manieyra fayta no accideys al malaute claudicacio; e si es restaurada sola, otra aquo que li sia applicada l’autra camba, lahoras es necessari que claudique aquel del qual es tostemps.	However, when treating a fracture in this way, it is important not to cause any limp or hobbling. If the plaster cast is applied incorrectly and the patient has trouble walking after the treatment, then it may be necessary to apply another plaster cast on top of the first one to help stabilize the leg during rehabilitation.
E sapias que la coyssa es strenhuda en xl dias o un pauc mes o un pauc mens, e tot aquo es segon la diversitat de las compleccios e de las autras dispozicios.	You should know that the plaster cast remains on for about 40 days or a bit more or less depending on the complexity and other factors of the fracture.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV
De restauracio de la fractura de la rodela del denolh.	On the treatment of fractures of the jawbone.
Sapias que fractura de la rodela del denol tart endeve, mays accideys a lu motas veguadas atrissio.	You should know that fractures of the jawbone are quite common and often occur due to trauma or blows to the face.
Mays si accideys a lu fractura, lahoras no es sino fissura o trauc en las suas partidas, e aquo es am plagua o ses plagua, e sobre aquo tot es estat am le sentiment.	"Yet if it happens that he has a fracture, then it is but a crack or break in his bones, and this is accompanied by pain or no pain, upon which all depends."
E la restauracio de lu es enayssi que sia engualat aquo que es romput de las partidas de lu am les ditz entro que sia agreguat e conjongit segon que es possible per equacio e facilitat e fabricacio.	"And the restoration of it is attempted by placing that which is broken of his bones with the said intestines being united and joined together as much as possible, according to what is easy, simple, and convenient."
E aprop pausa emplastre e pausa sobre aquel stela redonda, si indigeysses de aquela; e strenh desus am strictura ad aquo convenient.	"And then apply plaster and dressing over that round stone wound if necessary; and strengthen it with a bandage according to what is appropriate."
E aprop considera totas las disposicios las quals havem recomtadas en las autras fracturas, ayssi cum es apostema caut e semblant ad aquels enaissi que se oppause a tot accident am aquo que a lu es convenient entro que sia sanat.	"And consider all the methods which we have recommended in other fractures, thus as with caution and similar care to those, so that it may be applied to every accident according to what is convenient for him, until he is healed."
Capitol .xvi.	"Chapter XVI."
De restauracio de la fractura de la camba.	"On the restoration of a fracture of the humerus."
Sapias que en la camba so dos osses dels quals la un es gros, e es le nompnat per nom de la camba; e l’autra es subtil, e es nompnat focil.	"You should know that in the arm there are two bones of which one is thick and is called by the name of the arm, and the other is slender and is called the radius."
E accideys a quascus de las specias de fractura aquo que accideys als dos osses del bras, e per aquo es fayta restauracio de lu ayssi cum restauracio del bras engualment, e la operacio de lu es una.	"And it happens that in some species of fracture the two bones of the arm are affected, and for that reason restoration is made of it just like restoration of the arm altogether, and the operation of it is one."
E si so trincatz dos osses ensemps, la camba es convertida a totas partidas.	"And if the two bones are broken together, the humerus becomes completely disjointed."
E si es trinquat le os pus subtil, la camba es convertida a las partidas Denant.	"And if only the slender bone is broken, the arm remains articulated at the front."
E si es trincat le os pus gros, atrobas aquel dejos, e es de aquelas causas que no so a tu ameguadas.	"And if only the thick bone is broken, it remains attached to that of below and it is one of those causes which are not easily restored."
E aprop aministra extencio e equacio e liguacio de las astelas segon aquel engualment.	"And therefore apply extension, traction, and bandaging of the fragments according to what is appropriate in this case."
Mays empero cove, si la fractura de la camba es laja havent motas satagias, que la extencio sia mendre e pus leugiera, e alleuja am la tua vertut.	"But it happens that if the fracture of the humerus is old and there have been many attempts, then extension should be less and gentler, and alleviate with your skill."
E en la camba es alcuna causa de operacio sobre le bras, e es quan tu engualas las stelhas e que comples tota la tieua operacio, lahoras tu prendras pessas de fustz de pi le qual es pausat dejos las cauzas las quals so pausades en solies, e so faytas eyssament de brancas de palma; aligeys de aquelas a las quals es petita groceza, e no sia ges de las manudas, e sia la longuesa de aquelas segon la longuesa de la camba, e del denol entro al pus dejos.	"And in the humerus there is one cause for operation on the arm, and this is when you uncover the fragments and complete all your operation, then you will take pieces of wood from the trunk of a tree which has been placed below the causes which are placed beneath it, and made similarly from branches of palm; choose those which have little thickness, and let them not be thick ones, and let their length be according to the length of the humerus, and from one end to the other."
E aprop envolopa sobre quascuna drap en doas envolucios segon la longitut de lu, e pausa la una sobre la partida de la camba de la una part e l’autra del autra part, e sian del denol entro al pus bas loc del pe.	"And then apply on each splint two wrappings according to its length and place one on the fracture of the humerus on one side and the other on the other side, and they should extend from one end to the other."
E aprop lias las doas stelhas en tres locs de doas extremitatz e al mieg loc, quar am aquesta strectura la camba es prohibida de clinar a la partida dextra e sinistra, e sta per bona stacio.	"And then bind the two fragments in three places at both extremities and in the middle, because with this structure the humerus is prevented from bending to the right or left, and this is good stability."
E ja es aministrat un brasset de fust segon la longuesa de la camba; e sia pausada en lu la camba per so que conserve aquel de movement.	"And then apply a splint of wood according to the length of the humerus, and let it be placed on it so that it conserves its movement."
E majorment cove que tu fassas aquo en fractura, e quan am aquela es plagua propriament.	"And more importantly you should do this in fracture, especially when it is properly reduced."
E aprop considera en quascun jorn la camba e studia am aquel per derier studi, e tu le guardes de apostema e de imflacio o de autres causas semblantz; e cum accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, lahoras opausa te a lu am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	"And also consider each day the humerus and study it carefully, and you guard it from hematoma and inflammation or other similar causes. And whenever any of these occurs, then apply what is necessary until it is healed."
Capitol .xvii.	"Chapter XVII."
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	Of the fracture of the heel bone and bones of the foot.
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	The heel bone has not occurred fracture at all; but fractures of the bones of the foot have happened some times; and those of the foot rarely happen, and do not occur except attrition in the joints of position.
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant.	And if fractures happen to the bones of the foot and some of these bones become elevated above themselves among them, then the patient places their foot on the ground prepared in such a way that they can walk.
E aprop pausa la un pe sobre aquo que es elevat de aquels osses, e aprop calca aquels, e prem, e engualha aquels entro que torno en los locs.	And around they pause the one foot on what is elevated of those bones, and around they press them, compressing and squeezing them until it returns to its place.
E aprop pausa emplastre e stopa desus, e pausa dejos le ventre del pe una petita taula a la qual sian dos caps plas.	And around they apply plaster and bandages on top, and place under the belly of the foot a small table with two flat heads.
E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	And around they stretch that member with the foot downwards, because thou hast enveloped it with cloths and for other reasons which thou shalt indicate.
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	And when three or four days have passed, then thou dost untie the bandage, for thou shalt find the bones squeezed together, or pinched, or dislocated, and the operation in those is thus known.
Mays si alcus ditz son trincatz, lahoras restaura aquels, e enguala aquels ayssi cum yeu e recomtat a tu en la restauracio dels ditz de la ma.	But if some of them are pinched together, then thou dost restore them and squeeze them thus with oil, and recoat them according to what thou shalt learn in the restoration of these bones of the hand.
